story:
I am recording 9 songs for a new album/CD release.  The project is called Color Wheel and will feature 7 new original songs.  This is my third CD.  The other 2 (Grace and Elbow Grease, released end of 2013 and Transitions released at the end of 2011) I financed myself but this one I need your help to complete.

During 2015, I went through some big changes in my life personally and spent a lot of time writing, reflecting and honing my musical skills.  That process and time has resulted in some new songs that are a departure for me musically and that I am very proud of.

I am working with amazing musicians who are also my friends.  I have known them and worked with them for a few years now.  We have similar spirits and connect on many levels. We are trying to be the best human beings we can be not just the best musicians. The Core Four are Ben Wisch, 2 time grammy award winning producer and keyboard/piano player, Eugene Ruffolo, one of the top NYC singer/songwriters is playing acoustic guitar and singing background vocals, and George Naha, who is my co-writer and one of the tastiest electric guitar players, and myself.  In addition to the Core Four, Zev Katz is on bass and Chris Marshak is on drums and percussion. Jonathan Preddice plays cello on 3 of the songs as well.

I have already recorded most of the tracks for the songs but still have a lot to go.  We, The Core Four, have been recording the tracks live.  You can feel the energy between us.  We are all in one room together… we make magic and it is really fun too!  After that, bass and drums are added… and a guest artist or so.

The money raised will be used to finish recording the tracks (musicians, mixing, studio time), mastering the project, manufacturing the CDs and the Vinyl LPs, distribution, radio promotion in both the US and Europe.

story:
Vic Volare's 
Fabulous Bidecennial Extravaganza!

Celebrating 20 years of Legendary Singin’ and Swingin’

Saturday June 11th at the Parkway Theater 

Doors open 6:30 Show starts at 7:00 

Tickets start at $15 in advance $18 at the door

The show features a parade of all stars such as:

The voice talents of  Eric Webster

Magician David Harris

Soul Diva Kendra Glenn

Swing Songstress Charmin Michelle

Piano man extraordinaire Larry McDonough

Belfast Cowboys front man Terry Walsh

And of course Legendary Twin Cities Crooner Vic Volare

Backed up by the  Volare Lounge Orchestra 

and Big Band

I don’t know how else to say this but….It’s kind of a big deal.

Sign up for tickets today. If you can’t make it then be a part of the magic and sign up for perks to get some Swingin' Swank Swag.  


Click link to skip all perks and just buy tickets: 

www.vics20thtickets.com

Hey there! Thanks to you I've been performing as Vic Volare for 20 years. I've dedicated myself to playing the mid century modern music of the Rat Pack Era with all my heart and soul and your support has made it possible. Here is a video with footage from the Front back in 1996 or 97.


You can see the scene was electric! As a show of thanks to the thousands of V.L.O. fans, on Saturday June 11th I'm going to have a Fabulous Bidecennial Extravaganza at the Parkway Theater to celebrate those 20 years. Along with my smooth vocal stylings, the F.B.E. will feature magicians, singers, and big band with over 20 other musicians who have performed with me over the years. With such a cavalcade of talent the costs really add up. Even if the venue sells out it's difficult just to break even. I need your help to make the F.B.E a success!

Here's what you can do:

  • GO TO THE SHOW! Pic a Show Go Perk and enjoy the F.B.E.
  • Pic a NO GO Perk   Can't be there but want to be part of the F.B.E. dream
  • BRAG ABOUT YOURSELF!  YOU are a part of the 20 years and still swingin' legacy that is the VOLARE NATION!  The world of Facebook, twitter, Instagram and whatever social media you prefer needs to know this information. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5,000 to fund the production. The money will go directly to pay: 

  • the performers
  • venue rental
  • Big Band music and stands
  • set production
  • promotional expenses

What you get will vary according to how much you give. 

There are loads of swanky goodies from the Volare archives just waiting for you. Scroll through and find which one suits you best. speaking of suits you may want to direct your to the WEAR VIC"S SPARKLE JACKET Perk. Over the years hundreds perhaps even thousands have requested to wear Vic's Sparkle Jacket. The answer has always been "NO"....Until now! This is your only chance to take advantage of this once in a lifetime opportunity!


Risks & Challenges

There are only a limited number who can attend the event. Also there will be those who want to be there but can't. Even with the modest $15 advanced ticket price,  a full house will not cover the production costs. With this campaign it will let those who are able to attend a chance to get a little gift for giving more and those unable to attend a chance to contribute to the production.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word! Share this with friends you think would enjoy it.
  • Sign up for the mailing list at www.vicvolare.reverbnation.com
  • Follow me on Twitter and Facebook etc. 

Thanks for your consideration. As a show of thanks here's a little Gem from Vic in 1996. Yes there's such a lot of livin' to do!


Here is another video from that same session. It was recorded in October of 1996 for the cable access show TC MUSIQUE. This version of the classic song Fever went on my first cd and actually got some radio play on KLBB AM 1400.

story:
Hi. My name is Mike Dubose and I'm the singer-songwriter-guitarist of Mike Dubose and The Dissidents, along with bassist Diana Bruschke, drummer Susie Martinez and guitarist Tom Cuddy.

We are a rock n' roll band from Austin, TX with over 120 collective years of playing music professionally. This is the best band I've played with in my 20 years as a professional musician.

Our record label ran out of money to release our EP so we're doing it on our own, but we lack the money to do it right. This EP needs to come out, both to capture the elusive, almost magical musical and personal chemistry that we possess. It also needs to make the largest mark on the world as possible. Finally, we need to release this EP in order to tour the US, Europe and beyond. $50K is our funding goal. That sounds like a lot, but it isn't. Studio time is $15K, mastering the EP is $3K, distribution and manufacturing is $2K, PR is 5K, getting the record to radio is $5K, tour support (renting vans/motorhomes/buses/whatever is available, airline tickets to Europe, food, lodging, emergencies) is 10K, purchasing/renting non-vintage instruments, amplifiers and recording equipment to capture our live shows is $10K. 

We have lots of tokens of appreciation for you: signed copies of the EP, signed posters, limited-edition T-shirts, Mike Dubose and The Dissidents dog tags, playing a show in your garage or backyard, unreleased material, all the way up to executive producer credit for the EP. 

If we don't reach our goal, the funds will be disbursed to the EP regardless. If we have a surplus after we've toured as many places we can, the rest will be donated to charity. 

Nobody can predict the future and nothing goes personally. This IS a risky venture. I am certain of one thing: this EP could underperform expectations, but it will make a large splash. We will encounter unexpected obstacles, but we have a cadre of advisers that will help us overcome them. If the advisers can't help us with a financial obstacle, that's what a credit card is for! 

If you believe in independent music, giving as much as you can helps independent music destroy the puerile major labels, whether or not you believe in our band (if you DO we love you!) So your contribution impacts independent artists as a whole. We understand that some people can't afford to give. That's OK, you can still help us by sharing this with everyone you know! 

Much love - 

Mike, Diana, Susie and Tom

BIG LEAGUE DREAMS TOUR 2016

                     A LIVE TOUR OF ALL 30 MAJOR LEAGUE STADIUMS


THIS SUMMER BALLPLAYER NETWORK PRESENTS A LIVE INTERACTIVE TOUR OF ALL 30 MAJOR LEAGUE BASEBALL STADIUMS.


JOIN BASEBALL HOST MATT GARRINGER AND FRIENDS AS THEY TAKE YOU ON A LIVE INTERACTIVE BASEBALL ADVENTURE ACROSS AMERICA TO VISIT ALL 30 STADIUMS CELEBRATING THE TEAMS, CULTURE, LIFESTYLE, ATTRACTIONS, AND PERSONALITIES THAT MAKE UP AMERICA’S GREATEST PASTIME.

PRESENTED BY

BALLPLAYER NETWORK

HOSTED BY

MATT GARRINGER & FRIENDS

STARRING SPECIAL GUESTS, CELEBRITY PLAYERS, COACHES AND MORE

A LIVE INTERACTIVE BASEBALL SERIES

BIG LEAGUE DREAMS TOUR 2016 IS A LIVE INTERACTIVE BASEBALL SERIES HOSTED BY MATT GARRINGER AND FRIENDS THAT WILL TAKE FANS ACROSS AMERICA TO ALL 30 STADIUMS CELEBRATING THE TEAMS, CULTURE, LIFESTYLE, ATTRACTIONS AND PERSONALITIES THAT MAKE UP THE GAME. JOIN LIVE BROADCASTS AND INTERACT WITH SPECIAL GUESTS, CELEBRITY PLAYERS, LEGENDARY COACHES AND MORE. CONTRIBUTORS RECEIVE DISCOUNTS ON LIMITED EDITION TOUR MERCHANDISE INCLUDING BASEBALL RELATED GEAR, PERFORMANCE TRAINING TOOLS AND APPAREL.

THIS PROJECT WAS INSPIRED BY THE DREAM TO TAKE YOU AND ALL OUR FRIENDS WITH US TO EVERY MAJOR LEAGUE BASEBALL STADIUM. 

BIG LEAGUE DREAMS TOUR 2016 IS A LIVE INTERACTIVE BASEBALL SERIES THAT ALLOWS YOU, OUR FRIENDS, TO JOIN US LIVE FOR THE ULTIMATE BASEBALL ADVENTURE INCLUDING EXCLUSIVE ACCESS TO LIVE BROADCASTS AND VIP EVENTS, CELEBRITY HOSTED PARTIES, MEET-UPS AND COMPETITIONS.

PERKS

WE ARE OFFERING LIMITED EDITION SWAG AS THANK YOU TO OUR BACKERS. WE HAVE LOTS IN STORE FOR OUR BACKERS AND SPONSORS AND THOSE THAT ARE READY TO ROCK AND JOIN US WITHIN THE FIRST WEEK OF LAUNCH WILL BE ENTERED TO WIN RARE BASEBALL COLLECTIBLE.

POWERED BY BALLPLAYER NETWORK

BIG LEAGUE DREAMS TOUR 2016 IS PROUDLY PRESENTED BY THE BALLPLAYER NETWORK, BASEBALLS LEADING SOCIAL NETWORK AND BROADCAST LIVE VIA YOUTUBE, INSTAGRAM, PERISCOPE AND SELECT SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. 

JOIN US ON TOUR AND MAKE HISTORY. GET FEATURED ON BALLPLAYER NETWORK AND REACH MILLIONS OF BASEBALL FANS AND INFLUENCERS.

FUNDINGER

THANKS TO BALLPLAYER NETWORK MOST OF OUR FUNDING NEEDS TO MAKE THIS SERIES A REALITY HAVE BEEN PROVIDED FOR. WE ARE SEEKING ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO MAKE THIS THE BIGGEST PARTY WE CAN AND THAT MEANS MEETING UP WITH YOU IN YOUR CITY!!! JOIN US TODAY AND RECEIVE YOUR OFFICIAL ALL ACCESS PASS TO MEET-UPS, COMPETITIONS, CELEBRITY HOSTED EVENTS, VIP PARTIES AND MORE !!

          BIG LEAGUE DREAMS TOUR 2016 BUDGET OVERVIEW

                             

SPONSORSHIP

REACH MILLIONS OF BASEBALL FANS LIVE THROUGH BALLPLAYER NETWORK
CONTACT: BALLPLAYERNETWORK@GMAIL.COM

story:
About M. Lockwood Porter

I'm M. (Max) Lockwood Porter, an Americana/folk singer-songwriter based out of Berkeley, CA, but originally from Skiatook, OK.

I've been recording and performing as M. Lockwood Porter for 3 1/2 years. In that time, I've toured all over the US, played over 200 shows, supported acts like David Wax Museum, Clap Your Hands Say Yeah, American Aquarium, John Moreland, Lee Bains III & The Glory Fires, Samantha Crain, and David Ramirez, and released two albums that have gotten critical acclaim in the Americana/folk world. Most importantly to me, I've received a humbling and overwhelming amount of support from family, friends, and fans, and I've met a lot of amazing people along the way.

In October 2014, I released my second full-length album 27 on Black Mesa Records (US) and Hidden Trail Records (UK) to very positive reviews:

"27 is a solid album worth your time, attention, and money." - No Depression

"All in all a tremendous album." - Blabber 'n' Smoke

"M. Lockwood Porter’s 27 is one of the best records of the year. It's an absolutely amazing collection of songs." - Captains Dead

"Take care with M. Lockwood Porter. He is an important singer-songwriter" - Americana UK

About The Album

I've been writing the songs for my next record for the past 16 months, and I think that they're some of the best songs I've ever written. I've grown a lot in the past few years, and I've challenged myself to expand my subject matter. This record won't just be about me - it will be about the culture and world that we all live in, and about bringing people together to try to make it a little better.

I'm raising money to pay for the recording, mixing, mastering, pressing, and promotion of the album. I'm very proud of my first two records - both of which were recorded on shoestring budgets - but I did nearly all of the promotion for these albums myself. If I meet my fundraising goal, I'll be able to not only make this record, but to have a robust promotional campaign as well.

I've put together a set of perks that I hope will demonstrate some small portion of my gratitude for your support. Take a look, and see if any of them catch your eye.

I'm really excited to start making this record, and to have you all involved in it. Thank you so much for all of your support!

Max

story:
Short Summary

   Hey, dudes! Thank you for checkin out our project! We are super stoked to be gearing up to record at Montrose in RVA with producer Adrian Olsen of Avers! We're also booking a summer tour and shooting a new music video! There's just one thing. We need your help! There's nothing we want more than to put our new record in your hands...

What We Need & What You Get

   We need cash to pay off studio time, mixing, mastering, album art design, and printing! We've got a lot of super rad swag and gestures to say THANK YOU for your contribution! Digital downloads, records, tee shirts, a song written in your honor, sexy Pablo head shots and MUCH more! If we don't reach our goal, we'll still be SO very grateful for your donation! All the proceeds will go to the recording process and we'll just stretch it as far as we can!

The Impact

   Shagwüf is a rare beast. As a psychedelic, hard rock band we have SO much love for each other, the music, the road and our fans. We simply want to make killer music to share around the world. Por favor, let us make cool stuff for you! 

   We've worked really hard on writing new material and getting our ducks in a row to crush this project. It's been a year since we released our little lo-fi EP "Heavy Petting". As endearing as those garage recordings are, we have so much more to reveal. We've grown exponentially as writers, musicians & performers. We are ready to go full out wild on you and show you all that Shagwüf has to offer the universe. Together, we can make this dream a reality.

Challenges

   We realize this is a lot to ask. It's hard times for every one. The truth is, we want to give you something special. We want to be partners with you. Any amount large or small, means the world to us. Every little bit counts. We've got a lot of work cut out for us but it will be SO worth it in the end. Nothing can put a price on the final outcome. Hopefully, that'll be a stellar record in your hands (enclosed with our blood sweat and tears). A brand new smokin' music video. And your friends on the road, playing music and spreading the record that YOU contributed to! Rad right?!

Other Ways You Can Help

   Don't have a few bucks? No worries, man! You can still help us out by spreading the word! Tell your friends! Use the Indigogo share tools! Word of mouth! And please don't hesitate to post frequently. Remember, it's a good cause. In the words of Bowie, "We could be heroes!".

***WOW! We've been a band for two years this May! Click here to see what we've been doing...***
story_txt:
Short Summary    Hey, dudes! Thank you for checkin out our project! We are super stoked to be gearing up to record at Montrose in RVA with producer Adrian Olsen of Avers! We're also booking a summer tour and shooting a new music video! There's just one thing. We need your help! There's nothing we want more than to put our new record in your hands...
What We Need & What You Get
   We need cash to pay off studio time, mixing, mastering, album art design, and printing! We've got a lot of super rad swag and gestures to say THANK YOU for your contribution! Digital downloads, records, tee shirts, a song written in your honor, sexy Pablo head shots and MUCH more! If we don't reach our goal, we'll still be SO very grateful for your donation! All the proceeds will go to the recording process and we'll just stretch it as far as we can!
  The Impact

   Shagwüf is a rare beast. As a psychedelic, hard rock band we have SO much love for each other, the music, the road and our fans. We simply want to make killer music to share around the world. Por favor, let us make cool stuff for you! 

   We've worked really hard on writing new material and getting our ducks in a row to crush this project. It's been a year since we released our little lo-fi EP "Heavy Petting". As endearing as those garage recordings are, we have so much more to reveal. We've grown exponentially as writers, musicians & performers. We are ready to go full out wild on you and show you all that Shagwüf has to offer the universe. Together, we can make this dream a reality.   Challenges    We realize this is a lot to ask. It's hard times for every one. The truth is, we want to give you something special. We want to be partners with you. Any amount large or small, means the world to us. Every little bit counts. We've got a lot of work cut out for us but it will be SO worth it in the end. Nothing can put a price on the final outcome. Hopefully, that'll be a stellar record in your hands (enclosed with our blood sweat and tears). A brand new smokin' music video. And your friends on the road, playing music and spreading the record that YOU contributed to! Rad right?!
    Other Ways You Can Help    Don't have a few bucks? No worries, man! You can still help us out by spreading the word! Tell your friends! Use the Indigogo share tools! Word of mouth! And please don't hesitate to post frequently. Remember, it's a good cause. In the words of Bowie, "We could be heroes!".
***WOW! We've been a band for two years this May! Click here to see what we've been doing...***

story:
Short Summary

I am ready to begin my third project.  It has been a rewarding journey that God has allowed me to travel.  As many of you know, I have been singing since the age of 13.  I have financed all of my projects as an indie artist.  It hasn't been easy, but it has been rewarding.  I was recently diagnosed with multiple sclerosis but my faith has not wavered.  God allowed me to know that it was time to do my third CD, but I will need help from all of my friends and family.  This project will be an EPIC one.  The songs on this CD will be ones that will touch your soul.  Many of my fellow musicians will share in that moment to spread the Gospel with true sincerity. You can be a part of helping me create a project that will touch the lives of millions of people throughout Gods great universe.  Together we can impact the world.  You have my love and prayers for helping me to make this possible.  To God Be The Glory.

What We Need & What You Get

The Total Cost of the Project: $10,000.00

  • Studio Time @ $55 per hour
  •  85 hours for 10 songs = $4,675.00
  • 8.5 hours per song
  • Hiring musicians for session
  • Hiring of Background vocals for session
  • travel
  • mixing/mastering of project
  • Duplication of project
  • $25 Autographed CD once released
  • $100 contribution, you will receive a free CD and Tshirt and 2 VIP passes to CD release Concert
  • $500 contribution, you will receive a free CD, Tshirt and 4 VIP passes to CD release Concert
  • $1,000 contribution, you will receive a free CD, Tshirt and 8 VIP passes to CD release concert
  • $5000 contribution, you will receive a free CD, T shirt and 10 VIP passes to CD release concert and your name will appear in the credits on the CD as well as all marking material for CD release concert

The Impact

I am launching this campaign because many people have expressed wanting to support my ministry.  I am not a preacher, but as many of you know my ministry are the songs I sing.  The passion that lies within me is music and you can help me share this gift like never before.

  • This project is of value because many people go from day to day discouraged wondering how they are going to make it.  This music will help many who have lost hope be encouraged and regain confidence to go on.
  • I need your help to make this a reality.  TOGETHER WE CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest Challenge in recording, is not having the right people to make not just a good project but a great one.  Every time I've recorded, it has gotten better.  With that in mind, God has blessed me, having over twenty years of experience in the music business to have met some awesome musicians, singers and producers making this a fail safe project.  I have the right people to make a Great project.To God Be The Glory.

Other Ways You Can Help

There may be some of you who cannot make a monetary contribution but you can pass the word on to someone who can or you can make a small contribution of $25.00 and you will receive an autograph CD.  If you cannot make a monetary contribution, your prayers are invaluable and much appreciated.

story:
A Vehicle for Collaboration

Dave Good is building a mobile production apparatus and he needs your help. Once constructed "The Dave Good Show" will travel America bringing astute audiences and brilliant artists together. These shows and film festivals will take place in open spaces in mostly natural but sometimes urban environments. Shows will include combinations of music, cinema, dance, storytelling, comedy and other art forms. All equipment required will be contained inside Dave's mobile production apparatus. 

Who is Dave Good?

Dave Good is a legendary heretic and live show producer. He was mentored by one of the best crews in the world (Walker Art Center) and has worked on an astounding array of shows. He received a production credit on a Merce Cunningham/Charles Atlas movie at The Whitney Biennial. He's hugged several of The Dap Kings. He's done customer service for Steve Martin. His dad fixed Billy Joel's teeth. Few people in this world care more about audiences and artists than Dave. He's been working on this particular show concept for about 15 years. It's been a long time coming but plenty of qualified taste makers have confidently awaited a tour de force. This is it.

How will he spend this money?

Dave will buy a unique travel trailer for $5000 and spend $2500 renovating it. He will then buy a used truck to tow it for $12,000 and bank and extra $2500 for future repairs. He'll spend about $2000 on mics, speakers, chairs, tents, a projector etc. And then $1000 on incidental expenses and marketing costs.
Add that all up and you get 25k.

How will he pay the artists?

With a membership program. Think of The Dave Good show like Costco but for festivals. Members will get preferred access to all events and their fees will create a low cost experience. Food and drink will be cheap. Non-members can either sign up on site or pay a little extra to compensate. Artists, Non-Members and Members will be taken care of at a museum quality level.


HOW BIG IS THIS THING GOING TO GET?

Big. Really big.

What do I get if contribute?

Perks start at $5 and go up to $23,000. All kinds of cool custom stuff and opportunities for epic experiences. Dave will even rescue a dog. Much like a rescue dog, if you help Dave Good with his show, he will be loyal for life.


What if I'm rather broke and I still really want to help?

Well then you are a lot like Dave. Tweet it share it love it repeat it. Trust me helping will feel fantastic. Whatever you can do set Dave free. All he wants is to make a more beautiful and inspiring world. 
(Also, let's be honest, nearly all of us have a spare 5 bucks.)


WHY DO I FEEL SO WARM AND FUZZY ALL OF A SUDDEN?

Welcome to The Dave Good Show. Let's build it. They will come.

story:
By contributing to our campaign you are helping us record a 5 Song EP that will be released and shopped around for label representation.

Your money goes to: Getting a top of the line recording studio, kick ass producer, mixing & mastering, off the chart musicians, filming and the final product the EP

The whole process will take 3-4 weeks to facilitate.  When we reach our goal we will set the digital release date.  Most likely sometime in January.  




Kiyanu Kim - Guitar/Producer

Tony Tino - Bass

Zach Jones - Drums

John Arthur Greene - Lead Vocals & Guitar

story:
Why Music?


Music does not see us but allows us to see ourselves in others. It is blind. It is how we can connect, feel, and experience emotions without risk or judgement. Songs are how artists tell stories. This is mine.


Starseed is an album about who I am. For those of you who don't know me, I have always stayed true on my own path. I have grown up in many households and lived in many cities. I am a chameleon who speaks four languages and I love singing and rapping in all of them (www.soundcloud.com/astrolean). I sang in choir growing up and performed in musicals, school plays, and even regional singing competitions. My love for pop music remains the same as always, thanks to being raised with many late night dance sessions DJed by my older sister.


I was inspired to record my own album after spending almost 2 years traveling and working overseas. While I was abroad in Europe, I was able to redefine myself as an artist. While working a day job in Prague with the Czech Embassy, translating and assisting foreigners with their Visa process, I saw firsthand how much power language yields. Since I was privileged enough to give foreigners the opportunity to start a new life in the Czech Republic, I began exploring other ways I could impact the world. It wasn't long before I started experimenting with song lyrics in Czech, Dutch, and English.


I am 21 years old now and have spent the last 6 months living and recording my album in San Francisco and Hollywood. So far, I have already worked with some amazing producers and engineers (including Berklee Alumni and producers affiliated with Kid Cudi). These past several months have definitely been the most exciting of my life. However, they have also been the most difficult financially.


Supporting myself independently in California means almost all of my money goes towards the basics like rent, food, and transportation. What I am asking of you is to help make my dream a reality by pledging a gift to my campaign. Donate and be a part of the process!


Where Will Your Funding Go?

  1. Studio Rental
  2. Production Costs
  3. Recording
  4. Editing/Mixing
  5. Album Mastering
  6. Artwork
  7. Photography
  8. Videography
  9. Distribution
  10. Professional Marketing 
  11. Indigogo and Credit Card Fees
  12. The little things we forget about :)

Your Impact?


  • Support an openly gay multilingual rapper/singer/songwriter looking to break away from mainstream music
  • Solidify an original work that can be utilized for live performances and auditions
  • Provide polished material that can be submitted to labels and noticed by talent scouts within the industry

Spread the Word!


Even if you are not able to donate, tell your friends! You'd be surprised how many people will take the time to listen when you take the time to tell them. Plus, there are a ton of cool perks to check out! 

Thank you for being a part of my album and I look forward to sharing it with you !

story:
Festivals are well known for being outside of the city proper, where accommodations are both difficult to find and expensive, especially during major events. They also must be booked well in advance. The alternative has always been sleeping in a tent, which is unsafe, uncomfortable and lacks basic amenities

We identified the need for mobile, hostel type of accommodations that can be transported to festivals.


This is how we envisioned Nearby - The World's first mobile hostel. It is a concept made with just one purpose - to provide additional accommodation where its needed the most. 


Event accommodation options: comparison


Smart concept and features


Room amenities


And the best of all...


Help us bring Nearby to life

Our mission is simple - we want to make festival accommodation, close, comfortable and affordable, so you can be free to party and enjoy festivals.

We've been working on Nearby for the past 10 months... and now we need your help to make it happen.


P.S. Don't worry. We'll cover all major festivals and inform you on everything that's happening. 


Meet the team


Project cost breakdown structure


Timeline



Any questions? Shoot us a mail on info@nearby-hostel.com

story:
Who Are These Masked Men?

Post-rock, noise rock, math rock, indie rock ... call it what you like: Victory Hands are an Atlanta-based trio of veteran musicians playing it. Angular rhythms and anthemic melodies meet lyrics taken straight from the tapes and speeches of Richard Milhous Nixon. The paranoia, stilted language and rah-rah aggression of Nixon and cohorts combines with intricate music to create an oddly compelling form of abstract punk-rock poetry. But hell, don't take our weird word for it. Listen for yourself:





The ANDERSON Release

The ANDERSON release is the first in a long series of Victory Hands releases named after reporters who Nixon considered his adversaries. Columnist Jack Anderson, an architect of investigative journalism, was a real burr in Nixon's side. ANDERSON is being released by the HEADPHONE TREATS label (operated by Victory Hands member, Jimmy Ether).

ANDERSON includes the studio recordings of "The Guy We Can Kick" and "If They Give Him The Shaft". The 10" is pressed on clear vinyl. The standard edition artwork is on high-quality paper, letterpress-printed with glossy black foil. The inner sleeves are also printed with black foil and include redacted original Nixon transcripts and speeches, revealing the source material for the lyrics (Henry Kissinger writes some amazing choruses, y'all).

A small number of special leather editions are also available in burgundy debossed, tan debossed and brown leather with black foil. All leather editions are hand-stitched and come with special black inner sleeves with reflective brown foil print. There are only 40 of these in existence, and we saved the 30 that came out best for you.

(standard edition)


(tan leather with debossed art)


(burgundy leather with debossed art)


(brown leather with black foil printing)


High-Resolution Digital

In addition to the vinyl, we are offering TWO versions of the master for digital download in just about any audio format you could want.

VINYL MASTER: This is the exact same master that was used to press the vinyl. It's full resolution and exactly as Victory Hands wants you to hear it, but that means you'll need to crank it up a bit more than your typical audio file ripped from compact disc.

DIGITAL MASTER: This is kept as close to the intent of the vinyl master as possible, but it is a little louder (and is therefore less dynamic). It'll fit right in with your shuffle mix, though.

Here are the audio formats we provide:

24bit/88.2kHz VINYL MASTER in lossless FLAC (perfect for your Pono player or hi-fi stereo system)

24bit/44.1kHz VINYL MASTER in lossless ALAC (will play on most Apple and Android devices and desktops)

16bit/44.1kHz DIGTAL MASTER in lossless ALAC (will play on just about anything)

MP3 using the LAME encoder from 24bit/88.2k version of the DIGITAL MASTER


Our Goal

This is a Pre-Order Campaign. Our goal, at minimum, is for this campaign to recoup the cost of printing and manufacturing that we've already paid out of pocket (about $3000). But your participation in this campaign is Zero Risk -- the record is already recorded. The vinyl is already pressed and in our hot hands. All we have to do is ship it. You can listen to the songs above. You can view all the artwork. 

Even if we don't reach our goal, we'll still be shipping these records out immediately at the end of this campaign. That's why we're doing "Flexible Financing" with Indiegogo. You don't have to wait and see if we reach our goal. If you buy a perk, you're going to get it. And if we go beyond our goal, that money will ensure that upcoming Victory Hands releases already in production will also be released on vinyl with the same quality of artwork.

Many of you probably remember record release days. You'd go to the local record store and look to see what was coming out next Tuesday. If you had a good relationship with a clerk, you might even get them to sell it to you on Monday. There was excitement and anticipation around it. That's kinda gone now. 

That's why HEADPHONE TREATS is running Pre-Release Campaigns -- to make record releases more the event they should be. Your purchase now will help make releasing records like this in the future a sustainable venture. We really appreciate everyone who takes part.


Perk Options

Here are the perk levels we are offering :

DIGITAL DOWNLOADS ONLY $5

10" VINYL STANDARD EDITION + DOWNLOADS $15+ shipping

10" VINYL TAN LEATHER + DOWNLOADS $50 + shipping

10" VINYL BURGUNDY LEATHER + DOWNLOADS $50 + shipping

10" VINYL BROWN LEATHER + DOWNLOADS $50 + shipping


Help Spread The Word

If you dig what we're doing, please help spread the word on Facebook and Twitter.


Credits

Victory Hands is Shawn, Kip and Jimmy

Produced by Victory Hands

Cover illustrations by Doc Woglom

Aurally Chronicled by Jimmy Ether at Headphone Treats

Mastered by Jimmy Ether at Capocus! Studios

Vinyl "flat-cut" by Carl Saff

Printing by Henry+Co

Pressed at Erika Records

Video production Capocus! Studios

Web marketing by Websuasion

That's why HEADPHONE TREATS is running Pre-Release Campaigns -- to make record releases more the event they should be. Your purchase now will help make releasing records like this in the future a sustainable venture. We really appreciate everyone who takes part.



Perk Options
Here are the perk levels we are offering :
DIGITAL DOWNLOADS ONLY $5
10" VINYL STANDARD EDITION + DOWNLOADS $15+ shipping
10" VINYL TAN LEATHER + DOWNLOADS $50 + shipping
10" VINYL BURGUNDY LEATHER + DOWNLOADS $50 + shipping
10" VINYL BROWN LEATHER + DOWNLOADS $50 + shipping
    
Help Spread The Word If you dig what we're doing, please help spread the word on Facebook and Twitter.


Credits
Victory Hands is Shawn, Kip and Jimmy
Produced by Victory Hands
Cover illustrations by Doc Woglom
Aurally Chronicled by Jimmy Ether at Headphone Treats
Mastered by Jimmy Ether at Capocus! Studios
Vinyl "flat-cut" by Carl Saff
Printing by Henry+Co
Pressed at Erika Records
Video production Capocus! Studios
Web marketing by Websuasion

story:
Unbreakable Bloodline is set to rise to new heights with Above the Noise!

GREETINGS...

Unbreakable Bloodline is beyond excited to announce our latest project, Above the Noise, after many years of hard work & preparation. We are confident that this will be our most professional product to date & confident that it will also be "the one" that breaks Unbreakable Bloodline into becoming a widespread household name.

THE VISION...

We've learned so much about what it takes to be a successful team & are collectively focused on utilizing our God given talents as a catalyst to promote good works & inspire others. This project shall be no different aside from the fact that we are asking you to join us in supporting our vision.

WHAT TO EXPECT...

The content of this album will definitely be customized as music for the masses with stories of life that everyone can relate to in their own way. We are continually pushing our boundaries & venturing into new explorative areas both from writing & production perspectives & this new material definitely reflects such an evolution.  We absolutely cannot wait to deliver this finished product, in which we intend to use as a platform for greater advancements towards the betterment of humanity.

CREDENTIALS...

These past two years have blessed Unbreakable Bloodline with opportunities for such great achievements as playing Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival, Sweetwater 420 Fest, T.I.'s Summer Jam Festival & our second year at South by Southwest in Austin, TX, where we were named "The Red Gorilla Favorite act of 2017" out of 180,000 applicants & 600 performing acts.

MORE CREDENTIALS...

We have been extremely fortunate to appear in two big screen movies & have also been the recipient of additional awards such as "Best Hip Hop Band in the State" at the Georgia Music Awards, "Talent Tap Band of the Year" by Atlanta's alternative rock radio listeners & the Easter Seals "Volunteer of the Year" award just to name a few special highlights.  We've also humbly shared performance lineups with such iconic acts as U2, The Red Hot Chili Peppers, The Weeknd & Kid Rock among many others.

OUR CALLING...

Although Unbreakable Bloodline may be one of the hardest working independent bands in the music business & deserving of such accomplishments, we truly believe that our dedication has ultimately positioned us for a greater divine purpose with this new project.  The many pieces of this several year puzzle are finally coming into unification & we can clearly see a larger picture developing into focus. All being said, we feel that we now have the experience, business relationships, musical talents & heartfelt vision needed in order to elevate Unbreakable Bloodline to new heights, hence the album title, Above The Noise.

HUMANITARIAN EFFORTS...

Unbreakable Bloodline exists to make a positive difference, using music as a catalyst do so. The band is very involved with our youth, supporting projects such as K-2 Fire Safety Awareness, The Boys & Girls Club, C.H.A.M.P.S., & Pediatric Cancer Awareness.  The band has also helped design an educational program for public school systems, using Unbreakable Bloodline music, lyrics & videos to connect with our youth. The band additionally makes a meet & greet appearance at participating schools, encourages our youth to utilize their God given talents for good things & closes out the day with full production concert. Unbreakable Bloodline also supports The Pop Warner Warriors, Relay for Life & Easter Seals among many other charitable endeavors.

YOUR PARTICIPATION...

We are ready for this venture but there is still one primary ingredient that is missing, YOU!  We need your help & we invite you to be a part of history in the making by supporting this project.  You can support in many ways.  Even if you can't afford to contribute monetarily, you can be a part of this movement by sharing this campaign, networking your resources & keeping our mission in prayer. 

THE PERKS...

We are happy to be able to offer you a plethora of different contribution options to choose from.  Various donation tiers include digital downloads, autographed hard copy CDs, posters, armbands, stickers, t-shirts, hand written song lyrics, exclusive bonus tracks, autographed guitars, limited edition banners, private live performances, business sponsorship opportunities & even your name listed in the Above The Noise project credits, although the best perk of all is being a part of a collective vision in making a positive difference among others & leaving behind a legacy! 

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES...

Your financial contribution will help fund Above The Noise related expenses such as pre-production & final production studio sessions with both Joey Stuckey at Shadow Sound Studios in Macon, Ga., as well as wunderkind producer Darrick Atwater at Agent Method studios in Atlanta, Ga.  Our budget also includes recording related travel expenses, rough demo pre mixing, final product mixing, final mastering, CD artwork, CD jewel cases, CD packaging, Above the Noise related promotional material, new music videos & campaign perk tier merchandising.

OUR GOAL...

If we reach our fundraising goal, we will be able to accommodate these mentioned expenses & doing so will help us achieve our vision faster & more efficiently. Timing is of the essence & we want to strike the iron while it's hot.  However, if we do not reach our fundraising goal, rest assured that this project will still be completed.  It just may take us longer & we will have to seek alternate resources.

THE FLIGHT...

Once Above the Noise becomes a tangible reality (projected release in February 2018) we still have much hard work ahead of us.  At some point in the near future we intend to be faced with the decision of leaving our day jobs & stepping out on faith that this project will be the beginnings of greater things to come as full time musicians & humanitarians.  Therefore, anything above & beyond our goal shall be considered as additional blessings towards making this dream become a reality.

THE HURDLES...

We realize that there will be risks & obstacles which we will surely face on this adventure but we are prepared to take on & overcome such challenges as we believe to have been called to do.  We can't thank you enough for your support & we look much forward to rocking out with you soon!

story:
Our Vision

We aim to make a tradition of the festival, so that every year, we can inspire more people in the neighborhoods they live in. Challenging the current elite status of classical music, we will keep the concerts free to the public and outside of the limited spaces now offering such performances.

Accomplishments

The Festival has brought classical guitarist  to perform in Latino neighborhoods from all over Latin America, Europe and USA.

Since the beginning of the festival, we have offered more than just concerts. Every year, each guest artist prepares master classes, lectures and conferences for the Latino community to further the interest of the people in classical music.

As a result of this, several participants have decided to dedicate time and energy to becoming professional musicians. Some of these students have even performed the opening concert for the guest artists at the festival.

 

Use of funds

  • Food for Artists
  • Transportation for Artists
  • Promotion of the Festival 
  • Flight tickets

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Jenifer aka JenUwin the Unicorn. I have a BA in Saxophone Performance and Music Composition, with a MM in Intermedia Music. I have a strong love for world music and modern music and create performances that bridges the two.
  • My campaign is for the funding of a recording project. Audiences expressed how much they loved the traditional and modern setting I gave to these world tunes. Children delighted in the music I presented and I would love for them to have more music to listen to at home.
  • Audiences enjoyed this music so much, especially the toddlers, and your contributions will help bring this music into the homes of family for their shared enjoyment!

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down for folks in more detail:

  • What we need is funding for studio time, album art & CD duplication.
  • What you get in supporting us is our album!
  • Studio time is $40 an hour, estimated 30-50 hours of recording, mixing and mastering ($1600-2000)
  • $738 for the printing and creation of the hard copy CDs.
  • $200 for digital creation and $200 for printing (=$400)
  • Musicians day rate = $50 (3 musicians = $150 a day, probably 6 days = $900)
  • Oh! The Unique perks! I have a pink Ukulele that will be hand painted and part of the $250 perk :D There is also fun stickers and buttons as freebies. 
  • If we don't reach our full goal, all the money will still go towards Studio Time and CD production. I will cover any coast that was not met and the project will still happen!

The Impact

  • This product is valuable to the world because it exposes young children to folk songs from around the world and the languages used in each country. It is my belief that fear is based on what we don not know, so if we can give exposure to different countries, then maybe racism and exclusion won't be so prominent in our world. I choose to help the world by bringing forth wonderful music and sharing it with young families. 
  • Your contribution will also provide an opportunity for a 6th grader to have a professional experience in the studio. It will also enable retired folks to participate in a fun musical opportunity. Additionally, this is a long time dream I've had, to record an album. And so, by contributing, you are helping dreams come true and positive experiences to be had!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I understand if you cannot help monetarily, however if you'd still like to support this project, please share it via social media or email with friends and family you think would benefit from this music album! Thanks for helping us get the word out! Make some noise for the Rainbow Band and the Rainbow World children's music album! 
  • Reminder: use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who am I and what's the plan?

My name is Beth Porter, an independent artist based in Wigtown, South West Scotland. As a session cellist I’ve worked with Eliza Carthy, Peter Gabriel, Newton Faulkner, The Proclaimers, The Heavy and many more, but I also write songs myself and this is a fundraising campaign to help realise and release my second solo album.

I have written an album’s worth of quirky, dark, catchy and endearing songs and need your help to get them recorded and released into the world! Using cello and ukuleles as songwriting tools, I’ve been working with incredibly talented musicians from Bath and Bristol (my old home) with whom I recorded and toured my first album (Open Doors). These include pianist Jools Scott (a long time collaborator who has an amazing ear for hearing the potential in my songs and for transforming them, as well as taking the lead in some of the arrangements); string players Sue Lord, Emma Hooper and Ian Vorley (also long term music friends with whom I play with in Red Carousel string quartet); bass player Pete Gibbs (Rock-solid on both electric and double bass - my go-to for all bass needs!); drummer Paul McMahon (the life and soul of any party, will make you cry with laughter and has the energy and passion for playing music that matches no other); wind players Pete Judge (Three Cane Whale, Get The Blessing), Catherine Turner (top flute player) and Rob Spalding (Rivers of England). The plan is to develop the new songs and turn them into full blown arrangements with these great players. I completely trust their abilities and how we work together to turn this into a really exciting new album. They are also a lot of fun to be in the studio with!

Then we need to record them! My first choice of producer/engineer is Luke Cawthra, who I have worked with over the years on various projects. Not only does he write beautiful instrumental music that I have cello played on, but he is a talented guitar player with a great ear for a cool sound. I recorded one song with him and it turned out better than I could have imagined. His studio has a grand piano, a drum kit that he knows well, and an Elvis clock that seems to shake its legs, even without batteries!

We really can’t do all this without you guys getting involved. As you may know it’s a huge undertaking and expense to be able to get an album recorded and out into the world. Labels are a rare breed and long gone are the days of a big advance for recording and living. It’s much more hand to mouth, but that’s not to say that the music isn’t up to the same standards! We have got some of the way under our own steam already and are proud to be independent. However, with your support, help and investment, we can finish the album and make sure it gets heard outside the studio.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for £8,700 which pays for:

  • Recording and mixing the album (paying musicians, engineer/producer, studio time & expenses). £3,500
  • Mastering the album. £700
  • Manufacturing vinyl and CDs £2,500
  • Artwork / Design (paying artist/designer). £500
  • Making FOUR music videos to market the album - it’s all about visuals, films, Youtube etc. Many people discover music this way. We have a couple of people with cameras and ideas! £2,000
  • Working with a plugger and marketing team to get radio play to promote the album eg BBC 6Music, online radio, local radio stations, blogs etc £1,500

Total: £10,700

I've invested £2,000 of my own money to get the project underway

Rewards available:

  • Unique super special delux SUPPORTER-ONLY collector's edition of the album on vinyl + CD or a special media-enhanced download. 
  • A song written for you (inc. video / live recording)
  • A private house concert for you or your friends

...and more!!  There's something for everybody with prices from £8 to £1,000. It might be nice to buy as a present for a friend or family member, or suggest it to people you know who like investing in independent projects. What ever the investment everyone will be invested in our story and we will keep you updated with where we are over the length of the campaign. 

If we don’t reach our goal in full, the marketing and videos might have to wait a bit longer as the money will go into making the album first. The album will be born, and who knows what will happen from there, but you'll definitely get your copy!!

---

Getting this album made is important to me as I have been involved in the making of over 80 albums for other people so this is my chance to get my own music to your ears! One of the songs on this album is one of the first I ever wrote (about 13 years ago) and it’s about time I recorded it! I think the cello is an intriguing songwriting instrument that brings out different harmonies and textures to a guitar or piano and I’d love you to hear the new songs I’ve been writing.

I have just had a baby and moved from Bristol to Scotland so life's going to get busier and there won't be many more chances when I could make time for this project in the near future.

 

Challenges

This kind of funding is one of the only ways these things can happen in this day and age in the absence of a thriving music industry. Great music (which hopefully this is!) is still being made and deserves to be heard. I see Indiegogo as a much more interesting relationship between the artist and the fans where we can interact and create stories together. I’ll keep you updated with how the process is going, the highs and lows and the joys of recording. Every supporter will get the singles, special video features and any news stories before they go public, and more perks will become available as we go. I would be so grateful and over the moon if we could make this happen! Thank you :-) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have the money to invest in the project there are still ways in which you can help this project reach its goal. Please share, tell your friends and help create a buzz. If you know anyone who writes a blog or contributes to a magazine, please give them a shout!

story:
Hello Dear Music Lovers,

My name is Giorgi Mikadze and I am here to invite you to join in the creation of my first record.

I am a musician, pianist, composer and arranger from Tbilisi, Republic of Georgia, currently residing in Los Angeles after moving from NYC. Due to my diverse education (Tbilisi State Conservatory, Manhattan School of Music, Berklee College of Music and Planet MicroJam Institute) and a classical music background and extensive knowledge in jazz and contemporary music, I have always been enthusiastic about ancient music traditions and have always used that knowledge to create music that is unique and unheard of.

Over the course of my musical journey I was curious about unknown and unusual styles and eventually studied microtonal music in an unusual setting. I was recently very fortunate to use these new ideas at the recording session of Philipp Gerschlauer in the studio with the amazing drummer Jack DeJohnette (Miles Davis, John Coltrane, Ornette Colman, Pat Metheny and more) exploring and recording music based on a 128 notes per octave pitch continuum – it was a magical experience.

I was very fortunate to perform, record and tour with many artists such as Roy Hargrove, Dave Liebman, Lee Ritenour, Meshell Ndegeocello, David Fiuczynski, Chris Potter, Matt Garrison, Nils Landgren, Jojo Mayer and many more.

 

BUT it's time for my album now!

This will be my first CD as a leader and composer where I will combine Georgian folk music with contemporary musical styles.

 

 

GIORGIAN MICROJAMZ

 

Giorgian MicrojamZ was developed during my three month residency at 18 Street Arts Center, as the winner of the  "Make Jazz Fellow" program in Santa Monica, CA where I explored microtonalities of traditional Georgian folk music and integrated those structures and tuning systems into new musical motifs and compositions, often mixing with in jazz, funk, fusion, R&B, African rhythms and hip-hop grooves. 

Each composition has a special tuning system that was based on equidistant scales which perfectly fits into Georgian musical microtonal scales.

 

The term "microtonal music" usually refers to music containing very small intervals but can include any tuning that differs from Western twelve notes per octave like on the piano.. Any interval, or sound less than a half tone is a microtone. The music of India, Indonesian gamelan music, Persian, Turkish or middle eastern music, they are all microtonal.  

The Blues has searing soulful lines filled with "blue notes" that are a microtonal pitches that fall in between the cracks on a piano. These are the sweet notes that you hear that any great blues rock guitar player like Jimi Hendrix would play. Without these the blues would be bland, kind of like Italian food without garlic or olive oil!!! I will use revolutionary software that allows me to use retune any keyboard in infinite ways.

 

The Musicians

As a musician, I place great value in the collaborative process and I look forward to working with this outstanding band:

David Fiuczynski, fretted and fretless guitars, who runs Planet MicroJam, an Institute that explores the use of microtones in jazz, traditional, folk, and other groove music.

Panagiotis Andreou: Grammy-nominated Greek-American bass player. He has extensive experience and knowledge of folk music from different countries, such as Indian, Balkan and Afro-Cuban music.

Sean Wright: phenomenal US-American drummer with amazing abilities, he is one of the most sought after percussionists on the contemporary music.

 

What We Need

The total amount needed to produce this album is $12,000. The funds raised in this campaign will directly contribute to:

  • Studio recording
  • Sound engineer
  • Artists' fees
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Publicity
  • Video recording
  • Copies of CDs

 

What you get?

I have prepared exclusive perks to thank you for your contribution: digital or hard copy of cd, private lessons, original music charts, private concert, solo or with group. And your names will be mentioned in the album, and much more…

 

The Impact

My goal is pretty simple.I would like the world to hear about Georgia that offers a treasure of folk music, extremely inspiring for musicians who are in search of unheard sonorities.

If you find the project interesting, but cannot purchase the album, we’d ask you to become a part of the campaign by sharing our page on social media, getting the word out to family and friends.

With your help this first record will be a pure sound of my original ideas gathered from musical experience.  We will be eternally grateful for any support you give us.

Thank you

I am a musician, pianist, composer and arranger from Tbilisi, Republic of Georgia, currently residing in Los Angeles after moving from NYC. Studio recording
Sound engineer
Artists' fees
Mixing
Mastering
Publicity
Video recording
Copies of CDs

 
What you get?
I have prepared exclusive perks to thank you for your contribution: digital or hard copy of cd, private lessons, original music charts, private concert, solo or with group. And your names will be mentioned in the album, and much more…
 
The Impact
My goal is pretty simple.I would like the world to hear about Georgia that offers a treasure of folk music, extremely inspiring for musicians who are in search of unheard sonorities.
If you find the project interesting, but cannot purchase the album, we’d ask you to become a part of the campaign by sharing our page on social media, getting the word out to family and friends.
With your help this first record will be a pure sound of my original ideas gathered from musical experience.  We will be eternally grateful for any support you give us.
Thank you

story:
For years people have been asking me when I was coming out with an album. I’m grateful for the folks who have supported and encouraged me over the years! Time and circumstances made it difficult to get into the studio, not to mention the tremendous amount of work and money that goes into such a project. The time has finally come when I feel I need to listen to my friends and fans and produce my first album. I won’t be singing as Barbra or Celine, but as myself – because I have something to say.

Have you noticed how negative the world has become? Television, social media, news networks on both sides of the aisle seem to promote division and anger. Instead of focusing on the hate and fear, I want this album to help people focus on hope and joy.  

Studies have shown we tend to produce in our lives what we focus on.  Like an archer, we can only hit the target in our sites. By recording a collection of beloved songs and some originals with positive messages or uplifting melodies I hope to help listeners find their inner voice of hope and joy to embrace, instead of all the negativity bombarding us every day.

To make this vision for an album that’s a voice for good is something I can’t do alone- I need your help. Financially backing this album, be it a dollar or larger amount, gives you the opportunity to be part of the team promoting something you can believe in and feel good about that may actually make a difference in people’s lives.  

Expenses for creating a quality album include recording, editing, mastering, producing and distribution, to name a few. The album will be released on CD and in digital outlets, such as Spotify, iTunes, and Amazon Music.

Contributors (I prefer to think of you as “team members”, for whom I’m truly grateful) will get various goodies for their financial support to this project, which you can see listed on this page. As a contributor on the team you’ll see regular updates here on this site on how we’re doing. You may also see secret “surprises” along the way that other folks won’t be privy to. Please note that we only have 30 short days to make this happen!

It would also be unbelievably helpful if you would share this campaign with your friends, family, and social media connections with #ichooselove.  

I’m asking you to join me on this journey to help make this album a reality and, perhaps, make a difference in some hearts and minds.  Can you imagine a world where everyone says, “I choose love”?

Thank you so much!

story:
Un premier EP solo pour Émilie!

ES-TU PUMPED? 

Moi je le suis en tout cas! Cette année a été remplie d'aventures, de rencontres, d'apprentissages et tout ça m'a menée à ce moment. Depuis que je m'en souviens, je chante et j'écris des chansons. C'est une partie intégrante de ma personne, c'est comme ça que je passe à travers les hauts et les bas de la vie. J'ai envie de partager mon histoire avec vous. 

J'ai la chance d'être bien entouré par l'agence d'artiste Le Grenier musique et d'avoir Daran comme réalisateur. Avec tout ce beau monde autour de moi, vous pouvez être certains que le projet que vous appuyez portera fruits!

Ce que vous appuyez: 

Les fonds financeront les dépenses associées au EP. 

  • Le studio
  • Le réalisateur/producteur
  • Le mixage
  • Le mastering
  • Le graphiste
  • La pochette d'album

Vous ne me connaissez pas? 

Voici une chanson qui sera sur le disque! 

 

Qu'est-ce que ça vous donne?

Vous pouvez être fiers d'encourager une artiste acadienne en début de carrière. En plus, vous aurez accès à des récompenses! Regardez à droite pour voir la liste des récompenses liées aux divers montants de don. Cliquez sur celui qui vous intéresse pour l'obtenir! 

Est-ce que vous pouvez aider autrement? 

Bien sur!

Des fois, ce n'est pas possible de donner et je comprends ça. Une façon super-simple de m'aider est de partager ma campagne avec vos amis, votre famille votre voisin et même votre chien! Plus on rejoint de gens, plus tôt on pourra atteindre notre objectif! 

Encore une fois, merci à tous ceux qui m'encouragent et qui me supportent dans cette aventure. Vous ne pouvez pas savoir à quel point je l'apprécie. 

Émilie xox

story:
Last year, we hosted Kenya's Safari Voices International (SVI), a fifteen-voice ensemble that gives soul-stirring performances and shares our vision for raising the vibration of our human family through song.  

With the support of individuals and corporations, our intention to bring the Kenyans to America in the fall of 2015 was fulfilled!  They performed in venues throughout New York, Las Vegas, Los Angeles and Denver on a 10-day concert tour.

We are happy to announce that our 2016 exchange will be Kenya's Light the Future Choir, an eighteen voice ensemble whose youthful exuberance is thrilling to experience.

The Light the Future choir members are orphans ranging from 11 – 18 years of age who serve as ambassadors for The Maisha Project, representing the village of Kano, Kenya. 

Our intention, with your support, is to host these young singers in November 2016 for a five day experience of New York City.

Our goal is to perform in select venues, experience a Broadway musical, tour historic sites and share cultural experiences with local students.

The S.T.A.R.S. Foundation (Souls Taking Action Reaching Souls) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization and all of your donations are tax deductible.

Donate Today and Be a Part of This Life Changing Adventure!

story:
The Story

We have been compared to Athlete, Ben Howard and The Swell Season, and our music has had airplay across the UK and beyond. We have been lucky enough to appear on stages from folk clubs to festivals including The Great Escape, Wychwood Festival, Greenbelt and Weyfest whilst earning an honourable mention at the International Songwriters' Competition final thanks to our single Dry Bones.

In March 2016 we released our second EP 'Light Runs After Us' featuring singles Slow to Now and Lions Roar. The latter was adopted by our hometown of Rugby as it's official song for the Rugby World Cup. The song also included the voices of 100's of local school children which led to the song being played at the Ricoh Arena with support from Wasps RFC and reached to #14 in iTunes charts.

Our heart is to connect with people through our stories and anthems and believe an Album for us now, will be the best way to express that and hopefully reach more ears.

The Album

We are excited to be say we are going to work with acclaimed producer Ian Grimble (Bears Den, RHODES, Seth Lakeman) and plan to record at Rockfield Studios which has seen the likes of Bears Den, Royal Blood and Queen step through it's doors.

This is going to be a huge project for us, and that is why we want you to come along with us on it. 

How Can You Help?

To make our album a reality we need to raise £39,000! Yep, crazy huh? Well, we have some big plans for this album and to make it the best it can be, this is what it will take. We haven't got a label to fund this for us, so we need your help. 

The budget is broken down into a few chunks, which you can take a look at below:

 - Recording: £32500

 - Marketing and PR: £3000

 - Production: £3500

There are some great special Perks in backing us and pre-ordering the album. From CDs, Vinyl, T-shirts, custom lyrical paintings, and more :)

So grab a coffee, take some time and explore the different ways you can support us on our journey and if you support us by the 14th October you get a free digital of our special live EP!

If you can't contribute financially, don't worry there are lots of other ways you can come along on the journey with us, from sharing the campaign to spreading the word amongst your friends, just let everyone know about it!

Nath, Matt, Dan, Chris and James

www.speakbrother.co.uk

story:
The Project

Songs for Ledalero is Joan Grabowski’s first CD working together with Fr. Eman Weroh, SVD, at a Catholic seminary in Indonesia!  Together they recorded 7 songs, 5 of which are in English; two of the songs were composed by Fr. Eman himself.  Joan Grabowski is a vocalist with over 30 years of experience as a music minister in American Roman Catholic parish and diocesan settings.  This is her 4th CD.  The others are:  Take  Lord, Receive with In Our Midst, lifechoices with pianist Ginny Butschek, and In the Studio with Two or More.

This campaign is to raise money to raise money, if you will.  This $5,000 USD will pay for the duplication of 2,000 of the new CD along with payment of song royalties.  If we can do that, then 100% of the sales of this CD can be sent directly to support the seminary.  If we raise more than the goal, believe me, that will be a huge blessing to the seminary. And you can help!  How exciting!!!

The Seminary

At St. Paul Major Seminary in Ledalero, Flores, Indonesia, almost 300 Divine Word Missionary (SVD) seminarians are preparing for the priesthood.  They attend school with 300 other priest candidates from other religious orders as well as the Diocese of Maumere.  Joan Grabowski, after a 30+ year career working for not-for-profit organizations and corporate America, lives at the seminary as the lone female!  This seminary is one of the largest Catholic Seminaries in the world. She works as a volunteer to help them with English language skills. They practice speaking with and listening a native English speaker before being sent all around the world as missionaries.   In addition to the 300 seminarians, the SVD community at Ledalero seminary also includes around 30 priests and brothers – and Joan, a lay missionary -- who support the seminary.  

Every day, seminarians tend to their gardens to raise their fruits, vegetables to eat.  In addition, they raise pigs to sell to help support themselves in their dorms.  The SVDs also have a large working farm where they raise chickens to sell eggs to produce income for the seminary.   Most of the SVDs here come from extremely simple families, most of whom are farmers who live in simple bamboo houses or concrete homes. Most do not own a car; some own a motorbike.  Here on the island of Flores, there are no Starbucks, no movie theatres, and few restaurants.  Here on Flores, there are good-hearted people living difficult lives in great economic poverty, 95% of whom are Catholic.

After attending daily philosophy and theology classes, the seminarians tend their gardens and their livestock (pigs and chickens) to provide most of their daily food.  In addition to their Bachelors and Masters degree studies and SVD community activities, the seminarians cook in simple “kitchens” on open wood fires or open-flame gas burners and their diet consists of rice, dried fish, and fresh vegetables and fruits. They also hand-wash their own clothes and hang them out to dry before ironing them.  There is no air conditioning, no showers and no bathtubs, no hot water in the bathrooms; and they bathe with ground water which occasionally a) runs out or b) runs brown from the water running over the Earth.  There is Wi-Fi but only when the electricity is working, and even then the signal is weak and is not sufficient to support the community of almost 300 SVD priests and seminarians. 

The seminary is staffed by dedicated SVD missionaries who have Masters or Doctorate degrees in philosophy, theology, anthropology, or missiology (the science of religious mission).  They have so much wisdom and have dedicated their lives to forming these young men into new missionaries.  If you have time, you are invited to come visit!  You will be amazed at how much they can do with so few resources.

Although they are part the world-wide religious congregation of 6,000 Divine Word Missionaries, like most SVD communities, the seminary must raise more than 50% of its $500,000 USD annual operating budget to supplement what they receive from the world-wide SVD community.  In an area where the average household income is the equivalent of $3,600 USD per YEAR, fundraising is difficult.  Some help comes from Jakarta and western Indonesia which is more developed, but still -- fundraising here is difficult, to put it mildly.

FINANCIAL NEEDS: There are many financial needs here.  But this campaign is to raise money to raise money, if you will.  This $5,000 USD will pay for the duplication of 2,000 CDs along with payment of song royalties for producing this CD.  If we can do that, then 100% of the sales of this CD can be sent directly to support the seminary.  If we raise more than the goal, believe me, that will be a huge blessing to the seminary.

The sales of 2,000 Songs for Ledalero CDs in the USA and Indonesia will raise approximately $15,000 for the seminary! 

These seminarians are willing to devote their lives to the service of Jesus Christ in the mission field all over the world.  You can help!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Fr. Eman donated his services at no charge.  We used Fr. Eman’s sound engineer and his music studio in Indonesia.  I had the CD mastered in Dallas.  Another Indonesian SVD priest designed the artwork for the cover, again at no charge.
  • Now we need $5,000 to cover the following expenses:
    • $  900……… manufacturing 1,000 CDs in Indonesia.
    • $  500……….advertising and distribution in Indonesia
    • $    50……… international bank transfer fees
    • $1,372 ……...manufacturing and digital distribution in the US (includes manufacturing, UPC barcode for retail sales, and registration for music sales through CD Baby, iTunes (through CD Baby), Amazon, GooglePlay, as well as Gracenote MusicID.
    • $   190………mechanical licensing (song royalties) in the US
    • $1,000 (est.)...mastering at VergeMusicWorks studio in Dallas
    • $   988………miscellaneous for unexpected expenses in Indonesia, or donation to the seminary
    • TOTAL: $5,000
  • What you get! 
    • Joan will email you a bonus song that was recorded with the Seminary choir of over 60 wonderful, male voices singing Panis Angelicus with her as a soloist.
    • The seminary community will remember you in their prayers. 
  • How will CDs be sold in the US?
    • CDs will be available for purchase online via iTunes, Amazon and CD Baby, (digital downloads as well as physical CDs, too).
  • If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funds raised will go to producing a smaller quantity of CDs.
  • If we exceed our goal, anything extra will go directly to the seminary.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please pray for this project!
  • Please share on facebook and other social media to help get the word out and make some noise about this project.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Come visit us in Indonesia for 1-3 months and see for yourself how even a little goes a long way to help!

What others say about Joan and her music:

  • "Remarkably, a Caucasian lady sang the familiar Taste and See responsory in such a freewheeling, dynamic and inspirational way that she seemed to have learned the grace notes and delivery from a black Gospel singer. It qualified as blue-eyed soul."  -Fr. Jerome LeDoux, SVD
  • "Joan has a fantastic voice." -Joan K. G.
  • Ms. Joan has so much joy!
  • The music was very uplifting to a tired restless soul.
  • I attended (the concert) because of Joan’s voice and her holiness as it comes through her voice.
  • Christ was present and foremost in every song. This was truly a gift from above! ...It moved me to tears. Amazing! Heaven danced today!
  • It was a beautiful spiritual experience. The Spirit of the Lord is strong in your music and your love of what you are doing is apparent.
