GOD BLESS YOU AND YOURS!
story_txt:
The Project
Songs for Ledalero is Joan Grabowski’s first CD working together with Fr. Eman Weroh, SVD, at a Catholic seminary in Indonesia!  Together they recorded 7 songs, 5 of which are in English; two of the songs were composed by Fr. Eman himself.  Joan Grabowski is a vocalist with over 30 years of experience as a music minister in American Roman Catholic parish and diocesan settings.  This is her 4th CD.  The others are:  Take  Lord, Receive with In Our Midst, lifechoices with pianist Ginny Butschek, and In the Studio with Two or More.
This campaign is to raise money to raise money, if you will.  This $5,000 USD will pay for the duplication of 2,000 of the new CD along with payment of song royalties.  If we can do that, then 100% of the sales of this CD can be sent directly to support the seminary.  If we raise more than the goal, believe me, that will be a huge blessing to the seminary. And you can help!  How exciting!!!
The Seminary
At St. Paul Major Seminary in Ledalero, Flores, Indonesia, almost 300 Divine Word Missionary (SVD) seminarians are preparing for the priesthood.  They attend school with 300 other priest candidates from other religious orders as well as the Diocese of Maumere.  Joan Grabowski, after a 30+ year career working for not-for-profit organizations and corporate America, lives at the seminary as the lone female!  This seminary is one of the largest Catholic Seminaries in the world. She works as a volunteer to help them with English language skills. They practice speaking with and listening a native English speaker before being sent all around the world as missionaries.   In addition to the 300 seminarians, the SVD community at Ledalero seminary also includes around 30 priests and brothers – and Joan, a lay missionary -- who support the seminary.  
Every day, seminarians tend to their gardens to raise their fruits, vegetables to eat.  In addition, they raise pigs to sell to help support themselves in their dorms.  The SVDs also have a large working farm where they raise chickens to sell eggs to produce income for the seminary.   Most of the SVDs here come from extremely simple families, most of whom are farmers who live in simple bamboo houses or concrete homes. Most do not own a car; some own a motorbike.  Here on the island of Flores, there are no Starbucks, no movie theatres, and few restaurants.  Here on Flores, there are good-hearted people living difficult lives in great economic poverty, 95% of whom are Catholic.
After attending daily philosophy and theology classes, the seminarians tend their gardens and their livestock (pigs and chickens) to provide most of their daily food.  In addition to their Bachelors and Masters degree studies and SVD community activities, the seminarians cook in simple “kitchens” on open wood fires or open-flame gas burners and their diet consists of rice, dried fish, and fresh vegetables and fruits. They also hand-wash their own clothes and hang them out to dry before ironing them.  There is no air conditioning, no showers and no bathtubs, no hot water in the bathrooms; and they bathe with ground water which occasionally a) runs out or b) runs brown from the water running over the Earth.  There is Wi-Fi but only when the electricity is working, and even then the signal is weak and is not sufficient to support the community of almost 300 SVD priests and seminarians. 
The seminary is staffed by dedicated SVD missionaries who have Masters or Doctorate degrees in philosophy, theology, anthropology, or missiology (the science of religious mission).  They have so much wisdom and have dedicated their lives to forming these young men into new missionaries.  If you have time, you are invited to come visit!  You will be amazed at how much they can do with so few resources.
Although they are part the world-wide religious congregation of 6,000 Divine Word Missionaries, like most SVD communities, the seminary must raise more than 50% of its $500,000 USD annual operating budget to supplement what they receive from the world-wide SVD community.  In an area where the average household income is the equivalent of $3,600 USD per YEAR, fundraising is difficult.  Some help comes from Jakarta and western Indonesia which is more developed, but still -- fundraising here is difficult, to put it mildly.
FINANCIAL NEEDS: There are many financial needs here.  But this campaign is to raise money to raise money, if you will.  This $5,000 USD will pay for the duplication of 2,000 CDs along with payment of song royalties for producing this CD.  If we can do that, then 100% of the sales of this CD can be sent directly to support the seminary.  If we raise more than the goal, believe me, that will be a huge blessing to the seminary.
The sales of 2,000 Songs for Ledalero CDs in the USA and Indonesia will raise approximately $15,000 for the seminary! 
These seminarians are willing to devote their lives to the service of Jesus Christ in the mission field all over the world.  You can help!
What We Need & What You Get

Fr. Eman donated his services at no charge.  We used Fr. Eman’s sound engineer and his music studio in Indonesia.  I had the CD mastered in Dallas.  Another Indonesian SVD priest designed the artwork for the cover, again at no charge.
Now we need $5,000 to cover the following expenses:
$  900……… manufacturing 1,000 CDs in Indonesia.
$  500……….advertising and distribution in Indonesia
$    50……… international bank transfer fees
$1,372 ……...manufacturing and digital distribution in the US (includes manufacturing, UPC barcode for retail sales, and registration for music sales through CD Baby, iTunes (through CD Baby), Amazon, GooglePlay, as well as Gracenote MusicID.
$   190………mechanical licensing (song royalties) in the US
$1,000 (est.)...mastering at VergeMusicWorks studio in Dallas
$   988………miscellaneous for unexpected expenses in Indonesia, or donation to the seminary
TOTAL: $5,000


What you get! 
Joan will email you a bonus song that was recorded with the Seminary choir of over 60 wonderful, male voices singing Panis Angelicus with her as a soloist.
The seminary community will remember you in their prayers. 


How will CDs be sold in the US?CDs will be available for purchase online via iTunes, Amazon and CD Baby, (digital downloads as well as physical CDs, too).

If we don’t reach our entire goal, the funds raised will go to producing a smaller quantity of CDs.
If we exceed our goal, anything extra will go directly to the seminary.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please pray for this project!
Please share on facebook and other social media to help get the word out and make some noise about this project.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Come visit us in Indonesia for 1-3 months and see for yourself how even a little goes a long way to help!

What others say about Joan and her music:

"Remarkably, a Caucasian lady sang the familiar Taste and See responsory in such a freewheeling, dynamic and inspirational way that she seemed to have learned the grace notes and delivery from a black Gospel singer. It qualified as blue-eyed soul."  -Fr. Jerome LeDoux, SVD
"Joan has a fantastic voice." -Joan K. G.
Ms. Joan has so much joy!
The music was very uplifting to a tired restless soul.
I attended (the concert) because of Joan’s voice and her holiness as it comes through her voice.
Christ was present and foremost in every song. This was truly a gift from above! ...It moved me to tears. Amazing! Heaven danced today!
It was a beautiful spiritual experience. The Spirit of the Lord is strong in your music and your love of what you are doing is apparent.

story:
Thirsty Bear needs your help! Between the costs associated with the beginning of the recording process and investing in better equipment to improve the quality of their live show, band funding is running low and will not support the completion of the album. "To Love and Be Loved" is so close to being complete, in fact, we're75% of the way there!

Thirsty Bear intends to allocate your generous donation to the following costs:

- Completion of recording process at Edie Road Recording Studio ($1,200)

- Mixing and mastering the tracks ($2,300)

Thank you! Big, warm bear hugs from Thirsty Bear to you!

story:
Hey look, man!

We are Gentleman Caller, and this will be our 6th and most important record. It is a song-by-song response to a collection of short stories by Maryse Meijer called HEARTBREAKER. This book is a life-changer. This record is meant to honor it, and Maryse has generously offered to be a part of this project with us. 

There are a lot of great perks, but every amount helps, and SHARES SHARES SHARES (especially from my fellow musicians and artists.) When you help support an ambitious artistic endeavor, I have always believed you help enrich the world. This project, and projects like it, really depends on your support.

Again, every share gets a free download of the song you hear in this video, "No One's Daughter." Just like our FB page, and send us a note that says "I shared it!" We will get you a code and be so grateful. https://www.facebook.com/thegentlemancaller/

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money we are asking for will go toward the pressing of vinyl as well as mixing and mastering. We are trying to keep costs as minimal as possible to make our goal attainable. 

Besides being able to pre-order a great record, some of our unique perks also include signed records by Kenny, signed books by Maryse, t-shirts, lyric sheets, original demos of songs and live in-living room readings/performances by Kenny and Maryse.

 

The Impact

Gentleman Caller have had success raising money for records before. Without it, we wouldn't be able to get records properly released on media, so that you can have something tangible in your hands. It's dark times for the music industry, so we simply have to rely on fans of good music and concepts to make it happen. This record is a particularly ambitious one, as it is the first concept record we've ever made. You'll get to hear songs of romance from all kinds of saucy and nefarious characters. It'll freak you out and break your heart. Or, anyway, that's our goal.

WE LOVE YOU, THANK YOU SO MUCH.

story:
Summary

Three years ago, an IndieGoGo campaign helped relaunch the second incarnation of Northwest Passage and helped make it the pre-eminent website on the 80s and 90s northwest music scene, or “grunge” if you will. This campaign aims to sustain the website and take it to the next level!

Over the last three years, you’ve seen semi-regular original content and the most active social media accounts on the topic of “grunge.” We’ve created exclusive content on the history of the critical Reciprocal Recording, Sub Pop Lame Fest and the forgotten Cobain/Lanegan collaboration. But there’s so much more that we can do!

What We Need & What You Get
As you already know, building/maintaining a website isn’t free. There are many costs involved – from purchasing the domain name, annual hosting costs, and software to build and maintain the website. Beyond the time and effort invested in this website, there are hundreds of dollars in annual costs.

  • Annual web URL costs
  • Annual hosting costs
  • Software subscription costs

Supporting this campaign will keep this site permanently ad-free. We set the goal at $500, but every dollar helps -- and any additional funds will go entirely to optimizing the site. We’re looking to hire some web development assistance so our time is spent on content development, and not site maintenance! We’d love to expand what our site offers, including bringing back the northwest band database.

You guys help out with these costs, and I’ll donate as much time and effort as I can to create new content, build the ultimate northwest music site and grow the community. By supporting this campaign, you can be a big part of building this community and keeping the scene alive!

Our rewards are modest, as this is a small fan-run operation.

  • Fan Level. We’re thankful for all the support from music fans like you. Support at the fan level and we’ll happily recognize you on our website.
  • Supporter Level. We have a huge collection of live recordings and out-of-print music that deserves to be shared. We’re starting an online archive and all supporters at this level will be given exclusive access. You’ll also get on our mailing list with bi-monthly updates and previews of upcoming content. You’ll also get recognized as a supporter on our website as well.
  • Benefactor Level. Wow, you really want to make this site happen! At our highest level, you’ll be given all the previously-listed benefits, but you’ll have close involvement with the website. Your input will be sought out and you’ll have the opportunity to have input on the direction of this project.
    And of course, any dollar amount counts! No amount is too small, and we’re thankful for your support.

The Impact
I’ve been a fan of the northwest music scene for years, and have always felt that it deserves a website as good as the music. The “grunge” scene spawned a ton of influential artists, not limited to Nirvana, Pearl Jam, Soundgarden, Alice in Chains, Mudhoney, Screaming Trees, Bikini Kill, Built to Spill, Mother Love Bone, Tad, Beat Happening and a ton of other bands.

Your previous support of Northwest Passage made this site re-boot possible. Your continuing support will make this site better than ever and will allow us to continue work on this project. We aim to grow this site as far as we can take it, so it can be enjoyed by all music fans. But we promise to keep it at a fan level – with no ads, clickbait-type content or any other attempts to build a “brand.” Our goal is to make the best northwest music site possible, and every dollar you donate goes toward that goal.

Other Ways You Can Help
Can’t contribute monetarily, but still want to help? No problem. There’s a number of other ways you can assist in the success of this website.

  • Help spread the word about our website and our campaign.
  • Share our Facebook and Twitter pages with friends who might be interested in our site. The bigger audience, the better!
  • Become an actual contributor to our website! We’re always looking for additional writers, graphic designers and web developers, but we welcome any help as far as assisting with social media, finding content, suggesting new features, or submitting links for us to share. Lots of ways to make an impact!

Thank you for your support! (c)

story:
Summary

This is a project by our band, called Rear Window. We are a collective of seasoned musicians with decades of experience in total amongst ourselves.  In short, we are a progressive styled art-rock band. This means there are many layers to our sound and the ideas we are telling and conveying to our audience. The music is often structured to augment the feelings or story we are telling within the lyrics.

                Being a progressive, art-rock band, presentation is a crucial part of the experience. Our Indi-Go-Go campaign is built around this aspect. A440 Studios has an amazing soundstage, audio gear, and camera crew. ( http://www.a440live.tv/ ) Their soundstage is just like being at the best possible club in the Twin Cities. To be able to perform there, with their staging, lights, and have the whole thing recorded by a professional group of top-notch audio engineers, would enable Rear Window to present fans with the best possible experience.  Add to that 360-degree video camera recording, and you might as well be there on stage with us!

                Working with great people in a great place will yield great results. It would be great to be able to do it for free, but that cheapens the art, and doesn’t pay these great people for their time, effort, and contributions.  Our campaign is relatively low-dough compared to start-up companies with an experimental and manufactured product. We are offering an experimental and engaging experience. The product will be music, which can be enjoyed over and over. We need you to help us bring out the best possible artistic product and provide a quality experience worth seeing again and again.

 

What we Need, and What is in it for you


                Our goal with funding for creating a video web series is $750. This is to cover rental of the sound stage space, and paying the crew for set up, recording, and mixing of the performance, as well as running the lights and visuals for the video aspect. To help us get there, you can contribute $1, $3, $25, or $50. No matter what your budget, you’ll get to hear/see the music. $1 gets you first look at our completed video performance! We’ll send you a link to the private video so you can check it out before it goes public! $3 contributions will get you high-quality audio downloads. This isn’t some MP3 (unless you want that) – this is recorded and mixed for our fans in high-definition! $25 will get you tickets to see/hear the whole thing live! Plus, since the video is 360-degrees, you’ll be in the show as part of our studio audience! Show all your friends you’re on YouTube! $50, and not only do you come to the show, you can hang out with us and everyone else beforehand at the Pre-Party! Whether you want to experience it at home, or come to the Twin Cities and see it live, the option is all up to you! Any excess we make over the goal amount, will go to the future episodes of our web-series.
 

Impact

 

Music is an art-form. Art in the visual form has changed a lot through history. It has had many changes in subject matter, styles, movements, made statements, and so on. Music has changed in the same way. How music has been brought to the listener has changed too. Vinyl, cassette, CD, digital file, and streaming service.  The constant has been the live performance.  Bands go on tour, just like special art exhibits might go on tour. Some art pieces you might never see because you are not able to get there. Some music you might not ever hear live because you can’t get there.  This is the part of music that still needs to change.

                Art museums have hours of business and are open to mostly all ages. Music clubs have a lot of age restrictions and performances are often late in the evening or at night. Schedules are hectic in this day and age, and hearing great music should be an enjoyable experience, and not a great difficult task. Band:Rear Window wants to be able to help bring the music to you, on a schedule that’s better than 10pm on a weeknight and in a way that is more convenient, yet retains that the performance is still a special event.

                Video is a large part of media these days. There are so many devices and ways to “capture the moment” in today’s world. Use of video surely isn’t new – but there are ways to make it more personal, interactive, and special.  360-degree video cameras let you as the viewer decide where you want to look and what you want to look at. Every time you watch it, the show can be different.  With that in mind, a great setting is important so that as the viewer, you want to look around the space you are virtually a part of.

 

Risk

 

We have talented performers, and we have a spectacular venue, and we have expert audio and video crew. That's a lot of people to bring together. We have a date set for this performance, but scheduling can still be an issue. The show WILL go on, but delays can occur.

Schedules are hectic in this day and age, and hearing great music should be an enjoyable experience, and not a great difficult task. Band:Rear Window wants to be able to help bring the music to you, on a schedule that’s better than 10pm on a weeknight and in a way that is more convenient, yet retains that the performance is still a special event.                Video is a large part of media these days. There are so many devices and ways to “capture the moment” in today’s world. Use of video surely isn’t new – but there are ways to make it more personal, interactive, and special.  360-degree video cameras let you as the viewer decide where you want to look and what you want to look at. Every time you watch it, the show can be different.  With that in mind, a great setting is important so that as the viewer, you want to look around the space you are virtually a part of. Risk We have talented performers, and we have a spectacular venue, and we have expert audio and video crew. That's a lot of people to bring together. We have a date set for this performance, but scheduling can still be an issue. The show WILL go on, but delays can occur.

story:
IV GODS GLORY

Whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God. 1 Corinthians 10:31

A Christian Urban Apparel & Hip-Hop Music Shop Opening in Houston, TX


Every Bit of Love Helps

First we would like to ask that everyone, before anything else, please keep us lifted in prayer during this time, this is not a small endeavor and it is meant to be done to bring God the glory that He deserves! Getting the opportunity to create a place for Christian brands, music and events to unite all for His glory is a dream come true, and from the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for any help you may offer. No donation is too small!

Part of the Community

Edit

IV GODS GLORY is Houston's future Christian Urban Apparel & Hip-Hop Music Shop. We will also be a venue for Christian events! Most importantly IV GODS GLORY is to be a safe space in a central location for the city’s young Christian community to gather. 

IV GODS GLORY will be a space of acceptance & support and sponsor local outreach programs, provide affordable space for Christian meetings and events and will host weekly/monthly events and bible studies.

We can't wait to open! Please keep us in your prayers!

We’ve done a lot of praying and searching within the area and have found a space in the EADO (East Downtown) District of Houston, TX. It's currently vacant which makes this a great opportunity for Christian Hip Hop to be in the up-and-coming area for entertainment and fashion. 

Voice Your Vision

We’re doing this for our community: that’s you! Community involvement, discussion and prayer are very important for us moving forward. We will need your help to improve in the right ways. Please give us your input on what you want to see created at IV GODS GLORY.

Write a comment on this page, send us a message on Facebook or Twitter, or email IVGODSGLORY@gmail.com!


Donation Goal

Our goal is to raise $20,000 with your donation IV GODS GLORY will purchase furniture, fixtures and equipment for the store. What if we don't reach our goal? With flexible funding, we are able to keep all donations and put them toward the project even if the full amount is not reached. IV GODS GLORY will open whether we reach the goal or not but we may have to adjust how the funds are allocated to each portion of the budget. Even if you don’t live in our area, or can benefit directly from our space, your contribution will be instrumental in creating something meaningful and cool.


In Return For Your Support:

-Become a PERMANENT fixture with IV GODS GLORY with your name on a 6in x 6in ceramic tile we will have on our wall

-IV GODS GLORY logo car window decal

-T-shirt with our logo

-Discounts

-Invite to community opening party


Other Ways You Can Help

Prayer! Please keep us lifted in prayer during this time!

If you can't contribute to this campaign, please do us a favor and help us get the word out about all the work we are doing here. We think that even people outside of the city will believe in what we're doing. Tell/Tag your favorite Christian Apparel Brands & Musicians about us so that we can get the gear, music and events that you love!

Please use the share tools above to share this campaign via Twitter, Facebook, etc, and use the Hashtag #IVGODSGLORY so others can join in the discussion.

Your support means the world. Visit www.IVGODSGLORY.com
for updates.

story:
The Project

Keeping Live Music in the Egyptian Festival you can visit without a passport .

The Jewels of the Orient is scheduled for August 26 – 28 in 2016 at the Crowne Plaza Hotel in North Wilmington (630 Naamans Rd, Claymont, De 19703).  http://www.jewelsoftheorient.com/.   This is the 4th year of the festival, but only the second year with a full live band.

Our festival was created to bring music, dance, workshops & food together in a celebratory festival setting.     

Jewels of the Orient has featured performers and teachers from all over the US & other counties.   We feature a live band at the Friday, Saturday and Sunday shows, as well as at the after parties.  We do also hold workshops during the dance weekend, but those fees cover only the instructors and the rooms.  We need help bringing the shows to life with live music.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help keeping and expanding live music as part of the event. 

Including a live band for 3 nights is expensive, but we feel that the festival gains so much from this unique experience.  Live music is becoming more rare and we want to continue to offer a live music experience to both our dancers and audience.  We are fundraising asking you to help us fund the existing band and possibly even expand the band.  We also have other ideas to improve the festival shows further if we meet those goals.

We are fundraising for seven thousand seven hundred and thirty dollars. $7730.00.

Budget Breakdown:

We are fundraising to pay the band, including food for both nights $5930.00

Sound System upgrades   $770.00

DJ for festival                  $430.00

More lighting                   $400.00

More Gala decorations    $200.00

Grand total of $7730.00 which could be used to improve the festival for 2016 and future years!!!

If we meet this goal we will continue to raise funds to improve the Gala Shows at the festival:

Dinner for all Fri and Sat performers  $1,320.00

More band members/vocalist  $1,100.00

We Have Some Really Cool Perks When You Contribute To Our Campaign

We appreciate any amount you contribute and to show our appreciation we have some cool perks to say thanks.

Our perks start with a thank you on the webpage and in the program.  We also offer sponsor web links where we will list a link to your dance or business page, autographed cd's by the band, dinner show tickets, full page ads, T-shirts and even bellydance lessons. These are very limited so be sure to choose these perks early if you are interested.  Lorelei will offer 2 hour private/semi private in person or virtual lessons including topics such as balancing props, zills, drumming rhythms for dancers, costume alterations, and makeup tricks.   Nefertiti will also 2 hour private lessons including topics such as Shaabi, Egyptian Style, Professional Dancer Developement, &Tarib,

 Our featured perk “Sponsor a diamond” when you contribute $60.00 you will not only help with the band but, also your contribution will allow us to feed a youth at the dinner shows.  

So get excited and help us grow this festival to an amazing community event.   Even if we don't reach our entire goal we will use any amount to provide for the band

The Impact

Your donations will have a massive impact on the shows.  Not only are you helping fund the base costs of the festival for 2016, but you are helping support live music for this year and years to come.  Your donations helps us keep the show ticket prices affordable so live music and bellydance are open to more people in the community.   Your contribution will go far even by providing a meal to a deserving youth.  

Risks & Challenges

What if we don’t reach our goal?  We will still use any money raised to help pay the band, but we risk not being able to bring them back in 2017.

  • We may need to reduce the number of days of live music to 1 or 2 shows
  • We may need to reduce the size of the band
  • We may need to increase the cost of tickets

Other Ways You Can Help

We know you may not be able to donate at this time, but there are other ways you can help. 

  • Please share this campaign with other lovers of live music
  • Share the event website: http://www.jewelsoftheorient.com/
  • Attend one of the shows and bring your friends and family
  • Purchase a full color photo ad in the program.  http://www.jewelsoftheorient.com/#!price-list/cwns
  • Volunteer for a few hours at Jewels of the Orient 2016
  • Volunteer virtually by editing web pages and programs

Thank you for your support.

Thank you for your support.

story:
Band Overview

Plaguebringer is a Canadian metal band formed in late 2013. Since the band’s inception there has been two EPs released (Hallowed [2014] & Three Kings [2017]), a music video, and two tours. Planned for the end of 2018, Plaguebringer will release their debut full-length album “Diabolos”, which is the band’s most ambitious effort yet. This is the first album in which the band will have professional help in the mixing, mastering, and production to give the songs the most crushing sound yet. Typically, we fund all of our efforts ourselves, but the cost for this album is much higher than previous records, and we need your help. By purchasing one of the many perks for the album you are allieviating financial stress on the members of the band, and ensuring this album gets the best sound possible to satisfy our fans. Regardless if we reach our financing goal or not, we are moving forward with the production of the album and making this full length album happen. 

We hope you find a perk you like, and support this effort. We sincerely are thankful for you considering a contribution to our full length album. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5,000 USD to fund mixing, mastering, & production with Mick Kenny
  • By contributing to this cause you will have first dibs on very limited merchandise on the album, as well as a spot on the album credits, and a download of comprehesive Guitar Pro tabs of every song off of “Diabolos” (available for certain packages).
  • If we do not reach our goal we will use the funds raised towards the production of the album, and fund the rest ourselves.

The Impact

  • Each song will have the best production quality possible. This is in response to the production complaints we have had with our previous albums.
  • We have released two previous albums and toured Canada independently funded (no outside or label support). By supporting us you can trust we will follow through with our commitments. 
  • You will be helping a hard-working band with limited financial resources to produce an album that has been years in the making. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to support us financially here is what you can do; share our IndieGoGo campaign, past albums, or even the album sampler with your metal-head friends! Increasing awareness of our music is our ultimate goal. We sincerely appreciate your support!

<3 Plaguebringer

story:
!!! Note to the backers who back me for 50eur of more: if you want to receive your goodies, please email me your address -> tazvonstone@gmail.com !!!

Who am I & why am I asking for your support?

I am Matthijs Vanstaen, a musician. I've been writing and performing since I was 12 years old. It's something I need to do, it's something I love to do. I have a band called Lighthousing and I perform solo as well, with my alter ego: Taz Von Stone. All of my time, effort and money goes to these two children of mine. Yet the costs of being a musician are enormous (the rehearsal room you rent, the distances you cover, the gear you have, the gear you need, the gear that stops working and needs to be fixed/replaced with new gear, recordings, mixing, mastering, pressing,...) and never-ending. Now, having said this, I find myself in this predicament: I have recorded an entire album, I have put my heart and soul into it and I cannot wait to share it with you, the only thing is I do not have the money to finish it. It still needs to be mastered and pressed. I'm hoping I can do this with your help.

 

What are the costs/where will your money go to?

Mastering will be about 990 euro's and the pressing of the cd's will be about 1050 euro's. The money collected from your generous donations will be solely used for the mastering and pressing of the album. This will also be the case if the goal is not reached, it will only take longer for the album to be released, because I will have to save up some money along the way. If the goal is exceeded, the album will be pressed on vinyl too!

 

What's in it for you?

 

Well, first of all I hope your excited to hear my album. You will also make me extremely happy and help me pursue my dreams, but donate generously and you will receive the following:

- 50eur: signed album Taz Von Stone + limited edition Taz Von Stone guitar pick*

- 100eur: 2 signed albums Taz Von Stone + 2 limited edition postcards with artwork + 2 limited edition Taz Von Stone guitar picks*

- 150eur: 3 signed albums Taz Von Stone + 3 limited edition postcards with artwork + 3 limited edition Taz Von Stone guitar picks *

- 350eur: private living room concert 35-40 minutes**

- 500eur: private living room concert 50-60 minutes + signed album Taz Von Stone + limited edition Taz Von Stone guitar pick + limited edition postcard with artwork**

- 1000eur: private living room concert 60 minutes + 5 signed albums Taz Von Stone + 5 limited edition picks + 5 limited edition postcards with artwork**

*excl shipping costs for shipping outside EU

**excl travel expenses for concerts exceeding a 100km distance from Antwerp

\\\\\\\\\\:::send all info regarding adress/date... to tazvonstone@gmail.com::://////////

 

Massive thanks for your support! You are all heroes. I love you.

story:
What?

I am currently in the process of recording my first studio album called "The Return". There will be 7 original worship and prayer songs professionally recorded and I’m so excited to get them out into everybody’s hands, but I need your help to finish it. 

Why? 

I am a junior at Arizona State University, and I'm very involved at ASU’s Catholic Newman Center, leading students in music at Masses, worship nights, and community outreach. These songs were written through my experience in this ministry. Music has been a powerful influence in my own spiritual life, with power to unlock hearts and speak to them in a way words cannot. In the context of faith, it’s important to me that Music is done well and done for the right reasons. Not only can it be used to praise God, but can console a broken heart, Rejoice with the joyful, guide the lost, soften the arrogant, and inspire the numb. It is my goal that these songs would help to bring the light of Christ into the messy details of every day life. 

The Process

In December of 2017, after a year of dedicated songwriting, I began working on this project. I am fortunate that my dad is a working musician and has allowed my friends and I to use his recording studio at night. A typical studio album costs around $15,000- $20,000. Luckily my friends have volunteered their time and the recording studio didn't cost me anything. I need an additional $2,100 to hire a mixing engineer in Nashville, Tennessee and the remainder of the money goes to graphic design and CD duplication.  

I am incredibly grateful for your support and cannot wait for you to hear the music!

story:
My Story

Hello, my name is Wes. And I’ve been doing music for years now. It was a passion that became a calling while I was still a youth leader at my church. There I gained my artistry. And with that artistry, I became a member of a Christian rap group called The Brotherhood. We later split due to creative differences, which led me to abandon music entirely. I didn't think I would ever make music again. But after a few years of a creative drought, I found my new calling. So, though The Brotherhood's venture was short lived, it made me who I am today and who I am is a music producer. What I want is to give back and truly help make dreams possible for beginning artists.

This is why THE HOUSE was born. It was an act of faith after receiving the calling. I want to create the perfect environment for artists to learn and grow independently through love and support. It is also going to be the main location for The One Song Campaign, a completely free service to help new artists finish their first song. But like any house, this house is in need of support.

And I’m praying that by the grace of God, you will find it in your heart to help in any way you can. Whether it’s monetarily or informational, everything is a blessing. Even prayer will go a long way in the completion of this goal.

**ALL DONATIONS WILL GO DIRECTLY TO THE HOUSE**

 

Things Still Needed for THE HOUSE:

Below are the many things that your contributions will be going towards. If you or if you know anyone who has and/or would like to donate any of these items (used/new) please contact me directly via the contact information below.

  • An A/C Unit (18,000+ BTU per hour) THE HOUSE is being built in a warehouse that is 900 square feet with no air conditioning. $500 - $1200 Retail
  • Steel Front Door A door to secure the premises once we build the front walls of the entrance. $200-$300 Retail
  •  Drywall panels used for construction of interior walls and ceilings. We need at least 16+ sheets. $160+ Retail ($10 per sheet)
  • Insulation Materials Used to sound treat the rooms. (Acoustic panels, foam, rubber, fiberglass, carpet, etc.) $1000+ Retail (all the materials combined)
  • A 16-Channel Mixing Board A music engineering equipment used for combining sounds. Especially during live studio sessions $249-$999 Retail 
  • A Subwoofer Loudspeaker for playing back low end sounds, such as bass. $249-$399 Retail
  • Mixing and Mastering Plug-Ins An assortment of computer softwares that are used to mix and master the music to perfection. $500 Retail (all the different plugins combined)
  • 3 Piece Sofa Set For the artists to lounge on while waiting to record or to take breaks on during recording sessions. $780-$1200 Retail
  • Office Furniture Any type of furniture for an office setting (desk, chairs, table, lamps, ​etc.) Used furniture that still looks presentable will be accepted. Preferably dark colors like black or gray, if possible. $1000+ Retail (all the different office furniture combined)

 

The Impact of THE HOUSE

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

When it comes to local artists, it is very difficult to create quality music. Most artists have to resort to recording in poor sound conditions because it's very expensive to record at a live studio. Aside from the obvious money grab, recording studios want to own your creativity. By means of affiliation or direct marketing, they want your logo, your brand, your voice. It's never really yours and there's always a catch. 

With THE HOUSE, there's no catch. There's no contracts. No obligations and no affiliations. 

It's strictly a place for independent music growth. A place for you to grow your artistry the way you want to, with no limitations. A place for sound engineers to record with their artists in a quality environment that's also affordable. It's the ideal location for The One Song Campaign and other campaigns to come. So, if you're passionate about music or you want to support local artists accomplish their dreams: Support THE HOUSE.

 

Other Ways to Help Build THE HOUSE:

  • Prayer As mentioned before, this is vital to the success of The House. Every step that has been taken towards this has ALL truly been a blessing from God. There are so many testimonies so far with even more to come. It all starts with prayer.
  • Spreading The Word This too can go a long way. You personally may not be in the best position to financially support, but you might know someone who can. Let others around you know about the many different ways they can help.
  • Information is Key If you have any information that can help, please feel free to let us know. Even things like where to get the best deals on certain items.
  • Follow The Journey All the progress will be posted regularly on my Instagram page. (www.instagram.com/westhetech) Feel free to follow me, comment and like. Any words of encouragement throughout this journey is appreciated.

 

And YOU!!!

Thank you for all the love and support. Thank you to everyone who has helped so far. And a special thanks to God, All Mighty, for making all of this possible. Stay blessed!

 

In Good Faith,

Wesly Giordany

Founder of WesTheTech
story_txt:
My Story
Hello, my name is Wes. And I’ve been doing music for years now. It was a passion that became a calling while I was still a youth leader at my church. There I gained my artistry. And with that artistry, I became a member of a Christian rap group called The Brotherhood. We later split due to creative differences, which led me to abandon music entirely. I didn't think I would ever make music again. But after a few years of a creative drought, I found my new calling. So, though The Brotherhood's venture was short lived, it made me who I am today and who I am is a music producer. What I want is to give back and truly help make dreams possible for beginning artists.
This is why THE HOUSE was born. It was an act of faith after receiving the calling. I want to create the perfect environment for artists to learn and grow independently through love and support. It is also going to be the main location for The One Song Campaign, a completely free service to help new artists finish their first song. But like any house, this house is in need of support.
And I’m praying that by the grace of God, you will find it in your heart to help in any way you can. Whether it’s monetarily or informational, everything is a blessing. Even prayer will go a long way in the completion of this goal.
**ALL DONATIONS WILL GO DIRECTLY TO THE HOUSE**

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joseph Demaree, In an effort to find my place in this world I have ended up with the label - Artist. I went to school at the Academy of Art in SF riding a grant (1997-2003). I have been playing music since I was 14 and toured with many unique bands (The Unit Breed, Your Mother, Emo Summer, Ringwurm). I have been painting since childhood and continue to grow into tomorrow with each mark. Influenced by the early surrealist, I enjoy capturing my physical surroundings and experience within the non physical expressive kiss of always. If words could paint a picture, when a song sings a painting. I spent two years living on Maui HI painting in plein air and in studio, graced by the islands mana. I now ask for your assistance to fuel my artistic drive into the song and dance of original, independent, entertainment and exploration on this here soil we call The Mainland. 

Please have a look and listen 

http://www.idiomism.com this will take you directly to where you can listen and buy my music.

http://www.josephdemaree.com this will take you into my world of art where you can purchase my art directly. 

https://fineartamerica.com/profiles/joseph-dema... this will take you to where you can buy my original art as well as purchase fine art prints and prints on many different things, like phone cases, throw pillows, shower curtains, etc.. 

Your assistance will help put fuel and repairs into my 1995 Ford Econoline Van / Home. You will be helping me purchase art supplies & maintaining my musical gear. You will be sustaining a living american artist with a high metabolism and an active lifestyle. Along with skateboarding, riding a bike and hiking, painting in plein air all day in all sorts of weather can build quite an appetite. Playing music can keep a performer working late nights with only drink tickets at hand. Your patronage would help keep my cooler stocked with healthier alternatives.

Your funding can help this artist maintain a healthy life style and positive perspective to continue to create a unique, independent vision in the arts and music.

The money raised not only will help support me and my adventures but will be returned to you in trade of CD's, T-shirts, Paintings, Videos, Live Recordings, and a chance for us to possibly meet each other along the way. I would love to set up a show in your home, town, local venue, art gallery, etc. I would also love to make you a painting (portrait, landscape, still life & beyond). Living in a van can be very rewarding but it would be fantastic to be able to find other accommodations.

If you're able to help, here's a list of merchandise I have to offer. 

$5 - Tarot Cards (The Fool, The Magician)

$10 - CD (The Great Smoking Mirror, Joseph Demaree, The Unit Breed, Captain Nowhere, Emo Summer, Ringwurm)

$10 - Coloring Book

$15 - T-Shirt (The Great Smoking Mirror, Kitten Purrr, The Unit Breed) 

$300, $500, $1000 - Original Artwork. I will be painting during my travels and offer first pick of these paintings to you for your support. 

https://pixels.com/profiles/joseph-demaree.html - Click here and you can help by purchasing prints of my artwork:) They are available on many different things like T-Shirts, Coffee Mugs, Beach Towels, etc... 

Sure, there's a chance I could end up penniless with a broken down van on the side of the road. I suppose this would be a good spot to open up my van as a gallery space, until I am mobile again. So good people please help support this artist. I leave Portland OR 5/9/18 and my wallet is almost empty after purchasing a run down van and putting most of my $ into fixing it up. If you can't help financially maybe you could help with suggestions of places to play and paint, have a friend in the arts that might like what I do, know of a community that can dig it and help me with a gallery showing, music gig, accommodations, help finding a record label or manager, know how to convert my van into an electric automobile...:)

My schedule so far:

May 9 - Olympia WA at King Solimon's Reef in the Lounge 212 4th Ave E / 9:30pm

May 10 - Bellingham WA at Boscoe's 118 W Holly St / 8pm 

May 12 - Tacoma WA at The Valley with While I See Sound, Himiko Cloud, Black Ocean Temple / 1206 Puyallup Ave / 8:30pm

May 13 - Seattle WA at Parliament Tavern with Bobby Malvestuto, The Carpenter, Christopher Rogers / 4210 SW Admiral Way 98116 / FREE / 8pm

May 19 - San Jose CA at The Funhouse with Mid-morning Riser / 356 N 16th St / Party Time!

May 21 - Los Angeles CA at The Tygers House / 4430 Fountain Ave / Party Time!

May 23 - North Hollywood CA at Republic of Pie / 8pm / 11118 W Magnolia Blvd

May 24 - Spring Valley CA at The Bancroft Bar / 9:30pm - 12:30am / 9143 Campo Rd

May 25 - San Diego CA at City Pub / 6pm / With: Corea Blue, VCR / 4977 El Cajon Blvd

June 3 - Salt Lake City UT at Hotel RL The Living Stage / 6-8pm / 161 W 600 S

June 6 - Logan UT / Why Sound / All Ages / 7pm / 30 Federal Ave

June 7 - Hailey ID / Sun Valley Brewery / 7-9pm / 202 N Main St

June 10 - Boise ID / High Note Cafe / Brunch Show / 11am - 2pm / 225 N 5th St

June 11 - Moscow ID / One World Cafe / 7-9pm / 533 S Main St

June 25 - Eugene OR / Old Nick’s Pub / With Cigarets and Milk, The Rock Forming Minerals / $5 / 9pm / 21+ / 211 Washington St

June 28 - Medford OR / Johnny B’s Rocking Diner / 9pm / 120 E 6th St

July 10 - San Francisco / Revolution Cafe / 5 - 8:30 pm / 3248 22nd St 

July 12 - North Hollywood CA / Republic of Pie / 6pm / 11118 W Magnolia Blvd

 

Please let other music and art lovers know about me and my upcoming adventure. There's a share button to pass this around. Thank you:)!

story:
ASSOCIATION  C.L.S.I.  PRESENTE:

THE CIRCLE FOR THE LIBERATION OF SOUND AND IMAGE PRESENTS:

FESTIVAL "COULEURS D'AUTOMNE" (EDITION 2020)

"AUTUMN COLOURS" FESTIVAL  (2020 EDITION)

POURQUOI UN FINANCEMENT PARTICIPATIF POUR NOTRE FESTIVAL CETTE ANNÉE?

WHY CROWDFUNDING IS ESSENTIAL FOR OUR FESTIVAL THIS YEAR ?

Ce Festival a été conçu il y a un an et son budget a été construit il y a plus d'un an sur des hypothèses de subvention (3) et de taux de remplissage de la salle qui n'ont plus lieu après la crise sanitaire.

The "Autumn Colours" Festival was conceived more than a year ago, as well as its budget calculated, with certain positive assumptions which were the possibility of obtaining  3 grants, as well as, having a full house of concert goers for each of our 9 concerts. Since the COVID crisis, these assumptions are no longer valid.

D'une part, deux subventions sur les trois demandées nous ont été octroyées (un grand merci à l'ADAMI et à la SPEDIDAM pour avoir cru en notre projet), ce qui correspond à 6000€ de moins que prévu.

On the one hand, we only obtained 2 of 3 grants leaving us 6,000 euros less than needed (thanks very much to ADAMI and SPEDIDAM for having believed in our project and giving us the money we asked them for).

D'autre part les règles sanitaires nous imposent de diviser nos prévisions de recettes par deux (35 personnes par concert au lieu de 70), d'où un manque à gagner de 4725€.

On the other hand, public health regulations, due to the COVID virus, only allow us to have a half full hall, which, is maximum 35 persons for 9 concerts, since our theater hall seats only 70 maximum, which cuts our box office receipts in half causing us to be missing another 4725 euros !

Le budget a donc été revu à la baisse en ayant néanmoins pour objectif de sanctuariser au maximum la rémunération des musiciens et de conserver l'ensemble des concerts prévus. Comment faire?

So, our receipt budget was now 10,725 euros less than our original assumptions.  Still, we wanted to pay our musicians reasonable fees, as well as, keep intact the idea of a 9 concert festival. How to do this ?

A partir de là, deux solutions s'offraient à nous : annuler le festival ou continuer.

Starting there, only two options were left: cancel the festival or to continue...

Nous avons choisi de faire vivre la musique et de maintenir le festival. Heureusement nous avons obtenu un don de 6000€. Reste à trouver... le reste via notre financement participatif.

We decided to continue so that the music we programmed would continue to be played and the festival would be saved. Luckily, we obtained 6,000 euros from an anonymous donor. Still, we need to raise now 4,725 euros in crowd funding ! This means we need at least 68 donors to give 70 euros each to meet our crowd funding goal !!

Votre contribution est donc essentielle pour nous permettre d'atteindre l'équilibre et ainsi pouvoir continuer à défendre les musiques "libres". Nous restons très ouverts dans notre approche esthétique; et souhaitons que différents types de musique contemporaine électronique cohabitent dans le même festival.

Your crowdfunding contributions are now essential to allow us to not only balance our budget, but also continue to program diverse musics that need aesthetic freedom in order to co-exist. Our spirit is to be very open in our aesthetic approach, to let many different types of contemporary electronic music be on the same festival.

Nous sommes conscients que la période est difficile, aussi chaque contributeur pourra écouter l'ensemble des enregistrements du Festival en plus des contreparties déjà prévues. Nous venons que chaque personne qui souhaite écouter les 9 concerts mais ne peut pas venir physiquement, puisse le faire. Une de nos contreparties est donc de pouvoir écouter et réécouter tous les concerts autant de fois que vous le voulez, que vous puissiez venir ou pas au festival, si vous contribuez à la hauteur d'un pass festival (70€)

We are very aware that times are tough for both health reasons, as well as, financial reasons. We want to allow everyone who wants to hear all 9 concerts but who can't attend in person to be able to listen "online" to all concerts. One of our perks will be that, if you can attend, or if you can not attend our festival, you will still be able to listen and relisten to recordings of all our concerts as many times as you wish, if you contribute at least the equivalent of a festival pass (70 euros).

Merci d'avance de nous aider.

Many thanks in advance for helping us.

Programme du festival "COULEURS D'AUTOMNE"

Program of the Festival "AUTUMN COULOURS"

L'édition 2020 du festival « Couleurs d’Automne » effectue un survol des musiques contemporaines électroniques.

The 2020 edition of the festival "AUTUMN COLOURS" takes the form of an overview of contemporary electronic musics.

Pas moins de 9 concerts auront lieu entre le 17 et le 27 septembre au Théâtre Aleph d'Ivry-sur-Seine proposant plusieurs styles de musique électronique contemporaine :

9 different concerts will take place between September 17th and 27th at the Aleph Theatre in Ivry-sur-Seine (Paris) that propose several different styles of contemporary electronic music in works with and without voices, instruments, video and dance:

- rock psychédélique électronique (musiques de Syd Barrett, le 17 et le 18 septembre à 20h30),

-psychedelic rock music with electronic sounds, voice, and instruments mixed in (music of Syd Barrett, September 17th and 18th at 20H30).

- théâtre musical électroacoustique avec vidéo (concerts de Gérard Pape le 19 septembre et de Olga Krashenko le 26 septembre à 20h30),

-electroacoustic music theatre  with voices and instruments mixed in as well as video (concerts of Gerard Pape the 19th of September and of Olga Krashenko  the 26th of September, both at 20h30).

- musiques électroacoustiques et mixtes (concert de Paul Méfano le 20 septembre à 18h30 à l'occasion de la sortie de son nouveau CD "Luftklang"),

-electroacoustic music only  as well as music that mixes voices, instruments and electroacoustic sounds (concert of Paul Mefano the 20th of September at 18h30 on the occasion of the release of his new CD "Luftklang" on the ACEL label)

- musique acousmatique (concert de Alexandre Yterce le 25 septembre à 20h30)

-acousmatic music only as well as with dance and video (concert of Alexandre Yterce the 25th of September at 20h30)

- musique électroacoustique et mixte (concert en hommage à Françoise Barrière le 27 septembre à 18h30).

-electroacoustic music only as well as music that mixes voice and electroacoustic sounds and video (concert in homage to Françoise Barrière the 27th of September at 18h30).

Our spirit is to be very open in our aesthetic approach, to let many different types of contemporary electronic music be on the same festival.Nous sommes conscients que la période est difficile, aussi chaque contributeur pourra écouter l'ensemble des enregistrements du Festival en plus des contreparties déjà prévues. Nous venons que chaque personne qui souhaite écouter les 9 concerts mais ne peut pas venir physiquement, puisse le faire. Une de nos contreparties est donc de pouvoir écouter et réécouter tous les concerts autant de fois que vous le voulez, que vous puissiez venir ou pas au festival, si vous contribuez à la hauteur d'un pass festival (70€)We are very aware that times are tough for both health reasons, as well as, financial reasons. We want to allow everyone who wants to hear all 9 concerts but who can't attend in person to be able to listen "online" to all concerts. One of our perks will be that, if you can attend, or if you can not attend our festival, you will still be able to listen and relisten to recordings of all our concerts as many times as you wish, if you contribute at least the equivalent of a festival pass (70 euros).Merci d'avance de nous aider.Many thanks in advance for helping us.Programme du festival "COULEURS D'AUTOMNE"Program of the Festival "AUTUMN COULOURS"L'édition 2020 du festival « Couleurs d’Automne » effectue un survol des musiques contemporaines électroniques.The 2020 edition of the festival "AUTUMN COLOURS" takes the form of an overview of contemporary electronic musics.Pas moins de 9 concerts auront lieu entre le 17 et le 27 septembre au Théâtre Aleph d'Ivry-sur-Seine proposant plusieurs styles de musique électronique contemporaine :9 different concerts will take place between September 17th and 27th at the Aleph Theatre in Ivry-sur-Seine (Paris) that propose several different styles of contemporary electronic music in works with and without voices, instruments, video and dance:- rock psychédélique électronique (musiques de Syd Barrett, le 17 et le 18 septembre à 20h30),-psychedelic rock music with electronic sounds, voice, and instruments mixed in (music of Syd Barrett, September 17th and 18th at 20H30).- théâtre musical électroacoustique avec vidéo (concerts de Gérard Pape le 19 septembre et de Olga Krashenko le 26 septembre à 20h30),-electroacoustic music theatre  with voices and instruments mixed in as well as video (concerts of Gerard Pape the 19th of September and of Olga Krashenko  the 26th of September, both at 20h30).- musiques électroacoustiques et mixtes (concert de Paul Méfano le 20 septembre à 18h30 à l'occasion de la sortie de son nouveau CD "Luftklang"),-electroacoustic music only  as well as music that mixes voices, instruments and electroacoustic sounds (concert of Paul Mefano the 20th of September at 18h30 on the occasion of the release of his new CD "Luftklang" on the ACEL label)- musique acousmatique (concert de Alexandre Yterce le 25 septembre à 20h30)-acousmatic music only as well as with dance and video (concert of Alexandre Yterce the 25th of September at 20h30)- musique électroacoustique et mixte (concert en hommage à Françoise Barrière le 27 septembre à 18h30).-electroacoustic music only as well as music that mixes voice and electroacoustic sounds and video (concert in homage to Françoise Barrière the 27th of September at 18h30).

story:
Bref Résumé:

Nous sommes un groupe de musiciens incarnant des Rangers de l'espace tout droit  sortis de feuilletons japonais d’avant les années 2000  pour animer des conventions avec notre énergie!

Nos besoins et récompenses:

Nous devons récolter un maximum de ressources financières pour mener à terme ce projet. Nous proposerons aux contribuables, des articles tels que l’album complet dédicacé, des t-shirt, illustration, et rencontre avec le groupe.

story:
American Originals

Agave and Reginald Mobley are teaming up for American Originals, their third recording project featuring the music of underrepresented composers. We love Bach, Beethoven, and Brahms – we were raised on and inspired by those guys – but, this album features great music by composers you've never heard of, all composers of color, and all truly American Originals.  The incomparable Florence Price, the first woman of color to have a work performed by a major American orchestra; Esteban Salas, Cuba's first known classical composer; Scott Joplin, the brilliant ragtime pianist who started out laboring on the railroads; and Justin Holland, a guitar virtuoso and friend of Frederick Douglass (who also happened to play the violin!).

Agave, Reggie, and Geoffrey Silver from the Acis Productions label will be in Fresno, California from September 21 through 26 to record this beautiful and powerful music, most or all of which you may never have heard before. We're excited to work with Geoffrey and the Acis team for the first time!  Please join us on our adventure battling smoky California air and a global pandemic that has our lives and musical season turned on its head. We're here to bring more Black and brown voices to your playlist – voices that should be part of the musical canon, and with your help, they will!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $18,000 to fully fund American Originals.  But, we've got money coming in from a few other sources, including our digital presentations for SFEMS (San Francisco Early Music Society) and Sonoma Bach.  So, our campaign goal is $12,000.

Perks

We have some fun perks for your donations!  Our friend and brilliant photographer, Gary Payne has taken some great shots of us, including the "Power V" photo that leads our campaign. We're making American Originals "Power V" refrigerator magnets, masks, and autographed posters. We'll also offer autographed CDs, virtual private lessons, virtual concerts, and even a real, in-person garden concert, if you have the space for it!

The Impact

Black and brown composers have been creating great music for centuries, but racism in the classical music world has systematically shut them out of the 'canon' of western music – those composers whose names and works we hear repeated day in and day out in the concert hall and on the radio, and study as the bedrock of our musical heritage. Don't get us wrong, we absolutely love Bach, Beethoven, and Brahms, and have made our livelihoods performing their masterworks. This album is a step toward righting this injustice and shining light on the many contributions of American composers to the diverse, multicultural world that classical music can - and ought - to be. It will change your perspective, as it has ours.

Our track record

Founded in 2008, Agave has recorded four commercial albums. Cold Genius was Agave's first, a self-released disc featuring restoration-era English music by Purcell, Lawes, Locke, Matteis, and other brooding but sparkling works. For the next three albums, Agave teamed up with the VGo Recordings label. Friend of Ferdinand (2013), a long time favorite on the radio, features music from the courts of the Holy Roman Emperors in 17th century Vienna, including Schmelzer, Biber, Ferro, Granata, and other not exactly household names. Queen of Heaven, released in 2015, was devoted completely to music by Isabella Leonarda, a 17th century Italian nun whose publishing career spanned over 60 years, and whose unique voice shines on this disc. It was Agave's first collaboration with countertenor Reginald L. Mobley.  In 2018, Agave and Reggie released Peace In Our Time, music from the shadow of the Thirty Years' War, a conflagration that decimated not only human life, but also culture.  These composers–Johann Christoph and Heinrich Bach, Pohle, Weckmann, Scheidt, and Tunder–drew inspiration from what they experienced around them, be it gentle, harsh, pedestrian, or sublime.  

This will be Agave's fifth album and our third with Reggie, and we are quite confident that with the help of Acis Productions, we know how to make a beautiful sounding, looking, and compelling disc that delights, educates, and inspires.

Budget Summary

$1,000 Travel

$0 Venue rental (in kind)

$1,900 Pandemic-safe lodging

[$5,000] Engineering, editing (in house, in kind)

$3,000 Producing

$500 Licensing

$1,000 Package design

$2,500 CD manufacturing

$400 Mastering

$8,000 Paying ourselves (hoping we can raise enough for this!)

Risks & Challenges

We recorded our past three albums in Fresno, California, in Fresno City College's beautifully-restored OAB auditorium. We had all of the details worked out, including scheduling for a quiet time of year and getting to know the custodian who could help us track down and turn off all six air conditioners (!) in the building. With campuses across the world shut down due to COVID-19, OAB is not available to us this time. However, we have found another venue in Fresno, First Congregational Church, a.k.a. the Big Red Church. It is a spacious room with a big, sweet acoustic. In July, we recorded some excerpts from American Originals for our upcoming virtual performance engagements in Big Red Church.  It was a wonderful opportunity to get to know it.  You can see and hear some of this footage in our campaign video, above. We have the kinks worked out, and we are rarin' to go–fire, smoke, and pandemic be damned!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in our project, please help us by sharing this campaign on social media, spreading the word by all of the newfangled and old fashioned means, including word of mouth, and by utilizing IndieGoGo's share tools, right here.

Thank you for your support!

-Agave, Reggie, and the Acis Productions team

story:
Help Launch Tj’s country album, Lonesome Old Road!

 

 

Overview

 

Is there anything better than Montana country music? If you have never had the opportunity to hear any of this music, let me take a second to describe the sound to you. It is music that is very familiar to you. 

 

You know the stuff that reminds you of being at a country dance on a great summer night.  Music that reminds you of Merle Haggard, Waylon Jennings, Charlie Pride…. you get the point.  The country music that we grew up listening to, but mixed with just a little bit of edge here and there.  Real country.  Not the pop-country that mainstream radio is giving us these days.

 

My newest album, Lonesome Old Road is exactly that.  The real country you would hear played at countless country dances in Montana.  The songs have stories that you can relate to.  Real things about real people. 

 

History 

 

This album has been in the works for over a year and a half.  It started when I recorded my first single from the album, Small Town Prison.  Since then I have written several songs, picked out the best ones (and a couple of covers of some classic country songs) to get recorded.  The album is almost done, we just need to finish a couple of things 

 

Being an independent artist is both challenging and rewarding these days, especially when it comes to the financial end.  I love the freedom. I love being able to call my own shots and make the music that I want.  I love that so many dedicated county music lovers want to bypass labels and big corporations to support me directly!  I can’t really tell you how much I appreciate that. 

The Album

 

This album consists of 10 songs, eight originals, and two cover songs.  The majority of the record was recorded in my studio in Montana, with some additional instruments and the mixing and mastering done at Opal Studios in Portland Oregon by extraordinary producer Kevin Hahn.  

 

 

I wanted to stay as far from Nashville as I could when making this record because I didn’t want it to sound just like everything else that is coming out of the studios there right now.

 

I wanted it to be unique and sound like Montana.  That was where Kevin comes in.  I have known him for many, many years as he is married to a school mate of mine.  In fact, her Grandma lives on the ranch right across the road from where my family ranch is.

 

When it came time to finally start making the record, I knew he was the right guy for the job.  In fact, he described to me exactly what sound and style I was going for even before I was able to tell him what I was thinking. 

A match made in heaven.  

 

 

Behind the scenes and budget.

 

Having said all that - one thing that you really need in order to do anything (i.e. produce a great-sounding album, print march, tour, get the songs out to the masses, etc.)— is funding.  

 

 

 

What does it take to make an album like this?  Well, a lot.

 

In this case, financial speaking, it takes a lot more than what this campaign goal is asking. In fact, the goal I am asking for is just a very small portion of the total cost of the album and promotion.

 

For those interested in how it works, a budget like this for a mid-level album is very common (often much more)  and the money is typically fronted by a band label, which they have to pay back through album sales and touring.

 

I have decided to take the more challenging path of not signing with a record label and releasing the album under my own label, Cross J Records.  

 

That means I, alone, am responsible for funding my music, making every last detail come together, and promoting it.

 

It is a lot of responsibility.

 

But I have found the reward of doing this with my fans to be far more rewarding than anything I could have imagined.

 

From the time my very first single, Small Town Prison was released, I have had several people send me messages of encouragement, asking me to complete the album so they could hear more of my songs.

 

I love being transparent and want you to know the challenges I face as an independent artist.  I take huge pride in the TOTALLY AMAZING SUPPORT country music fans from all around the world have shown me.  Without you, I could not have gotten so far.  There is nothing in this world like country music fans, you are awesome.

 

The journey on this lonely old road has been long and hard to get to this point, but it has been 100% worth it.  I can’t wait to share the rest of the album with you.  

 

I would be absolutely honored if you decided to partner with me and help with the final completion of this album and It’s release very soon!

story:
Hi, Music Lovers all over the World!

My name is Ja Hsieh. I am a percussionist who is originally from Taiwan. Currently, I am performing and teaching in San Jose, California in the U.S. I am excited to present my second CD, “Lambada” Percussion Recording Project, on this great fundraising website. I finished the recording on Dec. 2019, and I am trying to raise the funds to release it. If you like music, please take a look at this project, and consider donating to help bring it to completion.

  • This is my second percussion album

I was extremely lucky to have so many backers to support my first album, which resulted in a great deal of inspiring feedback. After 5 years, I decided to produce this 2nd album Lambada. On this percussion recording, you will hear Piazzolla’s compositions “Oblivion” and “La Muerte Del Angel” on vibes. There are also solo versions of “Over the Rainbow,” “Cavatina,” (from the movie “ The Deer Hunter,”) and Kansas’ famous tune “Dust In the Wind.” In addition, you will also find a challenging and exhilarating piece “Drum Dances” with me on drum set and Irene Yang on piano.

  • The Diversity of Sound on the Album

The album covers a lot of sonic ground, there are pieces with solo vibraphone, vibraphone with piano, and drum set with piano. Some of the tunes included on this recording are vocal and instrumental classics. The melodies themselves are simple, yet so beautiful. They are timeless and still popular among listeners decades later. You will hear tunes ranging from very melodic to extremely rhythmic. This album is one you will enjoy listening to at any time for any occasion.

  • We need your help

In order to complete this project, we really need your help. The main costs are recording, mixing, mastering, distribution, printing, song licensings, and renting venues. It’s not easy to record a percussion album like this because the transportation of percussion instruments and gear is more challenging than almost any other instrument. In addition to learning and playing the music, percussionists have to devote a great deal of time considering how to set up, and how to move the instruments from place to place. If you are interested in gorgeous music, please consider donating to this project. To check the album out, click the link below. I’d like to share my music with you and other listeners all over the World.

Hi 大家好

我是打擊樂家—謝家豪。目前在美國加州聖荷西從事演奏和教學的工作。很期待即將發行第二張個人打擊樂演奏專輯。在這張唱片裡，您可以聽到探戈大師的經典樂曲Oblivion、La Muerte De Angel ;獨奏曲目也包括了: Over the Rainbow、選自電影越戰獵鹿人的主題曲Cavatina、選自堪薩斯樂團的Dust in the Wind。這張專輯很榮幸能與充滿熱情且技巧一流的台灣鋼琴家楊欣樺合作錄音；並共同挑戰一首節奏複雜、演奏難度高的爵士鼓與鋼琴二重奏的現代作品Drum Dances。

這張專輯有很多經典的器樂曲，大部分我選擇以鐵琴來詮釋這次的錄音。其中多首音樂旋律雋永、刻劃人心，我相信這些旋律都能經得起時間的考驗，值得愛樂者一聽再聽。

要完成一張打擊樂專輯的背後，需要經過很多籌劃及人力的幫忙。專輯主要的預算有後製、混音、錄音、通路、印刷和場地費用等。如果您對這樣的音樂類型有興趣，歡迎您來贊助這張專輯的製作;如果您喜歡好聽的器樂曲目，更別忘了參考專輯內容並點開相關連結，希望可以跟喜愛打擊樂的朋友們一同分享我的音樂!

謝謝大家觀看這支影片，下次很快再見面!
