There are also solo versions of “Over the Rainbow,” “Cavatina,” (from the movie “ The Deer Hunter,”) and Kansas’ famous tune “Dust In the Wind.” In addition, you will also find a challenging and exhilarating piece “Drum Dances” with me on drum set and Irene Yang on piano.



The Diversity of Sound on the Album

The album covers a lot of sonic ground, there are pieces with solo vibraphone, vibraphone with piano, and drum set with piano. Some of the tunes included on this recording are vocal and instrumental classics. The melodies themselves are simple, yet so beautiful. They are timeless and still popular among listeners decades later. You will hear tunes ranging from very melodic to extremely rhythmic. This album is one you will enjoy listening to at any time for any occasion.

We need your help
In order to complete this project, we really need your help. The main costs are recording, mixing, mastering, distribution, printing, song licensings, and renting venues. It’s not easy to record a percussion album like this because the transportation of percussion instruments and gear is more challenging than almost any other instrument. In addition to learning and playing the music, percussionists have to devote a great deal of time considering how to set up, and how to move the instruments from place to place. If you are interested in gorgeous music, please consider donating to this project. To check the album out, click the link below. I’d like to share my music with you and other listeners all over the World.



Hi 大家好
我是打擊樂家—謝家豪。目前在美國加州聖荷西從事演奏和教學的工作。很期待即將發行第二張個人打擊樂演奏專輯。在這張唱片裡，您可以聽到探戈大師的經典樂曲Oblivion、La Muerte De Angel ;獨奏曲目也包括了: Over the Rainbow、選自電影越戰獵鹿人的主題曲Cavatina、選自堪薩斯樂團的Dust in the Wind。這張專輯很榮幸能與充滿熱情且技巧一流的台灣鋼琴家楊欣樺合作錄音；並共同挑戰一首節奏複雜、演奏難度高的爵士鼓與鋼琴二重奏的現代作品Drum Dances。
這張專輯有很多經典的器樂曲，大部分我選擇以鐵琴來詮釋這次的錄音。其中多首音樂旋律雋永、刻劃人心，我相信這些旋律都能經得起時間的考驗，值得愛樂者一聽再聽。
要完成一張打擊樂專輯的背後，需要經過很多籌劃及人力的幫忙。專輯主要的預算有後製、混音、錄音、通路、印刷和場地費用等。如果您對這樣的音樂類型有興趣，歡迎您來贊助這張專輯的製作;如果您喜歡好聽的器樂曲目，更別忘了參考專輯內容並點開相關連結，希望可以跟喜愛打擊樂的朋友們一同分享我的音樂!
謝謝大家觀看這支影片，下次很快再見面!

story:
Why 1820 The Musical Soundtrack?

1820 The Musical is a riveting story surrounding the lives of historical religious figures, Joseph and Emma Smith. Through a series of vignettes, it speaks to the human experience of love, loss, faith, trial, sacrifice, injustice, healing, and hope forged in the religious fervor of 19th Century America. The script was written by award-winning playwright, George Nelson, who has had success with plays Off-Broadway and around the world. The sibling songwriting trio, Doug Lowe, Kendra Lowe Holt, & Kayliann Lowe Juarez, has numerous placements in Film/TV and radio singles, including songs on the Billboard Top 10 charts. 

The stage production was set to debut earlier this year in Salt Lake City, Los Angeles, and Phoenix, but has been postponed due to Covid. Many who purchased tickets and are eagerly anticipating a future premiere have requested a soundtrack while they wait. 

The creative team heard your request and is pleased to answer your call for an official soundtrack of 1820 The Musical! Do we need your help? Yes! Are we asking you to donate today and help fund this massive endeavor? Yes! Do we actually need your help? Yes! In the same breath, this campaign is about more than just raising funds. Rather, it is a way to stay connected with each of you by getting this infectious music into your hands and speakers. By pre-ordering the soundtrack today, you literally become co-creator with us for this riveting drama. Our hope is that by the time we are able to meet together to watch the musical unfold in person, you will know every song lyric and melody and truly be one of the cast members as you sing along with us in the theater!

What We Need & What You Get

We have 19 songs that are in various stages of completion (watch the video that gives you sneak peeks of several songs from the soundtrack!), with multiple lead vocalists, ensemble singers, live musicians, string sessions, track production, mixing, and distribution. We have A-list players and award-winning producers involved (including Grammy-nominated) and need YOUR help to raise $50,000 in order to present this soundtrack to you on a sparkling silver platter. (*Note that NONE of these funds raised will go to pay the the songwriters. This campaign will cover hard costs of production expenses and Indiegogo fees ONLY. This is truly a labor of love to get the music into your hands so you don't have to wait a second longer!)

Perks you can expect:

-Digital Download and/or Signed Physical CD Copy of the Soundtrack

-Listening Party Access 

-Signed Hand-written Song Lyric of Your Choice

-60 min Songwriting Mentoring Session with Songwriting Team

-60 min Script Mentoring Session with Director George Nelson 

-House Concert (with Lead Characters and/or Core Cast)

-Soundtrack Co-Executive Producer / Executive Producer

-60 Min Q&A Zoom Call with Creative Team

-Songwriting Session (Write a Song with the Songwriting Team)

-Theatre Tickets / Meet & Greet Passes

-Pay it Forward and Share with Friends and Family - 10 copy package

These exclusive perks have been intimately curated by the creative team with YOU in mind and are ONLY accessible through THIS campaign. Don't miss your chance to take advantage of this unique opportunity! Pre-order now!

The Impact

By pre-ordering the soundtrack right here on Indiegogo today, you are literally helping answer the call of numerous others requesting to "get this music out there." As previously mentioned, the sibling songwriting trio has multiple Film/TV credits, Top 10 Billboard songs on the radio, and decades of experience headlining stage shows internationally. One can expect a multi-genre soundtrack, with something for everyone. Music has a way of bringing people together, and the positive responses from the various readings and previews associated with this musical have been overwhelming.

Risks & Challenges

The creative team brings years of experience recording and creating music projects professionally. Kendra has worked on various celebrity albums and TV shows; Kayliann is a studio session singer in Nashville, with clients including iHeart Radio; Doug is a film producer with endless recording and production credits. As a result, the risks and challenges associated with this soundtrack have mostly been related to moving the project forward in multiple states in America during quarantine, while still adhering to Covid-19 regulations. For example, studio sessions have either been done virtually or with social distancing and mask-wearing. Nashville has carried the bulk of the lead vocals and tracking sessions with live musicians, while Salt Lake City has undertaken the string and ensemble vocal sessions, as well as stellar Grammy-nominated producers who program gorgeous loops, textures, and sounds to make the songs sparkle like "The Greatest Showman." We are passionate about this music and have gladly lost sleep and even at times, our sanity, in order to make this soundtrack a reality for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize this has been a wild and unstable year for people financially. Do you feel the pull to contribute but don't presently have the funds to do so? Here are other ways you can still help!

  • Spread the word.
  • Did we mention, SPREAD THE WORD?
  • Help us get the word out about this campaign and make some noise!
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools to share this link to your social media pages. 
  • Text this link to friends and family, or ask a neighbor if they'll "pay it forward" and contribute for you to have a copy of this soundtrack!
  • Like and Follow 1820 The Musical on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and Spotify (@1820Musical). Once the music is delivered to everyone who participated in the campaign, we will release the music on Spotify for you to stream. We will also do give-aways on our social media accounts, so please FOLLOW along!
  • https://www.facebook.com/1820Musical
  • https://www.instagram.com/1820musical
  • https://open.spotify.com/user/t08gr2qe2p8roftzb... (1820 Musical Account) (It is crucial to click the FOLLOW button on Spotify so you can be alerted when we release the music here.)
  • https://twitter.com/1820musical

story:
I'm Jerome, a singer-songwriter and rapper from Zimbabwe, and I'm heading into the studio in November to record with an amazing producer. Bringing together hip-hop and African vibes, Mr Arab will be my debut album, after years of releases.

In order for the album to happen there are 3 things that I'd love for you to do right now:

1. Pick your perk (to the right)

2. Contribute  

3. Help spread the word!!

I would greatly appreciate it if YOU could help turn this dream into reality and join me on my journey!

 

Singer, songwriter, rapper, producer, poet, creative, director, actor... I am an all-round entertainer driven by hiphop, inspired by sounds of soul and RnB. I am an MC that rides a beat like a dancehall artist with an English twang at times due to the grime scene I lived in. I am African to the core but a child of the world.

I have collaborated and shared the stage with several international artists, producers and songwriters, including Raekwon, 112, J.P. Cooper, Ian Devany (“Been Around the World”, Lisa Stansfield), DJ Mark One, and Cassper Nyovest. I have released singles on labels including InHouse Records (USA), Stoney Boy Music (Sweden), Underrated Individuals Records (Netherlands) and Killertraxx (Italy). My music has charted internationally on the beatport EDM charts, and has been played in over thirty countries worldwide.

 

Mr Arab is my debut album. It is not just a studio album but also a collection of stories from the heart. My jumping board is my life. I look at expectations of masculinity, and the insecurities that can arise; struggles in love; and the pressure of trying to make it in life.  But the overall message is a conversation on hope and love. 

Mr Arab is my first full-length studio album, produced by Louis Chivat (Wiley, The Game, AM Sniper). The tracks are written and the plan is to release the album in February 2019.  But those who have the ALL ACCESS PASS will get a listen much earlier.

 

The Producer/ Beatmaker (aka Louis Chivat): to make the music with and give us the quality of sound we need 

Studio/Sound Engineer : to assist with the recording 

Mastering: Essential for radio play, it makes sure it is the same frequency as the tracks on commercial radio and gives us a full sound.

Distribution (The Hills Entertainment Group): To get the album out to as many people as possible 

PR Campaign: To spread the word and market the album 

Manufacturing: To print limited edition physical copies

Development funds for the tour: to create the live show, incorporating dance and theatre, and develop creative workshops encouraging  individual expression

As you can see by this pie chart, recording an album can be an expensive process! I've broken the costs down for you so that you know what's being spent and where. At the end of the day, we want the music to sound AMAZING, right!?!

 

I'm looking to raise £7,000 to start with.  This goes towards the production, mastering, distribution, and manufacturing of the album, as well as a solid PR campaign. 

What I need to complete the project is £10,000. With this, we will be able to professionally document the making of the album. It will also fund the development of the live show, which will incorporate theatre, dance and poetry on stage. The funds will pay for a videographer, editor, sound guy, rehearsal space and artist fees.

£15 000 will fund two professionally shot music videos, as well as an Unplugged Session of the album that will be filmed and uploaded on social media.

To achieve my ultimate vision for the project which includes a world tour, I need £20,000-£25,000. This would allow us to put on the Mr Arab show in it's full glory, with a full team (band, sound engineer, lighting engineer, visuals etc) in a recognised venue, and to film it and market it to promoters around the world. 

 

I will be working with producer Louis Chivat, who has a string of credits to his name and has worked with numerous UK & USA charting acts (Cool & Dre, The Game, Wiley, AM Sniper, Curren$y), and co-writer Edwin Mutema, a hugely talented Zambian singer song-writer. For live instrumentation, I will bring in Samuel Masta (guitar), Rodwell Mwepu (bass) and Kasonde Sunkutu (drums). Respected sound engineer Paul Kruz will be engineer on the project - he has  worked on projects for east African heavy-weights including Diamond Platinumz and Alikiba.

 

There are some amazing perks for you to choose from: check out the full list on the right ==>

This is the perk which I feel is the most value for money: ALL ACCESS PASS (Soft Copy)! 
 You get added to the private Facebook group and will get EXCLUSIVE ACCESS to the whole process, including PHOTOS, LIVE STREAMS, listening to unreleased DEMOS, UPDATES, the DIGITAL ALBUM and a PERSONAL VIDEO THANK posted on my Facebook.

If you're into merch, then RAISE THE FLAG is a great deal for you! You get the ALBUM T-SHIRT,  TOTE BAG, LIMITED EDITION SIGNED CD, DIGITAL ALBUM, ALL ACCESS PASS and  a bag of my FAVOURITE COFFEE!

Get involved by: preordering the album, booking me for public or private gigs, chatting to me on skype,  taking me for coffee (ok, no perk, just take me for coffee!), and a bunch of stuff in the perks section on your right>>>

 

Chasing a record deal is not as lucrative as many may think. Really, it's just a big loan and I would lose rights to my music. But who needs a record deal when I've got family, friends and fans, the people that have seen me at my best and at my worst but still stuck by me through my crazy decisions. Even if you didn't understand them, I hope they make sense now. I know we can make this project happen and that is why I am doing this campaign.

I have recorded hundreds of tracks (released and unreleased) and built up quite the catalog working with other musicians, artists, producers and DJ's. What better time to work on the album than now? The biggest challenge I face as an independent artist is the proper resources to develop this body of work to its full potential. I am fortunate to be surrounded by people who love music, love art, love passion, love life, and are who are willing to support a dreamer.

 

If it's not possible to financially contribute towards my campaign, it's cool, I get it! There are still things you can do that would make a huge difference and that don't cost a thing.

It would be AMAZING if you could share my video or campaign through your social media or chat to your aunt, dad, boss, girlfriend, bartender, neighbour....you never know who's going to want to help turn this dream into reality! In whatever way you are able to support the making of this album, I thank you. 

Looking forward to sharing the music with you all.

__________________________________________________________________________________________

story:
"György Kurtág’s compositions have left an indelible imprint on twentieth century music history. His stark, concentrated, intensely expressive style has made him an icon of minimal music, able to evoke whole universes in just a few bars"

Due to his highly personal sensitive style and demands, relatively very little is recorded up till now. Four well-known musicians who have intensely worked on this music, also with the composer himself, decided to now record the most prolific works for their instruments.

You could be part of this fantastic project by helping us financing the costs we make for recording, promotion and lay-out. 

Soprano Viktoriia Vitrenko, violinist David Grimal, cimbalist Luigi Gaggero and double bassist Niek de Groot all worked together in several formations before. We all find it very important this unparalleled music is recorded and documented.

The German label AUDITE is known for its exquisite projects and great sounding recordings. We think that will enhance Kurtág's music in the best way possible.

We will record;

-Szenen aus einem Roman

-Erinnerung an einen Winterabend

-Einige Sätze aus den Sudelbüchern Georg Christoph Lichtenbergs

-Hét Dal

-Errinerungsgeraüsche

-8 Duos

Recordings will take place in Hannover in the Leibniz Saal on December 9-12 2018. The release is planned for autumn 2019. A presentation concert with the CD's repertoire will take place on November 2nd 2019 in the Essen Philharmonie during the 'NOW' Festival. 

We are very inspired for this project and invest a lot of our time and effort. However the costs on top of that for making and promoting such a CD, are euro 16.000.
story_txt:
"György Kurtág’s compositions have left an indelible imprint on twentieth century music history. His stark, concentrated, intensely expressive style has made him an icon of minimal music, able to evoke whole universes in just a few bars"
Due to his highly personal sensitive style and demands, relatively very little is recorded up till now. Four well-known musicians who have intensely worked on this music, also with the composer himself, decided to now record the most prolific works for their instruments.
You could be part of this fantastic project by helping us financing the costs we make for recording, promotion and lay-out. 
Soprano Viktoriia Vitrenko, violinist David Grimal, cimbalist Luigi Gaggero and double bassist Niek de Groot all worked together in several formations before. We all find it very important this unparalleled music is recorded and documented.
The German label AUDITE is known for its exquisite projects and great sounding recordings. We think that will enhance Kurtág's music in the best way possible.
We will record;
-Szenen aus einem Roman
-Erinnerung an einen Winterabend
-Einige Sätze aus den Sudelbüchern Georg Christoph Lichtenbergs
-Hét Dal
-Errinerungsgeraüsche
-8 Duos
Recordings will take place in Hannover in the Leibniz Saal on December 9-12 2018. The release is planned for autumn 2019. A presentation concert with the CD's repertoire will take place on November 2nd 2019 in the Essen Philharmonie during the 'NOW' Festival. 
We are very inspired for this project and invest a lot of our time and effort. However the costs on top of that for making and promoting such a CD, are euro 16.000.

story:
Goodnight Little Machines: 19 Lullabies and Anthems for Little Machines, is a brand new album of constantly surprising and beautiful music by acclaimed producer and composer, Sxip Shirey. The project includes amazing visual art and film inspired by the music.

Sxip Shirey is a New York City based producer, composer, and artist. He tours internationally with the circus theater production LIMBO and is responsible for creating the show's iconic soundtrack. Sxip is a United States Artist Fellow, has been a featured performer at TED, and teaches workshops at the Norwegian Theater Academy. His music has appeared in numerous films and theater pieces, including NEIL GAIMAN'S "Statuesque". He has been a musical guest with WELCOME TO NIGHT VALE, toured with the DRESDEN DOLLS, played MADONNA'S birthday party and continues to play underground parties New York City. He and his creative partner COCO KAROL create immersive choir pieces that have been performed in Central Park and The Sydney Opera House.

 

The main reward for this campaign is the album, Goodnight Little Machines, by Sxip Shirey. In addition, we are excited to include the 120-minute "Stoya, The Sound Track," which he made for the film "Graphic Depictions". Other rewards include incredible art prints by Tracy Greenwald, Funquest, and Jim Shirey, and a limited edition set of linocut prints by Andrew Baird. Every reward at the $25 level and above receives both a digital and a CD copy of Goodnight Little Machines. At the $5000 level, you can even receive Goodnight Little Machines on vinyl, as part of an exclusive rare edition of the album.

The Goodnight Little Machines album and crowdfunding campaign features work by a number of other talented artists, including illustrator Zelda Devon, author Maria Dahvana Headley, designer/director Chris Green,  choreographer Coco Karol, Australian artist Shaun Tan, costume and clothing designer Brett Henderson Kreuter (Also known as Muffinhead),  painter Tracy Greenwald, illustrator Michael Arthur, Japanese/NYC street artist Funquest, photographer and artist Jim Shirey, Tasmanian artist Andrew Baird. and New Zealand animator Rafael Sandino de LeonThe album itself is being engineered, mixed and mastered by Don Godwin.

 

  • ​$3 - Stoya, The Sound Track. You get  a digital album of amazing music, which will arrive within 24 hours of claiming this reward.

  • $10 - . You get a digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines. Also includes the "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.
  • $25 - Goodnight Little Machines . You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines and "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.

  • $50 - Art and Music.You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines and five mini art prints. Also includes "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.
  • $100 - Tracy Art and Music.You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines and an amazing Tracy Greenwald art print. Also includes the "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.

  • $100 - Funquest Art and Music. You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines and an amazing Funquest art print. Also includes the Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.

$100 - Jim Shirey Art and Music. You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines and an amazing Jim Shirey art print. Also includes the ""Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.

  • $150 - Andrew Baird Art and Music .You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines and an amazing ultra limited edition Andrew Baird linocut print. Also includes the  "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.


$200 - Sxip Shirey Original Art and Music.You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines and an amazing hand drawn piece of original art by Sxip Shirey. Also includes the "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.


$500 - A Bundle of Art and Music. You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines, the Shaun Tan mini art prints, and one regular art print. Also includes the "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.


$1000 - A Song Just For You. Sxip Shirey will compose a song for you that you can keep forever. The song will be delivered to you both on CD and in digital format. Also includes the album Goodnight Little Machines in both digital and physical formats, plus the "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.

$2000 - All The Good Things.You get physical and digital copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines, five mini art prints, and an original drawing by Sxip Shirey. Also includes the ""Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.

$5000 - Vinyl Record. You get copies of the album Goodnight Little Machines on digital, CD, and vinyl record formats. Also includes five mini art prints, and the "Stoya, The Sound Track" reward.

Thank you so much for all your support! We couldn't do this without you. Your contribution to this campaign will make it possible for Sxip Shirey to make Goodnight Little Machines a truly incredible artistic experience. You are helping make art, and we are profoundly grateful to you.

Photo by Kyle Cassidy        .      Art by Jim Shirey

story:
CARMAN SPECIALTY PROJECT:

 

CARMAN OFFERS A ‘’FREE’’ 10 SONG LEGACY RECORD ON HIS NEW FUNDING CAMPAIGN AS A THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT at www.CarmanTour.com

 

In this day and age, my music projects are not funded by big record companies- but by you. You are the people I make the music for. So nothing stands between what I create and what you want to hear.

 

You know my life has been a series of miracles. Many of you have prayed me through those extreme highs and lows. I have soared, singing before stadiums of people worshipping God and in 2013 I’ve been shot down with a diagnosis of incurable multiple myeloma cancer. I’ve had the exhilaration of making 35 music videos and the grief of accompanying my friend in prison to his execution on death row. I’ve known the honor of being inducted to the gospel music hall of fame and the horror of watching my dearest friends die from fatal diseases in the prime of life. In just this past year I’ve enjoyed the high of getting married, becoming the stepfather of 6 and the grandfather of 9 to the unexpected passing of my mother with her wonderful gift of music that she passed onto me

This whole time I have chronicled my life in songs and videos. And then put those songs in YOUR hands to help you celebrate life’s victories and sustain you through lifes challenges.

 

It’s time to once again set life to music. This time I want to record a new Christmas and worship record and then do a Christmas tour in 2019. And as always I need your support every step of the way.

I have a series a great rewards for those of you who give to this project.

I NEED YOU TO HELP ME set life to music. ALL GIFTS ARE 100Z% TAX DEDUCTIBLE. It’s time to make NEW MUSIC FOR A NEW GENERATION. It’s this music that creates the concerts that changes the lives and has brought over a million souls to Christ.

story:
The Videoclip 

"Es tan natural" was written as a therapy in a cold winter day by Ronny. He was inspired by the cycles of life, of birth and death and talks about the harmony of the ups and downs of human nature and the importance of a peaceful life respecting the environment.  Our aim is to spread and empower the message of acceptance, love and respect that Ronny wants to communicate to the world. 

 

The Team:

  • Ronny Sequeira (The Artist) : His artistic career began in his hometown Estelí, Nicaragua, when a group of volunteer U.S. doctors gave him his first guitar at the age of 15. Since then, he has composed songs non-stop. When Ronny was 18 released his first song  "Amores de juventud". In 2010, Ronny moved to Germany, where he uses his love for nature in gardening  for a living and invests his free time in pursuing his musical career. He has participated in several cultural events, concerts and festivals. 
  • Alexandra Yepes (Director & Producer):  In 2007, Alexandra drove by her love for cinema co-founded the Audiovisual Laboratory “Chirimoya Films” in Bogota, Colombia. During her career she has developed several projects as a creative producer, like documentaries, shortfilms and feature films. In 2012 Alexandra has the unique opportunity to be selected by the Berlin Film Festival to participate in the Berlinale Talent Campus. Currently, she is based in Munich, where she continues working for her passion: making audiovisual projects. 
  • Adriana Dorado (Art Director):  Her passion for nature took her to explore academia through a PhD in biology.  Studying animal communication and their interaction with their environment, she realized that science and art have a lot in common. Inspired by nature and how human perceive it, she started to direct the art of a photography project, which is still ongoing. For now, she is preparing her debut, as art director, in the videoclip of "Es tan natural".

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking for resources (5.000 Eur) to fund the Videoclip: Purchase elements of art, rent camera and accessories, rent a Dron &  Post production. Also to finish the mix and mastering of the song. 
  • We have been working for several months on the conceptualization of the video and on some impressive and beautiful animal masks that we are going to use in the Videoclip (in fact those masks will be delivered to our collaborators :))
  • All the funds that we manage to collect, will be used to finance the videoclip.

 

The Impact

  • As latin americans living abroad, we are inspired on showing how the mixture of our culture and foreigner cultures influence our aesthetics. We use this opportunity to experiment and show our vision to the world.  
  • We would like to share with the world Ronny's music, releasing his first video " Es tan natural" and contribute to his career development. 
  • We are excited to show to the public the ideas that we create together. We believe that the release of the first video can be our platform to develop future videoclips and enhance collaborations with more musicians. 

​

Something you should know...

  • Ronny, Alexandra and Adriana met in a Ronny's concert. It was like "creative love at first sight", that's why they started this project together. 
  • Last fall we started recording a first part of the Videoclip with the masks, now we are motivated to finish it this fall with everyone's help. 
  • Previously we have already worked in a Videoclip for Minga 3 (a Munich band) & for Calle Mambo a video of their presentation at Backstage.

---------

El Videoclip 


"Es tan natural" fue escrito por Ronny como terapia en un día frío de invierno. Se inspira en los ciclos de la vida, del nacimiento y de la muerte y habla de la armonía, de los altibajos de la naturaleza humana y de la importancia de una vida tranquila y respetuosa con el medio ambiente. Nuestro objetivo es difundir y potenciar el mensaje de aceptación, amor y respeto que Ronny quiere comunicar al mundo. 

 

El Equipo:

  • Ronny Sequeira (El Artista): Su carrera artística comenzó en su ciudad natal de Estelí, Nicaragua, cuando un grupo de médicos voluntarios estadounidenses le regalaron su primera guitarra a la edad de 15 años. Desde entonces, ha compuesto canciones sin parar. Cuando Ronny tenía 18 años lanzó su primera canción "Amores de juventud". En 2010, Ronny se mudó a Alemania, donde utiliza su amor por la naturaleza en la jardinería para ganarse la vida e invierte su tiempo libre en continuar su carrera musical. Ha participado en diversos eventos culturales, conciertos y festivales. 
  • Alexandra Yepes (Directora y productora):  En 2007, Alexandra impulsada por su amor por el cine co-fundó el Laboratorio Audiovisual "Chirimoya Films" en Bogotá, Colombia. A lo largo de su carrera ha desarrollado varios proyectos como productora creativa, documentales, cortometrajes y largometrajes. En 2012 Alexandra tuvo la oportunidad única de ser seleccionada por el Festival de Cine de Berlín para participar en el Berlinale Talent Campus. Actualmente reside en Munich, donde sigue trabajando por su pasión: la realización de proyectos audiovisuales. 
  • Adriana Dorado (Directora de Arte): Su pasión por la naturaleza la llevó a explorar la academia a través de un doctorado en biología.  Estudiando la comunicación de los animales y su interacción con su entorno, se dio cuenta de que la ciencia y el arte tienen mucho en común. Inspirada en la naturaleza y en cómo la percibe el ser humano, comenzó a dirigir el arte de un proyecto fotográfico que sigue en marcha. Por ahora, prepara su debut, como directora de arte, en el videoclip de "Es tan natural".

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que usted obtiene:

  • Estamos buscando recursos (5.000 euros) para financiar el Videoclip: Comprar elementos de arte, alquilar cámara y accesorios, alquilar un Dron y Postproducción. También para terminar la mezcla y masterización de la canción. 
  • Llevamos varios meses trabajando en la conceptualización del video y en unas impresionantes y hermosas máscaras de animales que vamos a utilizar en el Videoclip (de hecho esas máscaras serán entregadas a nuestros colaboradores :)).
  • Todos los fondos que consigamos recaudar, serán utilizados para financiar el videoclip.

 

El impacto

  • Como latinoamericanos que vivimos en el extranjero, nos inspira mostrar cómo la mezcla de nuestra cultura y las culturas extranjeras influyen en nuestra estética. Aprovechamos esta oportunidad para experimentar y mostrar nuestra visión al mundo.  
  • Nos gustaría compartir con el mundo la música de Ronny, lanzando su primer video " Es tan natural " y contribuir al desarrollo de su carrera musical. 
  • Nos entusiasma mostrar al público las ideas que creamos juntos. Creemos que el lanzamiento del primer vídeo puede ser nuestra plataforma para desarrollar futuros videoclips y colaborar con otros músicos. 

 

Algo que deberías saber...

  • Ronny, Alexandra y Adriana se conocieron en un concierto de Ronny. Fue como "amor creativo a primera vista", por eso empezaron este proyecto juntos. 
  • El otoño pasado empezamos a grabar una primera parte del Videoclip con las máscaras, ahora estamos motivados para terminarlo este otoño con la ayuda de todos. 
  • Anteriormente ya hemos trabajado en un videoclip para Minga 3 (una banda de Munich) y para Calle Mambo un vídeo de su presentación en Backstage.

Anteriormente ya hemos trabajado en un videoclip para Minga 3 (una banda de Munich) y para Calle Mambo un vídeo de su presentación en Backstage.

story:
Since their debut gig at The Half Moon Putney on the 8th March 2014 The Boom Band have developed something of a reputation as an 'awesome' live band. Their studio work has had praise indeed with their debut album receiving rave reviews across the board prompting descriptions such as "hugely refreshing", "rousing songwriting" and "a special record" from major music press. It was perhaps Van Morrison who described them most succinctly, declaring "this band is great - they're on the money!", after the Booms had backed him at Paul Jones' Charity Show in December 2014. There have been several descriptions of The Booms as "the highlight of the festival" both in the UK and in The Netherlands, including a memorable performance at one of Europe's biggest blues festivals Moulin Blues, and they have returned to the legendary The Half Moon twice, each time leaving the packed house in no doubt as to the extent of their abilities.

On Friday 4th September The Boom Band will return to The Half Moon and on this occasion they will be recording the show to catch a snapshot of the development of the band at this point in time, from its beginnings as an improbable knockabout side-project, through the recording of their debut album and the realisation that it was a more serious proposition, the release of the album and its many plaudits, to festival appearances at home and abroad, helping to gel an already formidable unit. The Boom Band are due to take to the recording studio again later in 2015 to record an album of new material, with a prospective Spring release, but before this happy event takes place the band have chosen to capture their sound, live and raw at the venue where they first took to the stage together.

And while it took a while for their debut CD to reach people, such dallying will not be tolerated in this instance! The guys will record the show, whip the tracks into the studio for mixing the following week and then off for swift manufacture. The plan is to have CDs available to fulfill Indiegogo orders by the first week in October, with the official release scheduled for late November.

All funds raised from the pre-sales of the album will go towards manufacturing and subsequent promotion of the album. The actual costs of recording and mixing of the album are almost nothing as there is already in place the technology and know-how to make it happen. The next stages are where your assistance is required, so if you're coming to the gig and want a copy of the album as a souvenir so that you can say "I was there",  or you can't make it but want to find out what you missed, or would just like to know what all the fuss is about then please order it in advance as it will help to provide a workable budget to manufacture and plan the release of the album, without members of the band having to worry about selling their Grandparents or re-mortgaging their second homes in Barbados.

In addition to the ability to pre-order the CD through this page, also on offer will be other exclusive 'perks' only available through Indiegogo. Check back for updates.
And of course, if you want to come to the gig and be a part of this momentous event tickets can be purchased here - be an active part of the Booms' first live album release... http://www.musicglue.com/half-moon-putney/events/4-sep-15-the-boom-band-half-moon--putney/

Photo credits: Tony Joe Gardner, Mike Prior, Rob Blackham.

story:
Short Summary

  • Weekend Atlas is a seven-piece Indie Folk/Rock band based in Jacksonville, Florida. 
  • The band is comprised of Brennan Hinck, Kelly White, Nick Garcia, John Stribling, Mike Pruitt, Carter Hess, and Jacob Casey. We have been together as a band for approximately two years; and ever since, we have been working hard to make our music heard. 
  • We have recorded a debut EP and a debut album, and we feel like it's time to work on our next EP. We've been hard at work writing and picking the perfect songs that we feel represent us best. We have just gotten back from a tour of the east coast; we made our way up to New York, playing various cities in between, and came back home. While we believe that was an amazing opportunity to let others hear our music, we have been left with very few funds. This campaign will help us raise funds and awareness of our new record we are putting out and will get the listeners a chance to be a part of it and contribute. 



What We Need & What You Get

  • We have decided to ask for $6,000 to help us put out this EP. The majority of the funds will go to recording, mixing and mastering the record, approximately $3,000. 
  • The remaining funds will go to various outlets that will help us put out the best product we possibly can, including: photo-shoots, video shoots, album artwork/design, purchase of physical copies, marketing the album, and any unexpected costs. 
  • Contributing to this project will get you perks ranging from digital downloads of the new EP to handwritten lyrics to limited edition vinyls! If we do not reach our entire goal we will still put out the album and we will work out hardest to make sure it is top of the line quality.
  • Weekend Atlas "From the Earth" EP

  • Weekend Atlas Debut Album


  • Weekend Atlas "Logo" T-shirt

  • Weekend Atlas "Bison" T-shirt



The Impact

  • Music is the gateway to the soul, it's a universal language that excites people from all paths of life. We feel like we have something unique that needs to be shared with the world and we believe this EP will help us do just that. 
  • So far we have recorded a debut EP and a debut album. These were received very well but we want to think bigger. So far, our album has tracks playing on radio stations in the Philippines and Australia but we want it to expand beyond just those countries. 
  • We promise to not cut any corners and put out the best possible product we can. We know that if we can put all our effort into this next record we can make it huge.

Risks & Challenges

  • Being a band that has only been together for two years, we have already done a great deal of things that take most bands a few years to even start. We have recorded two records, played festivals, and toured the East Coast. 
  • We believe that with the release of this EP it will push us even further and we can share it with even more people as we continue to tour. 
  • We know that things don't always work out as planned but we know that we have what it takes to find a solution to any problem that may arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We know that sometimes it's hard to contribute to projects and we're okay with that! Word of mouth is extremely helpful and if all you can contribute is a share we appreciate that just as much.
  • Indiegogo has share tools and getting the word of helps just as much as contributing.

story:
Short Summary

Hello My name is Michael Crane I am a well published writer based in Melbourne.

A friend of mine once said to me "Michael you're a punk, because punks do it for themselves, organise things and don't wait to be asked".

Since 1991 I have been organising music and Poetry events including Poetry Slams, Art Auctions, Musical cabarets and Tributes to Leonard Cohen and Charles Bukowski.

I  have presented events in some of Melbourne's best venues including The Continental Cafe,The Universal Theatre, The Lounge, The Prince of Wales, The St Kilda Library ( and seven other libraries for the Poetry Idol series), The Malthouse Theatre and St Kilda's iconic Esplanade Hotel.

My events have been included in some major festivals including The Melbourne Writers Festival, the St Kilda Festival, The Darebin Music Feast and the Williamston Literary Festival.

I also published the Literary annual Journal, the Paradise Anthology which in seven issues published and paid more than 200 poets and musicians.

Although I have been able to get some funding for these projects I've never been able to get funding for my own writing. I have a great friend Lazarus from Trojan Press who printed 200 copies of my latest book, The Church of Contradictions which featured 135 prose poems and it has been recently reviewed in the Sydney

Morning Herald.

To see the review go to michaelcranemelbournewriter.blogspot.com

Lazarus printed my book on credit  and I am seeking funds to pay him back.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $1500 to put towards two things;

1. To pay Lazarus back for the printing costs ($1,200). 

2. To pay performers to play at a special function on Saturday the 10th October 5pm to 7pm at Robarta Nightclub- 107-109 Fitzroy Street St Kilda to re-launch the book ($300).

Australian music legend, Chris Wilson will be performing at the launch function. 

At the function there will also be free finger food supplied by the venue.

As you'll see in the perks section,  for a minimum $25 if you come to the function you will receive a signed copy of my book: The Church of Contradictions.

if you cant come along to the function on 10th October, please pledge anyway and I'll make sure to send you a signed copy of the book.

Risks & Challenges

If I am only able to raise part of the funds, I will pay the performers and some part towards the printing costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to also contact me if you are interested in having me speak any events:

michaelcrane680@yahoo.com

I don't mind doing readings in peoples homes.

Please do me a HUGE favour and share this campaign on your Facebook page!

story:
Meliotus Music First Album!

We have been blown away with the reactions to our music and now we feel it is important to spread the healing vibrations! One concert participant described the experience as a brain massage! People tend to close their eyes and allow themselves to be moved deeply into realms of relaxation allowing for shifts in their energy.

Working with medicinal plants, especially the aromatic herbs and master teaching plants, we feel the clarity of how the high vibrational frequencies of plants communicate to us. The healing resonance of music is something we can feel directly through our bodies also, like the beating of a drum can physically resound on our ribcage and emotions can be moved or soothed depending on the mood of a musical piece. The same is true of inhaling the essential oils of aromatic plants, like the soft, uplifting scent of a rose or the stimulating effect of basil or rosemary. Connecting healing with vibrational resonances has been widely recognised in Traditional cultures and rhythm and song and long been associated with enhancing and activating the healing of medicinal plants.

It is this element of healing through music we would like to share with you!

You can get a taster of our music through our page on www.soundcloud.com/melilotusmusic

What We Need & What You Get

We have already spent many hours in the studio recording some of our songs and now we need your help at raising funds to complete the manifestation with the post production such as:

  • mastering the CD,
  • creating the cover sleeve with original artwork,
  • pressing the CD, distribution and marketing.

We have put our energy into the creation and initial stages of making our first album and now your contributions will help us achieve its final landing!


The total costs for undertaking the physical manifestation of our CD will come to 4000 euros and breaks down approximately as:
2500 euros for mixing & mastering,
500 euros for art design, final sleeve artwork and printing,
1000 euros for pressing the CD, distribution and marketing and other associated costs.
      
We are offering unique perks, so that your contribution is part of an energy exchange, win-win process. Below is an overview of our offer exchanges and to claim your perks, go to the next section.

  • Receive a digital copy of our CD by contributing 10 euros.
  • Receive a hard copy of our CD by contributing 15 euros.
  • Receive a digital copy of our Melilotus Music Songbook and a digital copy of our CD by contributing 30 euros.
  • Receive a one day workshop including lunch at Melilotus Herb Farm and a digital copy of our CD for contributing 45 euros.
  • Receive a massage (1 hour) from Maureen at Melilotus Herb Farm and a digital copy of our CD for contributing 50 euros.
  • Receive a sound journey healing (2 hrs) from Jose at Melilotus Herb Farm and a digital copy of our CD for contributing 75 euros.
  • Receive an Individual Herbal Consultation (3 hrs) from Maureen and pick your own medicinal herbs from the Herb Garden at Melilotus Herb Farm and a digital copy of our CD for contributing 100 euros.
  • Receive a weekend workshop at Melilotus Herb Farm including 2 nights accommodation and all meals and a digital copy of our CD for contributing 225 euros.

You can get more details about our courses and guest teachers via our website www.theherbalpath.net

If we don't reach our entire goal with contributions, we will continue with our efforts but it will take us longer.

The Impact

  • With our long years of practice working with others through music and herbs, we have witnessed how these healing mediums can change lives. Now with the fusion of the two, we know the healing potential is even more powerful and want to share this gift of vibrational healing with you and others responding to the call of Nature's healing frequencies.

    •   We have a successful track record with running Apprenticeships in Healing Herbs & Medicine Music, weekend courses, individual consultations using herbs and music and hosting other international and traditional medicine teachers.

  •   Hear about what people have said about their experiences working with us: https://www.theherbalpath.net/testimonials

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't make a financial contribution, you can always help us by sharing out fundraising video to others who might want to explore our work through contributing to a copy of our CD.

    •    You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this!

story:
LB the Poet - Transitions

When was the last time you went through one?

Who helped you through some of the hardest transitions of your life?

When we start adding up how many times we have faced a transition, there’s plenty to recall. On the most basic level, we go through a transition every morning when we wake up -- each new day presents its successes and struggles. Even bigger than that are the life transitions we experience.

My transitions into marriage, parenthood, business, and activism have turned me into an artist, a poet, a mentor, and an educator. Throughout it all, I’ve looked to the freedom of writing as an outlet to share my successes and struggles. Throughout it all, I’ve learned that every day includes a win -- there may be setbacks and struggles, but there’s no such thing as a loss.

I’ve been through all of these transitions; both the daily rebirth and the huge life changes that impact me but also those around me. I know that I’m not alone and there are entire communities who have walked the same path or will soon encounter these transitions.

Join me on my newest journey to help spread the Word of Mouth I know we all need. This album is a culmination of years of exploration and transitions, and ultimately the goal in producing this art is to send the message far and wide that every day needs to be a “wins”-day.

I want to share my experience to let others know that they aren’t alone despite facing difficult, life-changing transitions. Just like I found my power through writing, I want everyone to know they can find their power too. My newest project speaks to just that. This album combines my love for poetry, music, and community collaboration. Regardless of which corner of the world you call your own, we can all foster positive affirmation through music that speaks to universal struggles, successes, and transitions.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5000 to complete the album, create artistic visuals, and produce the physical merchandise that we are offering to you in this campaign. Here's a breakdown of where the contributions will be going and what is being offered in return.

  • Cost to create, package, and ship the product ($1500)
  • Mixing and Mastering the album ($750)
  • Studio time ($250)
  • Filming and editing of music videos ($1250)
  • Marketing budget ($1000)
  • Indiegogo Fee ($250)

The Impact

There are some fortunate students in our city of Winston-Salem, NC that see and learn from LB the Poet on a regular basis. This fall LB is conducting poetry workshops in two Elementary Schools, two High Schools, and on a college campus. This album is for these students. This album is for all of the youth in our community and beyond that may not have the same luxury to be touched by the positivity, the direction, and the empowerment that LB provides to his students in the classroom. LB is packaging Positive Affirmations and Feel Good Music into this piece of artwork and offering it to the world.

Risks & Challenges

LB is known as a poet. LB is known for his energy on stage as an award-winning host. LB is known for his community involvement. LB is known for educating the youth and showing them a purpose-driven life.

You may not yet know LB as a musician and that may give some pause for backing this campaign. We completely understand where there may be hesitations. We are aware that there is a small taste of LB's musical talent. We will continue to provide you more of the sound and we are confident that LB is creating a masterpiece. If you know LB, then you likely already know that this is more than just music. This is a movement and we need you to be involved. If you are getting to know LB, we are grateful that you found this project and hope that you'll be a part of this Transition

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to financially support this campaign. We appreciate everyone took the time to find out more about the project and can't wait to hear your thoughts about the music. 

There are many ways that you can help.

By sharing a link to this campaign with someone else or on your social media platforms you are a supporter!

By engaging with us on this journey, listening to the music, singing along,  providing feedback, you are a supporter!

Thank you!

The Impact
There are some fortunate students in our city of Winston-Salem, NC that see and learn from LB the Poet on a regular basis. This fall LB is conducting poetry workshops in two Elementary Schools, two High Schools, and on a college campus. This album is for these students. This album is for all of the youth in our community and beyond that may not have the same luxury to be touched by the positivity, the direction, and the empowerment that LB provides to his students in the classroom. LB is packaging Positive Affirmations and Feel Good Music into this piece of artwork and offering it to the world.

Risks & Challenges
LB is known as a poet. LB is known for his energy on stage as an award-winning host. LB is known for his community involvement. LB is known for educating the youth and showing them a purpose-driven life.
You may not yet know LB as a musician and that may give some pause for backing this campaign. We completely understand where there may be hesitations. We are aware that there is a small taste of LB's musical talent. We will continue to provide you more of the sound and we are confident that LB is creating a masterpiece. If you know LB, then you likely already know that this is more than just music. This is a movement and we need you to be involved. If you are getting to know LB, we are grateful that you found this project and hope that you'll be a part of this Transition

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is able to financially support this campaign. We appreciate everyone took the time to find out more about the project and can't wait to hear your thoughts about the music. 
There are many ways that you can help.
By sharing a link to this campaign with someone else or on your social media platforms you are a supporter!
By engaging with us on this journey, listening to the music, singing along,  providing feedback, you are a supporter!
Thank you!

story:
A note about the perks:

  • If you'd like a perk that is for a different amount than your donation (for example giving $50, but want the $25 perk), please just click "BACK IT" at the top, enter the amount you'd like to donate, and send me a note to let me know which perk you'd like.  
  • ​If you live locally and want to receive your perk in person instead of paying for shipping, please just click "BACK IT" at the top, enter your amount you'd like to donate, and send me a note to let me know which perk you'd like. I have plenty and I'll get it to you!

 

10/9 Update: Full preview of the title song "Beggar's Disguise"!

 

About me and this album:

As many of you know, I'm a singer-songwriter from Western Massachusetts. Lately I use the term "alt-folk" to describe my stuff. Expect intricate guitars, delicate melodies, and lush lyrical images. Maybe earworms. Over the 20+ years I've been writing songs I've refined my craft, expanded my palette, lived in the world, and grown as a songwriter.

"Let in the Light" is my third full-length album and certainly my best yet. It's been nearly 5 years since my last release. In that time I have written, re-written, recorded, arranged, overdubbed and winnowed down the songs to these ten. I'm fortunate to have worked with several talented session musicians who contributed percussion, piano, violin, cello, pedal steel guitar, and accordion to these recordings.  I'm an incredibly proud father of this music. 

Tracklist: 

  1. Let in the Light 
  2. How Far We've Come
  3. Marrow and Bone
  4. Dandelion Seeds
  5. Beggar's Disguise
  6. Nautilus
  7. Three Little Birds
  8. Ones That I Love
  9. Immaculate Flowers
  10. Lost and Found

 

Your Support = Music for You

Donate $10 or more and you GET THE ALBUM! This is both a fundraiser and a pre-sale. Win-win! Donate at higher levels and you can other great perks, like an archival print of the cover artwork, more great music from my back catalog, or a house show if you're like, really super-duper. 

The cost of self-producing an album for an independent artist are significant. I've invested a lot of time and money on professional equipment, hiring talented session musicians, and a top notch mixing and mastering engineer (Mark Miller at Sonelab) to make these songs shine.

Realistically, my $1250 goal is less than half of what it will cost me to make the album:

Session musicians, recording = $900 

Mixing and Mastering = $1325

Printing (to do) ~ $400

Your support will help cover some of the costs that I've already put into this project as well as printing costs to make a beautiful limited-edition chapbook of the lyrics (with a free download code for the music, because nobody knows what a "CD" is anymore...). It's a good ol' fashioned music object that you can hold in your hands, read along with, and admire Betsey Garand's beautiful cover art. 

 

The Impact

I've got a day-job. But music and art making is my first love. A wise friend recently told me "my job keeps me afloat, but it's the art that lets me fly." It's tough to be an independent musician these days. Everybody's got music streaming into their earbuds for $10/month and folks like me only see a few cents for it. By supporting and buying my music you're making a statement that you care about independent music and art; bringing a little love and light to the world to help us fly. 

Even if you don't have much to give, you can REALLY HELP by sharing my IndieGoGo page with your friends and family who might like my music! More ears the merrier!

Ok, buh bye. 

Love, 

Joshua

story:
Who is FoSho?

We are FoSho!  Yep, just two bandmates, Monique Rosario and Jesse Conway, creating comedy hip-pop-rapnB-soul-folk music. 

We like cool things and also secretly like uncool things. We care deeply about lots of stuff and know how to be serious, but we also believe that having fun is a really big deal.  We met while performing musical improv out of hole-in-the-wall comedy clubs in Ventura, CA, and decided to join forces with this goal in mind: help the most people have the most fun. 

Win-Wins

The last few months have been spent grinding in the studio. Our ambition is twofold: 

  1. Release FoSho's first EP in 2019.  We have nine full songs that are ready for the polishing stage!
  2. Film the pilot episode for the FoSho Show.  Actually, we're already in pre-production for FoSho Show,  an original comedy series created by us! The pilot episode includes a music video featuring our song, Black Lights. 

Amount Needed for FoSho EP = $1,560

  • Copyright Music - $110
  • Register with ASCAP - $100
  • Register with BMI - $250
  • Mastering - $600
  • Album Cover Artwork - $500

Amount Needed for FoSho Show = $3,200

  • Cinematography - $1000
  • Sound Mixer - $200
  • Film Gear/Rentals - $500
  • Editing - $500
  • Costume & Props - $500
  • Food - $500

Your support not only helps us get these dope projects done, but your investment can get you FoSho swag or even a digital download of the complete FoSho album. 

Champions

Real talk. Lots goes into making an album, let alone a whole television show.  Since we began this journey as musical improvisers first, the smiling faces of the real people who came to our shows are always fresh in our minds. Making those people happy and future countless others is more than worth it. It motivates us everyday to put in the work and make the best goodness possible. 

With Jesse's musical know-how (this guy grew up with music), and Monique's background in film, we've been able to put together a winning strategy and team to turn our aspirations into reality.  In fact, the super-talented Levi Holiman, whose last film just won the Milan International Film Festival, will be our director of photography.  Kenneth Luper, a multi-hyphenate talent who just wrote and starred in the debut of his full-length comedy play, XOXO, God, has joined the cast, along with expert improviser, Amy Nash.  Berkeley School of Music graduate/musical can-do-it-all-guy, Matt Donner (aka, "Dr. Laundré Matt) is lending his magic to both the album and show.

Bout it

We get how it is to be bout it, but not have the cash flow to invest. You can still show love by following us on Instagram and letting your peeps know about us.  We appreciate every kind word and supportive thought!

story:
Now here’s the thing: it’s a big big place, we can definitely fit a thousand people in there, and to make the best of this we need moneyz. There’s a couple really cool headlines waiting to be confirmed, but before we commit on anything we need to figure out the numbers in the budget.

This is where you come in.

Want us to bring Étienne Jaumet, Zu, Alec Empire, Sculpture, T.Raumschmiere, or someone else that you might have in mind? (Direct contact to Masami Akita anyone?) To give a bunch of young artists the means to put up beautiful installations made with more than a bunch of old bottle caps? Oh, and do you believe every artist should get something in return for playing?

Pledge now, and you’ll give us the means to make dat festival a great event, because we’ll have an idea of how much we can spend and we’ll be able to work on stuff rather than bite our nails wondering what will have to come out of our own pocket.

Now, here’s the list of rewards, because we gotta have those, right? They're to be picked up at the festival, or at Noiseberg whenever. If you can't make it to either, leave your address and a little extra money for the postman.

Many thankyous.

The team.

story:
Re-visit this page! New songs and new perks will be added regularly!

First visit? Watch the campaign video above, return here for the story...

Featured Song:  "Belle" Click the image below

 

 

To hear an acoustic version of "Belle"-Click Here

THE STORY

My name is Chas Croslin. I’m a music, theater, and mischief maker.

This campaign is raising funds to release an EP (or Extended Play: more than a single, yet not really an album) of original music entitled “Moving Objects.” The music is already recorded and mixes essentially done. Songs are featured on this page and others can be heard at www.movingobjectsmusic.com

This is an independent music project, funded solely by the contributions of the artists involved and you!

For over 30 years, I’ve plucked beats from thin air and channeled melodies from the ether, working with individuals, bands, ensembles, choirs, and theater troupes, performing on streets, in garages, living rooms, theaters, and concert halls. Rock and roll is my headquarters, but I’ve been fortunate enough to also conduct missions in new wave, folk, jazz, world music, cabaret, and funk. It’s been a magical musical journey!

When I was a lad, I thought it would be a grand accomplishment to be able to write, perform, and record a set of songs of my own. That notion never really went away. In 2014, I began working with my friend, collaborator, and recording engineer Sam Wallace to flesh out and record nine original songs. They are now nearly complete!

I’m collaborating with a group of talented folks to make a fun campaign. Perks are a token of our appreciation for your participation and support. Awesome and unique creations and situations await you in the perks column. Scroll down and read about the artists involved below.

I hope you enjoy it!

Chas

Momentum

Please help us keep the momentum going! 

Share this campaign link: https://igg.me/at/movingobjectsmusic

Facebook-Like the page and share comments! www.facebook.com/movingobjectsmusic

Website-has artist bios, music and more info! -www.movingobjectsmusic.com

Cash challenged but want to support? Send a message and ask “How else can I help?” We’ll be happy to let you know!

We’ll give you sounds...We’ll give you sights…Help keep us moving!

The initial fundraising goal is $2,500 to release the songs and support the creative efforts:

 

Perks and Artists

Check back frequently for new and one-of-a-kind offers!

Limited Edition Print by Rio Yañez

A 12 x 12 Print-numbered and signed by artist Rio Yañez. Only 6 available!

I am beyond honored to offer this print, made exclusively for this campaign, by the incomparable graphic artist Rio Yañez! Rio also designed the awesome Moving Objects logos seen throughout this campaign. Observe more of his brilliance at rioyanez.com

 

Photographs by Sabrina Hill

Sabrina shot nearly all of the promotional photography used for the “Moving Objects campaign.

We are offering two different 8 x 10 unframed photographic prints of shots she took of moving objects on her recent trip to Japan! Visit thesabrina.com to see more of her lovely work

Moving Object-Japan1

 

CLAIMED! No longer available! Moving Object-Japan 2

Other Perks:

Note: appearance of final product and/or design may vary from the image example

Moving Objects Tote Bag 

 

Moving Objects T-Shirt

 

 

Photograph by Yawen Winnie Chen

A beautiful, one-of-a-kind 8 x 10 Photograph of a novice Buddhist monk in Burma at play. Only one of these-get it fast!

See her work at yaart.blogspot.com/

Read her bio: http://sfwomenartists.org/wp/ya-wen-chien/

story:
Why give now?

Will and I need to record a new cd. We love sharing our love of jazz and each other. Your contribution will help pay for recording fees. For 8 years we've talked about recording so much that I refuse to talk about it anymore without making moves. So with your help, we're finally going into the studio.

What are we recording?

Over the years, we have recorded for many special events.
We will record many of the songs that we been associated with in Knoxville.
When the lunch counter from the Greensboro sit-in started the Smithsonian tour at the Beck Center, we wrote and played our original song, "Answer the Call". We were invited to create a jingle for WBIR called 'Knoxville My Hometown". As a cast member of Carpetbag Theatre's BETWEEN A BALLAD AND A BLUES, we popularized Ida Cox's "Wild Women Don't Have the Blues". Will and I want to take songs like these that have shaped our lives together and record them on one album.

If we're just meeting us for the first time, here's a little bit about us...

Vocalist Kelle Jolly and Saxophonist Will Boyd are two of East Tennessee's most celebrated jazz musicians. They are the 2015 MLK Art Award recipients of Knoxville, where they currently reside. They have served as ambassadors of jazz, traveling to Muroran, Japan as Knoxville's Sister City representative at various jazz festivals and events. Their latest cd, DREAMS OF MURORAN, is dedicated to people of Muroran. They were married there in 2008. Will Boyd is a member of the Knoxville Jazz Orchestra, The BluePrint and The Streamliners. He possesses a Masters in Jazz Studies from the University of Tennessee where he studied with Jerry Coker and Donald Brown. Kelle Jolly is the host of Knoxville's newest radio show on WUOT 91.9FM, Jazz Jam with Kelle Jolly, an hour-long show that celebrates great local, national and international singers of jazz. Kelle Jolly is the founder of the WOMEN IN JAZZ JAM FESTIVAL which will be held in Knoxville March 10th-12th, 2017. www.womeninjazzjamfestival.com

How else can you help?
Share. If you don't support, we don't exist.

story:
WHATS MY STORY?

Hi, my name is Jared Grimble and I am a Singer/Songwriter based out of Los Angeles, Ca. Born and raised in Springfield, IL and then spending my late teens and early twenties in Chicago I was in the middle of everything; Love, Heartbreak and Music. Wanting more than what I had, I realized Chicago wasn't enough. I then decided to make my way to LA to pursue a music career. Illinois to California is a big jump and I thought I was ready, but I lived too far in the past I did not know how to advance in my life. I often thought of passed success, old relationships and the fear of missing out. I thought about this so much and it withheld me from happiness.

After two years of living out here in sunny California and finally looking in to my situation, I decided to break those chains that held me took advantage of new opportunities. I began to break away from those things that held me down and put them into song and I hope soon they bring an understanding to you as well. So please allow me and yourself by contributing to this Music Project.

 

What is "CASHMERE SWEATERS"?

Throughout my life I have found things to hold on to, but as time went on I found myself holding on to the past. My debut album “Cashmere Sweaters” explains those things in full depth and with The Tour it helps me showcase it in live mode. This album talks about things we all deal with; strengths, weaknesses, dreams, and everything else involved in love. Strength is positive, Weakness sinks, Dreams change and Love is wanted. The content of this album is pulled from the center of my heart and is displayed through the smooth sounds of Pop, R&B and Soul. You may think I wrote this album for my own gain, but this album isn't just for me. This album is for everyone who has gone through or is still going through this problem. This project is for all of those who can't get passed their past.

(INFLUENCES: Michael Jackson, Justin Timberlake, Ryan Leslie, Pharrell, and Marvin Gaye)

Where Are Your Contributions Going?

I am crowdfunding for a minimum of $5,000.

This money goes to:

  • Musicians
  • Merchandise
  • Photoshoots
  • Travel & Expense
  • Promo
  • Indiegogo fee

Being an independent artist gives you freedom, but unfortunately not enough funds.

By contributing you are helping me move forward and not just dream, but live out my dreams. By helping me share my music with the world you get...

What Do You Get?

I always liked the bible verse “Give and you shall receive”- Luke 6:38.

 For contributing to my project you get gifts!!!

SOCIAL MEDIA SHOUTOUT

  • If you contribute just $5 I will give you a big THANK YOU over social media!!! (No DM sliding)

                                       FREE DOWNLOAD OF LATEST SINGLE

story_txt:
WHATS MY STORY?Hi, my name is Jared Grimble and I am a Singer/Songwriter based out of Los Angeles, Ca. Born and raised in Springfield, IL and then spending my late teens and early twenties in Chicago I was in the middle of everything; Love, Heartbreak and Music. Wanting more than what I had, I realized Chicago wasn't enough. I then decided to make my way to LA to pursue a music career. Illinois to California is a big jump and I thought I was ready, but I lived too far in the past I did not know how to advance in my life. I often thought of passed success, old relationships and the fear of missing out. I thought about this so much and it withheld me from happiness.

After two years of living out here in sunny California and finally looking in to my situation, I decided to break those chains that held me took advantage of new opportunities. I began to break away from those things that held me down and put them into song and I hope soon they bring an understanding to you as well. So please allow me and yourself by contributing to this Music Project. What is "CASHMERE SWEATERS"?Throughout my life I have found things to hold on to, but as time went on I found myself holding on to the past. My debut album “Cashmere Sweaters” explains those things in full depth and with The Tour it helps me showcase it in live mode. This album talks about things we all deal with; strengths, weaknesses, dreams, and everything else involved in love. Strength is positive, Weakness sinks, Dreams change and Love is wanted. The content of this album is pulled from the center of my heart and is displayed through the smooth sounds of Pop, R&B and Soul. You may think I wrote this album for my own gain, but this album isn't just for me. This album is for everyone who has gone through or is still going through this problem. This project is for all of those who can't get passed their past.(INFLUENCES: Michael Jackson, Justin Timberlake, Ryan Leslie, Pharrell, and Marvin Gaye)Where Are Your Contributions Going?
I am crowdfunding for a minimum of $5,000.
This money goes to:

Musicians
Merchandise
Photoshoots
Travel & Expense
Promo
Indiegogo fee


Being an independent artist gives you freedom, but unfortunately not enough funds.
By contributing you are helping me move forward and not just dream, but live out my dreams. By helping me share my music with the world you get...What Do You Get?
I always liked the bible verse “Give and you shall receive”- Luke 6:38. For contributing to my project you get gifts!!!

SOCIAL MEDIA SHOUTOUT

If you contribute just $5 I will give you a big THANK YOU over social media!!! (No DM sliding)

story:
In its fifth year, New Orleans’ Bastille Day weekend’s main event is Bastille Day Fête which is being held at its new location, The New Orleans Museum of Art. 

Be French for a night at NOMA where you can enjoy delicious French food from local restaurants and dance the night away to the sound of live music. This year’s line-up will feature exceptional local artists and francophone acts. Children will be treated to face painting, French storytelling, and arts activities. 

And to top it off, dogs are invited too…dress up your pup for the annual “French Dog Contest” where all dogs are welcome to show off their French spirit and win prizes!

Bastille Day Fête is presented by The Alliance Française de La Nouvelle-Orléans (a 501(c)(3) non-profit) and the French-American Chamber of Commerce, with the support of the Consulate General of France in New Orleans.

story:
I’m so proud that we finally recorded some of my dad’s incredible compositions and arrangements, a couple of which I grew up hearing in progress. 

On a lazy spring Sunday afternoon in Gowanus, Brooklyn (a super fund site with a checkered past), we recorded the Frank Perowsky Jazz Orchestra in front of a handful of listeners, close friends and family. It was a momentous occasion for all of us and resulted in a beautiful sounding document of my dad’s compositions & arrangements that, with your HELP, we will be able to share with the world soon! 

Now that the music part is done and we have a release date at the famous BIRDLAND JAZZ CLUB IN NYC (Sunday, Oct 29th) we still need to wrap it up in a nice package and create a media frenzy!

So far we’ve fronted the money to self produce this project but we still have a number of tasks to fund for a proper release. We’ll pay an amazing designer and photographer, a manufacturer, and a PR company. It’s not easy to stick out from the crowd and get the attention needed to get music heard and appreciated these days. Another aspect of this project will be the educational element. We will make all of the scores and parts easily available for download. Frank and I will be available to visit schools and work with their music departments in a master class setting. 

With YOUR contribution and help we will be able to achieve all of these goals and you will be our “co-producers” in the process! 

It was quite an undertaking, lining up these incredible players, organizing all the charts, rehearsing, and capturing it all on tape. We pulled together a world class multigenerational team of old and new friends. The great Jerry Dodgion, Sam Burtis and my father have played together starting back before I was born in bands like Thad Jones/Mel Louis, Woody Herman, and Chico O’Farrill. I called on some legendary friends whom I met back at Music & Art High School, Bob Francescini and Chris Rogers as well as a few other colleagues like the incredible John Ellis, Waldron Ricks and David Berkman. We had the pleasure of recording at Matthew Garrison’s beautiful ShapeshifterLab. From Bryce Goggin’s Trout recording studio around the corner we used some amazing sounding vintage microphones and other necessary gear. We got it all mixed by the highly talented Andy Taub, edited by yours truly, and mastered by the great Roger Lian.

 

NOW’S THE TIME! 

This is an exciting time for the music world. Record labels with funding are practically non - existent. Record stores are gone. Musicians, along with their fan’s generous support are self producing/releasing their music in an unhindered fashion, putting the power into their own hands. Now more than ever you can stand up and be part of a producing team that makes art that is appealing to you come to fruition. 

The rewards are plenty. Check out the “perks” in our campaign and see which ones you prefer! Please help us spread the word about this, don’t forget to use the Indigogo Share Tools.

Thank you so much!!!!

Ben Perowsky
