To do so, I am using a very simple, yet ancient knowledge of planting seeds. We really underestimate the power of planting seeds. The more we plant, the more opportunities there are for 'wild' plants, flowers and trees to sprout and find a way to contribute to a greener atmosphere within the cities and beyond.
And of course you can imagine...
This does't only effect the plant that will grow, it stretches way, way beyond and effects the whole ecosystem, including the bees, the insects, the air, the waters and so on...
-I will collect seeds and give them good places to grow.
-I will 'guerrilla' plant seeds ( including produce and flowers) in the cities!
-I will plant with care & the intention to make the world a better and greener place to live in for next generations to come..
- And of course I will record inspirational music that will continue to grow and flow around the globe ;-)
 
*****************************************************************
Below an inspirational video on how things can unfold....
Check out this video on how 1 man, planted 11.000 trees to reforest 250 acres of land!This is a big inspiration and demonstration on how we can make a difference by planting seeds. Let's plant together! And make that change!
​

 
************************************************************
 
Other Ways You Can Help
You can donate a low a $5!
But if you really can't spend those $5, don't worry! You can contribute by spreading the word with your friends, family and social media channels. Your contribution and share is very much appreciated! Together we can make this mission work.
So...If ya feel inspired...
 SPREAD THE WORD! 
SHARE! 
SPREAD! 
FLY! 
GROW!
POLLINATE! ;-)
***
I love you so much
Thank you for taking the time to read about my campaign!
We are on this journey together
And I am honored to get to know you
travel with you
embark on this magical mission as an earthly global tribe
************************************************************
HOW TO DONATE WITHOUT CREDITCARD!
Choose your perk!
And transfer money to this Paypal account:
jenniferannsings@gmail.com
*Don't forget to add the perk & postage costs! ( $5 Europe & $10 world coverage)
***************************************************************************
Some songs that will be recorded:
https://soundcloud.com/jenniferannsings/hooponopono-fb-live-version
https://soundcloud.com/jenniferannsings/pachamama-sing-to-me
https://soundcloud.com/jenniferannsings/prayer-song
***********************************************************************
Social Media:
www.facebook.com/jenniferannsings
www.jenniferannsings.com
https://soundcloud.com/jenniferannsings
https://jenniferann.bandcamp.com
https://www.youtube.com/jenniferannsings
 


 

 

 
HOW TO DONATE WITHOUT CREDITCARD!
Choose your perk!
And transfer money to this Paypal account:
jenniferannsings@gmail.com
*Don't forget to add the perk! So I know what to send you! & postage costs! If you want a physical CD ( $5 Europe & $10 world coverage)

story:
CAMPAIGN OVERVIEW
Award-winning singer, songwriter, performer, producer, Erin Costelo will create an album of original music in a whirlwind 10 days, taking inspiration from the Nova Scotia countryside at a very unique oceanfront house and working with some incredibly talented musicians. Juno award-winner, Amelia Curran will direct a studio documentary about the making of this album, allowing viewers an in-depth view of the creative process.

 

CAMPAIGN PITCH
Erin Costelo will spend 10 days in January 2018 in rural Nova Scotia producing her 5th studio album, and is asking for your help to fund the album and accompanying documentary film. Joining Erin, to document the creative process and translate it into a documentary film, is Juno-award winner Amelia Curran.

The fun part is not only are Erin and Amelia award winning artists and performers, they are also close friends. They have admired each other's work for more than a decade but have yet to collaborate on a project. This will be special. It will be the ultimate insight into process of making an album: through the eyes of an artist like Amelia. She will capture the strength Erin has an artist, her interactions with band mates, and of course her work as the Producer of this project. There are few women in the industry taking on all of these challenges and we will see it all through Amelia’s lense.

This project is unique because, unlike past records, Erin has challenged herself to create this record in 10 days and has assembled a cracking band - including Blue Rodeo’s drummer Glenn Milchem, longtime collaborator Clive MacNutt on guitar, Anna Ruddick on upright and electric bass (Randy Bachmann, Ben Caplan, Ladies of the Canyon), Leith Fleming-Smith (Matt Mays) on organ, Andrew McKelvie (sax) and Andrew Jackson (trombone), plus the Blue Engine String Quartet- to work with her on this project.

From Erin..."10 days is such a challenge for me.  I have always taken my time with my own records.  Revised and edited and then revised again.  I want to challenge myself to be in the moment with some incredible musicians.  To take a musical snapshot of a moment in my life.  

And to hold myself to it, I will document it with the help of my amazing and talented friend Amelia Curran.  This documentary will serve as a window into this process.  It will showcase the joys and frustrations and most importantly for me, it will showcase two women, making the decisions.  I don't recall ever seeing a music documentary where women were at the creative helm.  In the production chair musically and the director's chair.  It is time we start to see this, to encourage more women to share their voices." 
 

ABOUT THE DOCUMENTARY
Amelia says..."The studio documentary is a long standing tradition.  It allows an audience to study the engine of the music they love - pry open the casing, and view the bones.

What is particularly enticing, and why Erin Costelo is a great candidate for studio documentary, are her skills as a self produced artist.  This isn't simply tapping a microphone and slogging through fifty takes.  Costelo is a Band Leader in the sense of Duke Ellington and his ilk.  Every note from under each performer is a considered move.  How it tumbles through the studio environment and is engineered and conditioned out the other side to it’s audience is a rodeo of painstaking precision and delight.

Once completed, this project will be able to be viewed as one concise music documentary, or song by song. "

In the middle of winter, the unique space where the album and film will be created will serve as an incubator for the new album. The space is an open concept timber-frame with massive fireplaces, ocean views and a central staircase built around an ancient white pine, felled in a nearby forest. The space seems to nurture and cull creativity, and because of this, all musicians will live at the space and create all day, in and around this inspiring environment and each other.

Erin, Amelia and the crew will be sharing the journey as it unfolds via social media, email updates to supporters and videos. We want to share the process and to get everyone excited about the new music and film.

We have funded $45,700 of our $71,700 total budget and are asking for your help to raise the remaining $25,000. No matter the amount, all funds will make a difference. If we have the good fortune to go OVER our goal, we will use those funds to Publicize and Market the album and Documentary in Canada and around the world.


ERIN COSTELO- THE ARTIST, ARRANGER, PRODUCER
Erin Costelo is an artist who mines the truth - through writing, arranging, producing and masterful live performance. With a voice unlike any other in Canada she has the ability to successfully float between genres and stages, her unwavering vision continuously offering the best sound and voice to a feeling, idea or story. With songs that sound like they were written by your heroes.  Heavily influenced by Gospel and Americana, she’s had the opportunity to open for heroes like Mavis Staples, Dr. John and Bettye Lavette and has recently performed with Levon Helm's Midnight Ramble Band.

Her latest, self-produced album Down Below, the Status Quo was nominated for a total of twelve awards in her home of Eastern Canada. It is a magical, moonlight-soaked reverie, filled with drama and intensity; in one moment a defiant cry and in the next a desperate whisper.  It has been described as "embodying the spirit of Nina Simone" and "conjuring the ghost of Donny Hathaway".

In addition to being a prolific artist with four albums to her credit and multiple award nominations, Erin is keenly sought after as an arranger and producer. Her talent as a producer was recognized this year with a Music Nova Scotia Award for Producer of the Year 2017, the first woman to win the award and one of the few women in Canada to take a major award for music production in the past several decades. In addition, she has written arrangements for Symphony Nova Scotia, CBC and the Blue Engine String Quartet, as well as artists including Stephen Fearing, Reeny Smith, and
Amelia Curran.

 

AMELIA CURRAN- ARTIST AND FILMMAKER
Amelia Curran is a Juno-Award winning songwriter and activist from St. John’s, Newfoundland. Curran’s music is distinguished by her intricate and elliptical lyrics, recently published in book form as “Relics & Tunes” by Breakwater Books.

2016 saw a move from music to film production with the release of Curran’s first feature documentary, “Gone”, an exploration of art and suicide.  The film was a partner project with IT’S MENTAL, a grassroots advocacy group founded by Curran, that works towards mental health care reform in Canada.

 

WHAT WE NEED
Erin needs to pay for the ALBUM, which includes paying:
Musicians, Studio Fee, Engineer, Mixing, Mastering, Album Art Design, Photography and Travel.

TOTAL: $26400

And Amelia’s DOCUMENTARY film, which includes payment for:  
Camera Operators, Equipment rental, Tape, Accommodations, Assistant Director, Editing and Sound.

TOTAL: $35800

And then we have to get it made, costs for final manufacturing includ:
Pressing Vinyl, Pressing CDS and the Photo Book.

TOTAL:  $9500

TOTAL ALBUM AND DOCUMENTARY PRODUCTION BUDGET: $71700

We have in place $46700 of funding, but we need your help to raise the additional $25000

This project will be released in September 2018 and the film will be submitted to film festivals throughout Canada and the United States. Erin and Amelia will travel together whenever possible in support of this project.  The album will be promoted through international touring in Fall 2018 and 2019. It will result in Erin touring Canada, United States, Germany, Austria, France, Belgium, Netherlands, and the U.K. and hopefully some exciting uncharted territories as well!


WHAT YOU GET
By supporting this project (new album by Erin Costelo and accompanying documentary film by Amelia Curran), you get an insider’s view to the creative process and we are offering perks to enhance the experience. Perks range from signed CDs, VIP access to shows, vocal lessons via skype, complete discography from both artists, book of still images for your coffee table, private film screening for 10 of your friends + pizza (cause who doesn’t like dinner and a movie?) or your own private house concert! We offer something for everyone, a price point for every budget.

If the goal is not met, we will persevere. We are creators and we will still create however knowing the possibility of what this project could be with full funding will always be at the back of our minds. Please help us realize our huge and ambitious vision!

RISKS AND CHALLENGES
Erin has challenged herself to create this album in 10 days. Working under intense deadline pressure can be formidable for some artists, but can bring out the best an artist like Erin has to offer.

Drive and creativity have always characterized Erin’s approach to her art. For Erin, that spirit allows her to seemingly without effort take on many roles in quick succession or simultaneously in service of her musical goals -- like her song, Fighter, a celebration of the courage it takes to succeed and that makes heroes of us all.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Donating isn't the only way you can help with the project. Sign up for newsletters from Erin at her website or follow Erin and Amelia on social media and help spread the word about the campaign:

SOCIAL MEDIA
www.erincostelo.ca
www.facebook.com/erincostelomusic
www.twitter.com/erincostelo
www.instagram.com/erincostelo
www.ameliacurran.com
www.facebook.com/ameliacurranmusic
www.twitter.com/amelia_curran

story:
A promise

Many years ago, I made a promise to my friends. The promise that I would make an album called The Gay Tapes. Guess what... I never did it. But the time has come to repeat my promise, not only to my friends, but to all of you: this year, 2018, I will make The Gay Tapes.

As 'Divan & his Unicorns' I will record  a collection of gay classics, songs with a gay twist and some original composition. I feel like I have to make this record. I think it's important, now more than ever. A meaningful project. 

Who am I? 

I'm a songwriter and performing artist from Belgium, involved in different projects, with an eclectic love for pop, acoustic and electronics. I write music for theatre, I sing in my native tongue Dutch with my band Hermitage, I did the fun electro-pop project C. Love Detectives with a female singer, I've been the lead singer - back in the 00's - of The Go Go Prophecy and I love to co-write with other songwriters and producers. Check out the videos below to see what I've been doing so far!

Be a part of The Gay Tapes

You can help me bringing The Gay Tapes to life in different ways:

1. Fund this project through this crowdfunding campaign. Buy a CD or LP (vinyl) in advance, invite me in your living room, buy a ticket for the release show, etc.

2. Help me on the artistic side. I need video makers, layout wonders, studio time, musicians, etc. If you like to part of this special project, for example by playing or producing one of the songs, offering a photo shoot, etc. Please contact me!

3. You can become part of the promo team. Help spreading this message by posting it on your socials, by informing LGBT platforms, ... Shout it out! #thegaytapes @divanmusic #divanandhisunicorns #lgbt

4. Be a sponsor with your company or help me find companies with a golden lgbt-friendly-heart.

5. Help me find the right places to perform. It can be small, as long as it's cosy and filled with warm-hearted people, I'm in!

Contact me with all your questions, suggestions and encouragements ;-)

Thank you in advance!

Divan & his Unicorns

HERMITAGE

C. LOVE DETECTIVES

 

THE GO GO PROPHECY

story:
To begin...

Over the last few years, I've recorded EP's in both a traditional studio setting (Orwin Orioles) and live in the multi-purpose space at the charter school I've worked at since moving to North Carolina (Carter).  While I loved the finished product of those recordings, I know that it's finally time to make a legitimate full-length record.    

SO...

At the end of April, I'll be traveling to Nashville, Tennessee to record my first full-length album at the Bomb Shelter with producer/engineer Billy Bennett.    I've enlisted a number of incredibly talented Nashville musicians to play with me, including:

  • Wallace Lester (North Mississippi drumming extraordinaire: The Como Mamas, Kenny Brown, most of the sons of RL Burnside and Junior Kimbrough...)
  • Heather Moulder (Just about the best keys player in Tennessee...)
  • Uncle Reed Turchi (Frequent collaborator and engineer on Carter, honorary Uncle to Jack, nasty North Mississippi-style slide guitarist)
  • Whoever else I can afford to ask to guest on the record...

The songs...

I've been writing songs for this record since 2009.  Some of them have been part of my live set for upwards of a decade, while others have been written in the last two months.   For a number of these tracks, it's simply time to commit them to tape and move forward.  I've found myself hung up on them for too long, holding out to commit them to other projects in hopes that this day would come.  They're meant to live on "Shenandoah" and I'm excited for you to here  the way they were meant to be presented.

The costs...

Making this album the wait it was intended to be heard is my number one priority.  I've cut corners in the past and settled for less than what I heard in my head, but I've committed to going for it this time around.  Getting an album to sound like those that you hear on the radio can be costly.  For the sake of transparency:

  • Studio Time: $700 (A Steal!)
  • Paying the Band: $500
  • Magnetic Tape (Strictly analog, homie): $100
  • Feeding the band/engineer: $100
  • Mixing: $700-$900

That total brings me to nearly $2300 (!) without even factoring in travel to Nashville, mastering, or the physical production of the CD's, t-shirts, and stickers to give to you!  Malynda Resh from Hey Over Here Creative has graciously created the artwork for all of my releases and designed my website pro bono up to this point, and I'd sure love to pay her for all of her incredible work as well.  

Where YOU come in...

Every single dollar pledged towards this campaign will help me make the best record possible.  A few $10 pledges allows me the freedom to record an extra song or two for the album or helps to pay for the down-payment on a mastering session.  I'm pumping as much of my own savings into this project as I can without forcing my son to drop out of daycare or take his first job at the age of two... (I'm kidding - please don't call Social Services on me.  Kthx.)

On the right side of this screen, you'll see pledge amounts and the perks that come along with them.  Pledge amounts range from $5 to $500 and everywhere in between.  Quite frankly, no pledge is too small or insignificant.  I'm incredibly thankful for anything and everything you offer, so THANK YOU in advance.  I literally cannot do this without you.

How else can I help, dude?

That's a good question, self acting as the voice of my friend or family member reading this right now.  If you can afford to make a pledge, please do!  However, I absolutely understand if you can't.  We all have bills and children who need braces and piano lessons, so don't sweat it if you can't swing it.   Simply post the link to this campaign on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or grandma's front door and put out the good word for your ol' friend John Joseph Boxter Jr.  Bug a friend at work.  Start a conversation with a perfect stranger in the bathroom.  I've taken the liberty of creating some great one liners to get the proverbial ball rolling for you:

  • "Hey bro, sick form on your squats.  Anyway, ever hear of this sad Americana singer named JB Boxter?  He's got this record about coal mines and Japanese trees... so dope!"
  • "Excuse me, Ma'am - have you heard of my friend JB Boxter?  You'd really love his song... ma'am... please don't close the door... calling the cops isn't necessary... I'll let myself out... lovely dining room you have!"
  • "Seriously though, __________________ (your boss name here).  Forget my Christmas bonus this year - how about pledging for a private house show for the company with JB Boxter?

All jokes aside, passing this along to anyone whom you think might dig my music goes a long way.  Thank you again.  

Cheers,

JB

Whoever else I can afford to ask to guest on the record...


The songs...
I've been writing songs for this record since 2009.  Some of them have been part of my live set for upwards of a decade, while others have been written in the last two months.   For a number of these tracks, it's simply time to commit them to tape and move forward.  I've found myself hung up on them for too long, holding out to commit them to other projects in hopes that this day would come.  They're meant to live on "Shenandoah" and I'm excited for you to here  the way they were meant to be presented.

The costs...
Making this album the wait it was intended to be heard is my number one priority.  I've cut corners in the past and settled for less than what I heard in my head, but I've committed to going for it this time around.  Getting an album to sound like those that you hear on the radio can be costly.  For the sake of transparency:

Studio Time: $700 (A Steal!)
Paying the Band: $500
Magnetic Tape (Strictly analog, homie): $100
Feeding the band/engineer: $100
Mixing: $700-$900

That total brings me to nearly $2300 (!) without even factoring in travel to Nashville, mastering, or the physical production of the CD's, t-shirts, and stickers to give to you!  Malynda Resh from Hey Over Here Creative has graciously created the artwork for all of my releases and designed my website pro bono up to this point, and I'd sure love to pay her for all of her incredible work as well.  
Where YOU come in...
Every single dollar pledged towards this campaign will help me make the best record possible.  A few $10 pledges allows me the freedom to record an extra song or two for the album or helps to pay for the down-payment on a mastering session.  I'm pumping as much of my own savings into this project as I can without forcing my son to drop out of daycare or take his first job at the age of two... (I'm kidding - please don't call Social Services on me.  Kthx.)
On the right side of this screen, you'll see pledge amounts and the perks that come along with them.  Pledge amounts range from $5 to $500 and everywhere in between.  Quite frankly, no pledge is too small or insignificant.  I'm incredibly thankful for anything and everything you offer, so THANK YOU in advance.  I literally cannot do this without you.
How else can I help, dude?
That's a good question, self acting as the voice of my friend or family member reading this right now.  If you can afford to make a pledge, please do!  However, I absolutely understand if you can't.  We all have bills and children who need braces and piano lessons, so don't sweat it if you can't swing it.   Simply post the link to this campaign on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or grandma's front door and put out the good word for your ol' friend John Joseph Boxter Jr.  Bug a friend at work.  Start a conversation with a perfect stranger in the bathroom.  I've taken the liberty of creating some great one liners to get the proverbial ball rolling for you:

"Hey bro, sick form on your squats.  Anyway, ever hear of this sad Americana singer named JB Boxter?  He's got this record about coal mines and Japanese trees... so dope!"

"Excuse me, Ma'am - have you heard of my friend JB Boxter?  You'd really love his song... ma'am... please don't close the door... calling the cops isn't necessary... I'll let myself out... lovely dining room you have!"
"Seriously though, __________________ (your boss name here).  Forget my Christmas bonus this year - how about pledging for a private house show for the company with JB Boxter?

All jokes aside, passing this along to anyone whom you think might dig my music goes a long way.  Thank you again.  
Cheers,
JB

story:
(Detalles en español sigue después del inglés) 

Story about Mariachi Samurai 

Mariachi Samurai is headed by Sam Moreno, who discovered mariachi and ranchera music in 1972 and went to Mexico to study latin music. Ever since then he has been a pioneer of spreading the beauty of mariachi music in Japan. He also participated in the 1st mariachi festival in Guadalajara, Mexico back in 1994. Sam started Mariachi Samurai in 2000, one of the only full mariachi bands in Japan. Mariachi Samurai has gotten an endorsement from the Mexican embassy in Japan and performed in various functions of the embassy as well as Latin American events in Japan.

 

Mariachi Samurai was officially invited to attend the 25th anniversary of the Mariachi Festival in Guadalajara, Mexico and would love to attend as it is such a special year. 

Additionally, as Mexico suffered a huge loss last year from the devastating earthquake we would also like to visit the disaster stricken zone near Mexico City and conduct a charity concert there. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 10,000USD to cover part of the flights. As we are a group of 11 members including dancers, only flights alone cost about 20,000USD. We are simultaneously conducting fund raising concerts but it is difficult to get this amount by just that so we hope you can help us fly there. Any additional fee we can get over 10,000USD we will use for ground transportation fee, to organize the charity concert, tour promo and management. 

Mariachi Samurai is an independent group (no label, publishing deal, industry money of any kind). We do everything by ourselves  so you are the only way we are going to be able to afford this tour.

Together with your support, we will make this tour happen!

 

In return for your money we offer you a list of exclusive gifts and offerings depending on your pledge amount. The gifts include:

  • Postcard from Japan
  • Download of recorded songs by Mariachi Samurai and Sawaka Katalyna
  • Photo book of the Mexican tour
  • Mexican mini souvenir (eg. mini sombrero, bookmark, etc.)
  • Live broadcast performance over Skype or similar software (We can separately discuss about going to play live instead of over Skype if timing works and transportation and accommodation is provided)
  • Original song with your name

*Even if we don't reach the goal we would like to use the money we can raise to help fund our flights. 

 

The Impact

  • We would love to represent Japan and serve as a bridge between Mexico and Japan
  • We would love to transmit this passion we have for Mexican music and share it with the Mexican people
  • We would love to conduct a charity concert and bring everyone together and create a lively enjoyable environment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us by spreading the word!

 

La Historia del Mariachi Samurai

Mariachi Samurai está dirigida por Sam Moreno, quien descubrió el mariachi y la música ranchera en 1972 y se fue a México para estudiar música latina. Desde entonces, ha sido un pionero de difundir la belleza de la música de mariachi en Japón. También participó en el primer Encuentro Internacional del Mariachi y la Charrería en Guadalajara, México en 1994. Sam comenzó Mariachi Samurai en 2000, una de las únicas bandas de mariachis en Japón. Mariachi Samurai tiene el respaldo oficial de la embajada de México en Japón y también ha actuado en diversas funciones de la embajada, así como en eventos latinoamericanos en Japón.

Mariachi Samurai fue invitado oficialmente a asistir al 25 ° aniversario del Encuentro del Mariachi en Guadalajara, y nos encantaría asistir ya que es un año muy especial. Además, como México sufrió una gran pérdida el año pasado por el terremoto, también nos gustaría visitar la zona afectada cerca de la Ciudad de México y llevar a cabo un concierto de caridad.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos 10,000 USD para cubrir parte de los vuelos. Como somos un grupo de 11 miembros, incluidos bailarines, solo los vuelos cuestan unos 20,000 USD. Al mismo tiempo, estamos organizando conciertos para recaudar fondos, pero es difícil obtener esta cantidad con solo eso, así que esperamos que nos ayuden a poder ir a México. Cualquiera cantidad adicional que podamos obtener de más de 10,000 USD, lo utilizaremos para pagar el transporte terrestre, para organizar el concierto benéfico, y para la promoción del tour y la administración.

Mariachi Samurai es un grupo independiente y hacemos todo por nuestra cuenta, así que el apoyo de ustedes es la única manera en que podremos pagar esta gira. ¡Con su apoyo, haremos que esta gira sea una realidad!

A cambio de su dinero, le ofrecemos regalos y cosas exclusivas según la cantidad de su apoyo. Los regalos incluyen:

  • Postal de Japón
  • Descarga de canciones grabadas por Mariachi Samurai y Sawaka Katalyna
  • Libro de fotos de la gira mexicana
  • Mini regalo mexicano (por ejemplo, mini sombrero, marcador, etc.)
  • Transmisión en vivo a través de Skype o software similar de un concierto del Mariachi samurai (podemos hablar por separado sobre ir a tocar en vivo en vez de Skype si logramos encontrar un tiempo que resulte bien a todos y si el transporte y los alojamientos son proporcionados)
  • Canción original con su nombre

*Aunque no alcancemos el objetivo, nos gustaría utilizar el dinero que podamos recaudar para  financiar nuestros vuelos.

El impacto

  • Nos encantaría representar a Japón y servir de puente entre México y Japón
  • Nos encantaría transmitir esta pasión que tenemos por la música mexicana y compartirla con los mexicanos
  • Nos encantaría realizar un concierto de caridad y unir a todos y crear un ambiente agradable y animado.

Otras maneras en que nos puedas apoyar

Por favor ayúdenos difundiendo la palabra!

También avísanos si conocen a alguien que quiera entrevistarnos o que quieran que toquemos durante la gira.

story:
Every donation is a big step forward and greatly appreciated . Unlock the goals!

 

We are currently working on a record at the Naidoo-Herberger-Studios in Mannheim, Germany. Give it a listen!

Single "Lonely Knights" https://soundcloud.com/neonation-x/lonelyknights

Demo "Higher" https://soundcloud.com/neonation-x/higher-demo 

Instrumental Demo "Supernova" https://soundcloud.com/neonation-x/supernova-in...

Instrumental Demo "The Way to Abaddon" https://soundcloud.com/neonation-x/thewaytoabaddon

We would love you to get involved at this stage of the production. We already found the sound and the musical language we wanna go for and now we wanna open up the creative process to the listener. Be a part of it!

Take a look at our music video for "Lonely Knights"

 

Together with our wonderful and talented creative team we are always experimenting in order to find new and interesting concepts for our future video content.

We are still in the concept phase for the Live Show Experience. It's an ellaborate and expensive process with a lot of crazy ideas involved. With your help we can make it happen!

The movie "Neonation" is not part of the campaign. It has already been fully funded and is actually in its final steps before completion. However, we can't help but show what we can achieve, when everything comes together.

Take a look at the trailer!

 

It is part of the bigger story we wanna tell with "Neonation X" and will make a run at Filmfestivals around the world (hopefully ;-)). Of course it will also be available on the internet for free in the near future.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/neonationX

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/neonationx

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/neonation-x

story:
What did we make?

A lot has changed for me in the last several years. I moved to Kansas City in 2015 after losing a job and having much of my life in Wichita fall apart, but continued to write songs during that time. The result was a new batch of tunes that became the foundation for this project, Mr. Golden Sun.

The Central States EP is a collection of songs that grapple with anxiety, doubt, and an attempt to maintain some sense of normalcy when the world feels like it's spinning out of control. I became really interested in telling small, personal stories about the people and places around me, whether autobiographically and fictitiously. There's a bit of both on here. And I'm really happy with how it's turning out.

My band and I pieced this EP together over the course of the last year, recording in various studios, living rooms, bathrooms, and other varied spaces in the KC metro area. Other musicians that played on the album were Ryan Shaw (drums), Joey Panella (bass), Jonathan Smith (keys), Bethany Slack, (vocals), and Nathan Wilhoit (piano). 

It was all mixed by Sean Lea, who also recorded vocals and some other bits and bobs. Michael Collins tracked the drums and bass. I recorded the rest myself (learning a ton along the way).

TW Walsh is mastering it. He used to be in Pedro the Lion, and has worked on records by Sufjan Stevens, Damien Jurado, The Shins, and tons of other fantastic-sounding recordings.

It's all nearly completed and we need you to help us push it across the finish line.

Money raised through this campaign will to toward offsetting recording, mixing, and mastering costs.

What does it sound like?

Sonically, the goal was to combine earthy, organic sounds like acoustic guitars and drums with more inorganic synthesizers and drum machines. Much of the EP leans toward "folk" stylistically, but with a much more atmospheric sound palate.

If you're not already familiar with our work, take a listen/look at the first two singles that we completed and released here:

Heavy Water (Official Video)

 

Place & Time (Single)

I also recorded two live acoustic sessions of songs off the EP with filmmaker Cole Blaise. Imagine these, but with like, more instruments.

Goldfinches (Morton Hall Session)

 
Julianne in Tangerine (Morton Hall Session)
 

 

What We Need / What You Get

The initial goal is set at $3,000. This will to toward offsetting recording, mixing, and mastering costs for recording the EP. Beyond just digital copies of the EP, we're offering perks in exchange for your help, including:

  • A classy, ultra-comfy t-shirt with three different color options.
  • Artwork by my daughter Wren (she's very excited about this).
  • A lyric booklet lovingly typed out on a Smith Corona typewriter.

Why support this project?

I really believe that art is worth investing in. Music in particular is at a weird point in which we expect it to continue to be made and expect to listen to it on demand, without cost. But someone always has to pay for it to be made, and without a record label, that's up to me to figure out. 

Here's a chance to lessen that personal burden and help me put something I really believe in out into the world.

What Are The Risks To You?

Thankfully, this project's release isn't completely hinging on this campaign. How much comes out-of-pocket for me personally is at stake, but it will come out regardless if we reach the full total or not.

This means you can donate confidently knowing that it's helping us out, and you'll still get what you are expecting.

Other Ways You Can Help

I totally understand if you can't contribute financially. But there are a few other ways you can really help out:

  • Share this campaign on social media. Mr. Golden Sun is a relatively new project and a lot of folks don't know it exists. If you love the tunes, help let us spread them around!
  • Follow our Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter pages, and subscribe to our Youtube channel.
  • Sign up for our newsletter so you can keep in touch with what we're working on in the future.
  • If you have a fun idea for another perk you could help with and think would be easy to add quickly, let me know!

Sign up for our newsletter so you can keep in touch with what we're working on in the future.
If you have a fun idea for another perk you could help with and think would be easy to add quickly, let me know!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Miranda Delgado, a Christian Country music artist, and I am very happy to share some exciting news with y’all! I am about to complete my first EP titled J-TOWN (Jesus Town)! Releasing a record has always been my dream since I was playing in overalls with chickens and birds at age 5 in Fort Worth, Texas. I have invested more than $8,000 working with award-winning producers to record five songs that communicate a message of faith-based hope, and raise awareness of some of our human struggles affecting society today. Now, I need your help to get to the finish line. I am requesting $4,000 to complete the last part of the project, which is mixing and mastering, distribution, and recording the music video for the release of the first single. If you are as passionate as I am about reaching the world with good news, please consider making a contribution to help me get these songs out, and spread much needed hope to our world.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown of how your contribution will be used:

  • Mixing and mastering - $1,900
  • Distribution- $522.75
  • Recording of first single music video- $1,577.25 minus campaign fee.

Should the campaign exceed the goal amount, I will use the extra funds for the music video, marketing, social media, and advertising. If I receive less than the set goal, the priority will be the mixing and mastering. As a token of appreciation, I have prepared a tiered list of perks for contributors that include, but are not limited to: single digital downloads, Full EP digital downloads, CD copies, an invitation to be a part of a Closed Group that will continue to receive news and other fun stuff first before general public release, and house concerts. Please refer to the Perks section for more details.

The Impact

J-TOWN is an EP (extended playlist) containing five songs. I have chosen these songs because they communicate a faith-based message, and/or are conversation starters about issues affecting society and the human being. I sincerely believe that listeners will be encouraged to take positive action for the betterment of themselves, and to raise the quality of life of their families.

  • J-TOWN (Jesus Town) - This song is about the joy of belonging to a community of faith. It was written at a time when my husband and I were reconnecting with God and the church- a place where you can find real love, where you can be honest about your struggles, and where you receive blessings from God.
  • JESUS CRAZY- This is my story, and the story of many men and women who have adopted a Christian worldview as their lives’ guiding principle. Sometimes people make fun of you. Well, I happen to enjoy my “Jesus Craziness” and it is perfectly okay for you to be a Christian too! This song is so much fun!  I can’t wait for you to hear it!
  • JESSIE – Bullying, anxiety, depression, and suicide. This is a conversation between a high school girl at her breaking point, and God. Sometimes we get to a place where we feel that there is no way out of our troubling circumstances, and that ending our lives is the only way to escape. Maybe nobody else is listening to us, but God is, and we need to hear His response.
  • WALL OF FIRE – In a world in which domestic violence, abuse, and harassment are everyday news, a mother talks to her teenage daughter about the characteristics of a good partner. This is one of my favorite songs because it encourages individuals to look for signs, and to not accept less than a person that will be a wall of fire around them, someone who will surround them with a kind of love that will burn any evil coming their way.
  • BRAND NEW DAY – This song is very close to my heart for several reasons. As a past victim of abuse, I know how hard it can be to get out of an abusive relationship. It takes a special kind of courage that only God can provide. Many women pray for strength to be able to escape, and many die in the process. God can save you from the grave, and show you a brand new day.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for considering contributing to this campaign. If you can’t contribute at this time, it doesn't mean you can't help! Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Miranda Delgado, a Christian Country music artist, and I am very happy to share some exciting news with y’all! I am about to complete my first EP titled J-TOWN (Jesus Town)! Releasing a record has always been my dream since I was playing in overalls with chickens and birds at age 5 in Fort Worth, Texas. I have invested more than $8,000 working with award-winning producers to record five songs that communicate a message of faith-based hope, and raise awareness of some of our human struggles affecting society today. Now, I need your help to get to the finish line. I am requesting $4,000 to complete the last part of the project, which is mixing and mastering, distribution, and recording the music video for the release of the first single. If you are as passionate as I am about reaching the world with good news, please consider making a contribution to help me get these songs out, and spread much needed hope to our world.
What We Need & What You Get
Here is the breakdown of how your contribution will be used:


Mixing and mastering - $1,900

Distribution- $522.75

Recording of first single music video- $1,577.25 minus campaign fee.

Should the campaign exceed the goal amount, I will use the extra funds for the music video, marketing, social media, and advertising. If I receive less than the set goal, the priority will be the mixing and mastering. As a token of appreciation, I have prepared a tiered list of perks for contributors that include, but are not limited to: single digital downloads, Full EP digital downloads, CD copies, an invitation to be a part of a Closed Group that will continue to receive news and other fun stuff first before general public release, and house concerts. Please refer to the Perks section for more details.
The Impact
J-TOWN is an EP (extended playlist) containing five songs. I have chosen these songs because they communicate a faith-based message, and/or are conversation starters about issues affecting society and the human being. I sincerely believe that listeners will be encouraged to take positive action for the betterment of themselves, and to raise the quality of life of their families.


J-TOWN (Jesus Town) - This song is about the joy of belonging to a community of faith. It was written at a time when my husband and I were reconnecting with God and the church- a place where you can find real love, where you can be honest about your struggles, and where you receive blessings from God.

JESUS CRAZY- This is my story, and the story of many men and women who have adopted a Christian worldview as their lives’ guiding principle. Sometimes people make fun of you. Well, I happen to enjoy my “Jesus Craziness” and it is perfectly okay for you to be a Christian too! This song is so much fun!  I can’t wait for you to hear it!

JESSIE – Bullying, anxiety, depression, and suicide. This is a conversation between a high school girl at her breaking point, and God. Sometimes we get to a place where we feel that there is no way out of our troubling circumstances, and that ending our lives is the only way to escape. Maybe nobody else is listening to us, but God is, and we need to hear His response.

WALL OF FIRE – In a world in which domestic violence, abuse, and harassment are everyday news, a mother talks to her teenage daughter about the characteristics of a good partner. This is one of my favorite songs because it encourages individuals to look for signs, and to not accept less than a person that will be a wall of fire around them, someone who will surround them with a kind of love that will burn any evil coming their way.

BRAND NEW DAY – This song is very close to my heart for several reasons. As a past victim of abuse, I know how hard it can be to get out of an abusive relationship. It takes a special kind of courage that only God can provide. Many women pray for strength to be able to escape, and many die in the process. God can save you from the grave, and show you a brand new day.

Other Ways You Can Help
Thank you for considering contributing to this campaign. If you can’t contribute at this time, it doesn't mean you can't help! Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
North American music is finding a new audience in the 21st Century!

www.amiciarts.com

It’s no secret that North America produces a tremendous catalogue of great music. From Broadway stages to Hollywood studios, from smoky cabarets and jazz clubs to the great opera houses, North American repertoire has something for everyone.

Amici Arts is quickly becoming the premier producer of North American music in Europe. Since 2015 Amici Arts has created productions showcasing the music of North American composers and lyricists. To date we have produced over thirty original  projects throughout Europe. We have introduced audiences to unknown material and reacquainted them with old favorites. 

With three successful seasons behind us, Amici Arts is leaping onto the international stage. This past year we have been preparing the European premiere of Tom Cipullo’s ground-breaking opera Glory Denied to be performed in Berlin's historic Parochialkirche. We have assembled a world-class cast and creative team to make this an international operatic event. As part of our Song For Life program, Amici Arts will donate ticket proceeds (up to 20,000 euros) to Human Rights Watch.

CLICK HERE for details about Glory Denied.

The guaranteed success of Glory Denied has brought exciting new projects to Amici Arts. We are currently working closely with several prominent North American composers to produce European and world premieres of their works. Negotiations are underway to bring our productions to theaters, embassies, and other world-class venues throughout Europe. 

As Amici Arts grows so does our budget. To continue producing the quality projects European audiences have come to expect, it’s time to expand our family of supporters. To date Amici Arts has been fully funded by its founders. Now we invite you to support us as we continue bringing the works of North American composers and lyricists to new audiences, providing performance opportunities for established artists, and jump starting careers for emerging talent.

Please join us on our journey to success by making a donation today. With your gift Amici Arts will continue to provide a home for North American music in Europe.

 

Join the Amici Arts family

There are several ways you can support Amici Arts in bringing quality North American music to European audiences.

  • Give a one-time financial gift through this campaign

Please email us at support@amiciarts.com to support Amici Arts though the following options.

  • Pledge monthly financial support
  • Sponsor an Amici Arts expense
  • Introduce Amici Arts to a corporate sponsor
  • Donate time and skill

Please visit our "INVEST" page for information on how you can become an Amici Arts investor.

-all gifts can be given in honor or memory of a person or event.

However you decide to help, please share this fund drive campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues. It’s easy using the Indiegogo sharing tool, and will help Amici Arts quickly reach its financial goal.

Your financial support will be used for Amici Arts operation expenses, including:

  • Registering as a non-profit company in the US and Europe
  • Applying for grants and government funding
  • Joining industry organizations
  • Securing an office/rehearsal space
  • Financing a support staff
  • Funding upcoming projects
  • Taking over the operating costs from the Amici Arts founders (including insurance, website, advertising, printing)

 

An Amici Arts gift for you

To thank our supporters Amici Arts has assembled variety of gift items from the upcoming Glory Denied European premiere.

 

The future of Amici Arts

Amici Arts is preparing several exciting new productions for the next three seasons. These projects include:

  • European premier of Anne Phillip's Bending Towards the Light, the jazz Nativity co-written with Bob Kindred and Dave Brubeck
  • Several works by Richard Pearson Thomas, including the world premiere of his opera Blood of Angels
  • The Musicality of Marc Blitzstein, with Philip Headlam of the Continuum Ensemble. To benefit the Heimatverein Steglitz e.V.
  • American Portraits, with Jonathan Levin (piano) and Tyrone Chambers (tenor)
  • Kurt Weill: the Journey To America
  • America at the Barre with Canadian dancer, Jaime Reid
  • The Promise of Living: America goes to the opera
  • Earth Day concert to benefit Citizens Climate Lobby
  • Concerts showcasing Canadian and Mexican music and artists
  • Annual concerts for Black History Month, Woman's Day, LGTBQ Pride, Veteran's Day, and World AIDS Day
  • Annual Messiah sing-a-long
  • European tours of existing Amici Arts productions

Amici Arts is committed to making a better world through music. The Song for Life program raises funding and awareness for international charitable organizations. The Amici Academy provides quality performing arts training to performers of all ages and skill levels ensuring that the next generation of performing artists has the necessary tools to succeed. Future Amici Academy programs include

  • The Musical Theater Forum offering Broadway-influenced training
  • Berlin- based Young Artist Program offering affordable training for North American artists interested in a career in Europe

 

Be a part of the magic!

With our production of Glory Denied Amici Arts is on the road to international success. Please join us on the adventure by contributing and sharing today. You’ll receive our gratitude and the satisfaction of knowing you were involved in the creation of something magical.

Amici Arts thanks you for your support. We look forward to seeing you at a Amici Arts performance soon.

 

Greetings from Berlin!

Charles Elliott

Executive Artistic Director and Co-Founder, Amici Arts Ltd.

www.amiciarts.com

story:
WHY I MUST DO IT!

I am a singer-songwriter and the piano is my instrument. My songs are varied in style, sort of a travelogue of the places I've lived. Songwriting and performing give me a place to put my passion and a way to make sense of myself.

Music reorganizes my nervous system and reconnects me to my source. I feel deeply encouraged when listeners tell me that they can relate to what I'm expressing. My fondest wish is to continue my art  as a catharsis, a spell, a prayer, and an emotional bridge to those who feel a kinship with my songs. Your participation in my campaign is the foundation of that bridge, a dream that I have been working towards all of my life.

HOW I MUST DO IT!

This campaign is about making an album of my original material; I reduced the budget by choosing not to create a physical CD. I love vinyl, CD’s, and cassettes and I still buy used copies, but with so many music streaming organizations, there is no need to create more plastic products.

I arrived at the budget for my campaign ($29,600) based on the cost to record No Fumare. This estimate includes studio costs, musicians’ fees, copyright and licensing fees for eleven original songs, plus legal advice, design, promotions, and the money I borrowed to make the music video.

I have already started writing the script for my second music video, so if there’s any money left over after making the album, I would like to start production on the video. I am still amazed by how the first one came together; I had no previous experience, so the extraordinary talent and dedication of the actors and support persons was indispensable. Making the video was one of the most challenging and exciting things I’ve ever done.

WHY YOU MIGHT DO IT!

I have been told that crowdfunding must be done in a certain way, starting with my appearance in a video “pitching” my appeal for support. What I planned all along and what feels much more rich to me is to use my music video for this purpose. My pitch is about my desire to inject more magic, love, and emotional depth into this precious world of ours, and the music video illustrates my version of that. I am hoping that the inclusion of the song and video also serves as an indication of my capabilities, and my commitment to my vision.

If you like what you see, read, and hear on this page, please support me in the way that feels best to you...donating, sharing, and/or following my progress. If you've made it this far, thank you for granting me the most valuable thing you own...your time.

story:
Hello friends, it feels like it’s been a long time coming and I am so excited to say that I have recorded my debut worship album, titled "You Hem Me In." This journey of music-making started as a personal exploration of creative expression over 20 years ago, which led to many written songs that made their way onto recordings, but I never felt courageous enough to share my worship songs in such a format.

About 3 years ago, the tides turned and I was ready to launch into the recording process of a worship album with all my resources; however, the Lord had a different timing on that plan and for good reason, as I did not write the title track until last winter, even though I knew my collection of songs was missing this work. I wanted to be faithful in the gift of bravery he had given me. This song in particular became the message that encompassed what the Father had been doing faithfully in me over the years, but it took a particular season of being in the fire for me to write it. Now, I can sing this song and release this album knowing right to the core that He is hemming me in: He goes before me, behind me, above and below and fights for me with such delight in his eyes. His love and defense is inescapable, impenetrable, and unwavering, regardless of our experience in the natural.

So, here we are in the present having spent the last 6 months using our limited but available resources of time, talent, finances and courage to breathe life into these recordings, and have come so close to the finish line. Here is where you get to sow and join in the conception of this passion project. There are a few expenses related to releasing album which I need your
help with to carry me to the finish line. 

  • Professional Mastering, to make the mixes sound their best. I have chosen a mastering engineer who has worked on many of my favourite contemporary Christian albums.
  • Professional Reproduction, so that the CDs you listen to this music on will be of the highest quality, and that the album art can look as good as we can make it.
  • Support with tour expenses, so we can lay out the funds to make sure our BC tour goals are achievable, and launch the album with suitable fanfare wherever we have community.

Thanks again for your support! And if you want to support but can't afford to be a patron now, please share the campaign through social media.

story:
Meet Tim, Joseph and Michael:

We are a trio - saxophone, bass and drums, who've been playing together as a group for about two years, but have known each other for decades.  Have a look at the video to see what we do.  We were attracted to the song, Ahab Makan, while preparing for our trip to Sudan. We decided to play it to show the process of a familiar melody being transformed by jazz improvisation.  It was met with enthusiasm by Sudanese audiences - and our friends at the US Embassy, who had invited us to Khartoum, suggested we film a recording of the song.  We asked if they could hook us up with some Sudanese musicians to participate - and before we knew it, we were laughing, playing and eating all over Khartoum with a brilliant director, dancers, musicians and a drone camera operator.

Meet Mai Khidir:

Mai Khidir was born in Sudan, pursued higher education in the UK, and is now back in Khartoum, running the organization she founded - Al Sudaniya Mentoring.  ASM's mission is to empower women by giving them access to mentors with expertise in the fields in which they want to pursue dreams. ASM describes it's key values as Excellence, Passion and Commitment, which dovetail perfectly with our group's idea of what it takes to play jazz. 

You can have a look at their website to find out more about what they do at:

http://alsudaniyamentoring.org/

 

Help Create a CD and support ASM simultaneously!

I have been feeling the desire to reach beyond simply creating and selling CDs over the last year, and meeting Mai inspired me to look for a way to let the music create waves that are not only musical.....

to that end:

  • We will donate 15% of all of the money we generate with the campaign to Al Sudaniya Mentoring.  Our goal is to donate $1500 dollars to ASM.
  • We will also offer an option for supporters to contribute directly to Mai's group in addition to the money collected for the production of the CD.

 

If We're able to raise $10,000:

  • $500 goes to Indiegogo, $1500 goes to Al Sudaniya Mentoring
  • $4000 goes to recording costs, including salary, recording studio and engineer
  • $1000 to hire an artist to make us a custom album design
  • $1200 to print the first 1000 hard copies of the CD
  • The remaining $1800 will be used for promotional materials, including a new video, ads and a radio campaign in coordination with the CD release

The Impact

You can participate along with us in an act of cultural diplomacy.  The idea behind sending jazz groups to countries around the world is to create experiences of real people working across cultures to make something beautiful together.  On top of that, you can also multiply the effect of Mai's project.  By supporting the mentoring of Sudanese women with dreams, you can help them move a step closer to bringing their ideas to the world.  And you'll have our music to provide the soundtrack to feeling good about all of that!!

Your options:

We will offer a variety of levels of support, each with it's own set of rewards, (in addition to knowing that you're supporting a great cause.)

  • Download of the music - fastest way to get the music
  • Download plus an additional donation to Al Sudaniya Mentoring - in this case we donate to ASM, and so do you....
  • Hard copy of the CD
  • Hard copy plus additional donation to Al Sudaniya Mentoring
  • Signed Copy of the CD
  • Signed copy plus additional donation to Al Sudaniya Mentoring
  • Co-Producer and Executive Producer credits in the liner notes

If you don't feel like you can help financially right now:

  • Feel free to spread the word about this campaign and about ASM
  • Indiegogo makes it easy - just hit the share buttons

story:
Short Summary

I have put my heart into these songs. Honestly, I don't know any other way to write songs. I take pride in saying that I write and produce my own music not because I get to boast about it but because if you are supporting my music and lyrics, I know I'm not the only one who feels the pain and questions of the world.

I Hate This

Asking people for money is the hardest thing in the world for me to do. I rather just create music and not have to deal with the business side of everything. But I believe that people need to hear these songs. Funding this is not only to get my music into your hands but you're supporting a dream that has been in my heart since I fell in love with music when I was 13. I have always waited for the day when I can share my music in the form of an EP, or rather a full on concept, to the world

  • Funding will help cover these expenses of Mixing, Mastering, and Costs of perks.
  • It will get my music into your hands with out a third-party that don't really pay artists anything
  • The perks will allow my name to get out as an artist when it comes to shirts/stickers that you rock

The Dream

No fancy studio. Just a shed in my best friends backyard (known as Threebyfive Records lol), my dorm room, my parents house, and a boy with a dream. All I want to do is create art that First, speaks to me and Secondly, art that speaks what words can't. I hope these songs become your songs as well. An anthem for the hurting, broken, confused, and for the dreamers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for even reading this. Thank you so much for being interested in anything I have to say. It's so crazy to think that anyone would ever want to listen to me. But here we are. Thank you. If you wan't to donate to me personally, please don't hesitate to email me or just contribute more on this site. aramirezjrmusic@gmail.com

  • Any amount of money would be amazing!
  • Help, me spread the word and SHARE!
  • I can't wait for you to hear these songs!

story:
First Just Listen

How did the Tubes come into being?

I'm the inventor of the JumpDrum,  an innovative percussion instrument that's also an exercise. But it's large, almost 8' tall and made of solid Baltic Birch plywood. I'd been getting many calls for a "kids" version of the JumpDrum when I came across theses amazing sounding PVC tubes. 

"These are perfect for kids," I thought. "Colorful, light, wonderful sound. But how do I attach them to the JumpDrum?"

First I came up with the frame using oak dowels and thin aluminum bars, but attaching it to the Thumper required the use of the Tripod support (used on the JumpDrum) which was a heavy and long piece of aluminum tubing. Definitely not for kids!

And then, while attempting to support the JumpDrum without the tripod, I accidentally invented the "simple stand" which has not only made the Tubes possible, but also simplified the design of the JumpDrum (available on the JumpDrum.com website if your interested--this campaign is about the TUBES, however).

JumpDrum TUBES on Simple Stand

And then I realized that I could put wooden dowels in place of PVC tubes. And then I tried aluminum tubes. And then even cardboard shipping tubes!  And they all worked...but I was still limited by the width of the frame. If a tube or dowel was wider than the frame, they banged against it when hit...until I came up with the patent pending "pull forward" design!

Now, although the frame is 26" wide, you can put any length dowel or tube in the hold, activate the pull forward bungies, and voila, your sound is pure!

Is it for kids or adults? For Professionals or beginners?

It's both for both questions!

  • For kids, we recommend the basic Tubes or the Tubes + Thumper. The Tubes are lighter and the sound is mellower than the dowels or chimes.
  • For Adults who are beginning percussionists we recommend the basic Tubes.
  • For Adults who frequent drum circles we recommend the dowels. Tubes would need amplification in such a setting.
  • For Adults who want to get a workout while they play, we recommend Dowels + Thumper.
  • For percussionist, we recommend the whole package, Tubes, Dowels, Chimes +Thumper. 

 

What's that box he's standing on?

The THUMPER is JumpDrum's proprietary bass drum. You play by marching, dancing or bouncing atop. The actuator located on the right underside of the spring platform activated the drum pedal when the user leans, marches, or bounces on that side. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I've designed the Tubes as a user friendly device in the sense that no matter what we sell I know that people will experiment with their own materials. But it must ship with some sound generators, and I feel the PVC tubes are the best choice. They have a rich tonal sound which can be changed by simply adding or removing the end cap. They are light & colorful. It's a win/win for kids, adults, percussionist, or just hobbyists. But the PVC tubes are the one part we need to import. We need to place a large order to keep our price low. And the more we sell, the more we can pass on our discount to you the buyer.

  • We are already in production building frames and simple stands. 
  • We have distributors in place for Hardwood (Maple, Walnut, Birch) dowels.
  • We just need pre-orders to ensure we can move the large quantity of tubes we need to purchase.

Benefits

Rhythm is the fasted way to raise your vibration. People are sitting down way to much these days. Our whole product line is about standing up and moving. Our intention is to wake people up to their true nature and potential!

"A growing body of research shows that drumming has a positive effect on Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, depression, PTSD, and more." 

Dale Eisinger, The Daily Beast

  • Even without the Thumper base, standing up and drumming is a workout.
  • People are getting fit with the JumpDrum, this is your chance to experience the same benefits at a lower cost. 
  • Kids are drawn to drums, but traditional drums are too loud. The Tubes have a mellow tone that kids and adults will love!

"Drumming Places One in the Present Moment"

"Drumming helps alleviate stress that is created from hanging on to the past or worrying about the future. When one plays a drum, one is placed squarely in the here and now."

Michael Drake, About Religion

What's so simple about the Simple Stand?

The great thing about the simple stand is that it's just a few piece of loose wood. But you screw them together, and then slip other pieces over and . . . well it's easier just to see a picture of the parts:

becomes this:

​What about the Thumper. How does it work?

Note: The video below was made for the JumpDrum and I'm standing on a Standard Thumper. We are offering the Thumper mini in this campaign, but it functions the same. Instead of 24"x24" the mini is 24"x16". 

 

Dowel, Chime, & Tube Pitches

On some of the videos I played 2" thick dowels cut to different lengths, on others I used 1.25" dowels. It's also possible to use dowels of the same length but different diameter--as with the chimes. The tubes come with a cap that raises the octave, so one length can represent two separate octaves. We aim to eventually offer custom pitches for all three variations of the instrument, however, at this time, we are including just the pitches deemed most effective for each sound generator by inventor/composer David De Palo. R&D is ongoing on this front.

As of the moment we launch, the pitches of the Tubes are Bb, Eb, G, Bb, Eb. The 1.25" dowels are F#,E,G,D,F#, and the Chimes are G#,A,C,E,G nat. However, all pitches are subject to change. We will notify you if/when we have options for you to choose from.

~~~
 

Risks & Challenges

All of our instruments are handcrafted in Connecticut, USA. We are a small operation, but our process is easily scalable. With your pre-orders we can move into a larger facility. But setting up an efficient manufacturing facility is no small order.

  • Luckily, David is very adept at moving the shop and re-arranging equipment.
  • We already have the JumpDrum workshop pumping out thumpers. It won't be hard to expand into the TUBES.
  • If we don't reach our funding goal, we'll still be able to fulfill your orders, but our margin will be drastically reduced. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that I'm a percussion/rhythm fanatic and many of you aren't. But if you want to help us out there are many other options:

  • Buy a towel!
  • Help us get the word out. Share to all your friends. Mention this as a cool gift for the Holidays. Think of musician friends, fitness enthusiasts, hyperactive kids, and send them a link.
  • If you use the Indiegogo share tool, there will be no confusion about where to go to show your support.
  • Think positively about yourself. Change the way you look at the world. See the good and ignore the bad. Raise your vibration and share it with others!
  • If the Tubes are not your thing, remember, you can buy a JumpDrum from our website!

Measurements

(approximately)

On simple stand:

On Thumper mini:

For everything else, please like our facebook page or join our mailing list via our website: www.JumpDrum.com

story:
It’s About the Music. It’s About the Community

The music scene in Trenton is one of the most unique and interesting in the country. It has a diverse combination of influences including punk, hardcore, hip hop, folk, rock, electronic and experimental. These genres cross-over not only in the same venues but often with the same artists.

Analog Trenton is a recording project that will capture this unique sound as a snapshot in time. But we’re not talking about setting up a recorder in a bar and recording a band. 

The album will be recording on professional studio-quality, vintage reel-to-reel analog tape recorders (Tascam ATR-60 1” 16 track) and recording will take place in three locations:

  • Championship Bar: Oct 6th and 7th. We will be setting up a remote studio and recording up to ten bands during this weekend session. This session is open to the public and there is no cover.
  • Trenton Coffee House and Records: Nov 3rd. As part of Trenton Artwork’s Art All Day we will be setting of a remote studio for a day and recording smaller acts such as singer/songwriters. 
  • Dirty Old Robot Studio : Only 20 minutes outside of Trenton, we will use this fully analog facility to record those artists and bands that we are not able to fit into the remote dates. Recording has already started and will extend to the end of the year.

It’s about capturing a snapshot of something special

I had the good fortune to be right in the middle of the artistic explosions of Hoboken in the early 90s and, later that decade, NYC’s meat packing district. As it was happening we didn’t realize it was historic. We were living in run down apartment buildings and doing our thing. At the time these were not “nice” places to live.  There was very little archiving or documenting done because we thought it would always be there. We never imagined that the places we had jammed, painted, done theater and created art in would be replaced by posh condos and upscale clothing boutiques.

I was introduced to the Trenton music scene about a year into my passion project of building a professional quality analog recording studio (see below for more). One of the beauties of analog recoding is that it records what’s there. It’s real. It has a unique and alive sound that digital can’t quite duplicate. Using this studio and it’s gear to record a full album, right here right now, felt like the right thing to do.

I don’t know if Trenton will go the way of Hoboken, the East Village and the meat packing district — either way I think capturing what is here today will make a valuable cultural snapshot and archive.

It's about analog

Does analog sound better than digital? I won't argue the science here but to me it does sound better.

This project is going to do something that's become rare: We are staying 100% analog from microphone to vinyl. Nearly every song produced today is mixed digitally, even those reproduced to vinyl. There are many ways to manipulate and process audio using computers and it's faster and less expensive. Today's audiences have come to expect the seeming perfection that producers are able to create (or perhaps simulate) using digital tools. But in that processing often much of the soul and spirit of the music is lost. Not always, but often.

By keeping it wholly analog we will be capturing the truest sound possible. 

It's about analog... but we'll have digital versions as well

We know that all, perhaps most, of you do not spin vinyl all day (though do give a try. You might be surprised). We will record as many artists as we can and produce:

  • A hand-numbered limited edition vinyl LP.
  • A standard edition vinyl LP.
  • A compact disc.
  • Digital album

The vinyl album and CD will contain as many tracks as we can fit. The digital album will be the whole set of recordings. 

Limited Edition Album

The limited edition album (is really cool!) will differ from the standard album in these ways:

  • They will be gate-fold.
  • The inside surfaces will contain scans of autographed Polaroid photos that we will be taking during recording. At the collector level and above, you will also receive on of the actual Polaroids.
  • They will be hand-numbered. We will produce as many as needed up to 500. Once the first run is completed they will never be produced again.

How much does it cost to produce an album?

The estimated budget for this project is $12,000. That includes tape stock ($200 per reel), professional mastering, album pressing, CD duplication, printing, shipping and other expendables/consumables. 

Everyone working on this project is a volunteer and 100% of any raised funds are going directly into the production of the album.

We’ve already raised $8,000 privately. We expect to receive $1,000 in sponsorships which leaves $5,000 left to raise.

About Dirty Old Robot Studio

About two years ago I decided to build an analog recording studio. The two year anniversary of this decision (very coincidentally) falls on the day this campaign ends — the day after Thanksgiving. On that day I began the journey of acquiring, repairing and learning how to maintain and operate a fully functional magnetic tape based recording studio. It’s been a long ride with a lot of ups and downs but mostly ups.

For additional information and some photos of the studio (in-progress always) visit http://billnobes.com/#studio.

More Information

Please visit our site for more information: http://analogtrenton.com
