story:
Short Summary

Hi, if you got to this page maybe you already know my name or have heard my music, but if you have not, here a brief summary: Pianist and composer from Argentina based in New York, I have been in search of a personal blend of Argentine tango and folk with jazz, classical and other herbs for the past 35 years, recorded 10 albums as a leader and many more as arranger, producer and pianist. Have worked with Paquito D'Rivera, Arturo O'Farrill, Edmar Castañeda, and many more latin jazz greats. If credentials are good enough, please read on.

 

 

In 2014, tired of knocking on labels doors to record my 9-piece ensemble, La Inestable de Brooklyn, I decided to launch a fundraiser for the first time. We collected $11,000 in 30 days, which allowed me to record, mix, pay musicians, art cover, CD fabrication, release, etc and we launched Second Half  with no record label, and got a Grammy nomination as Best Latin Jazz Album! 

 

 

Now, the industry is in even worst shape than four years ago, and I had this absurd idea to create a Tango Jazz Orchestra, a 17-piece ensemble with the structure of a usual jazz big band, but replacing the guitar for a bandoneon. I spent much of 2018 writing, rehearsing and performing with this band in NY, and it is time to get us into the studio. The expenses are huge as you can guess, I need around $30,000 to pay for recording, mixing, mastering, musicians, art cover, pics, video, press release, CD making, and a good list of etceteras. I know, the fact that I am crazy is not your problem! :) But if you can, I encourage you to check my music and see how you can be a part of this huge effort. Perks are hilarious and I hope also tempting, you can have the new album and many of my older ones, a private concert at your house, or a fake Messi autograph! 

And if you are wealthy and can make a big contribution, please DO. YOU CAN MAKE A HUGE DIFFERENCE! And I swear on my own health that every single dime will go to pay for the album expenses, I get zero dollars out of all this. $1,000 might be a lot for most of us musicians, but if life and business have been generous with you and you can and want, please do not hesitate and hit us big. Your name will be carved in this piece and I will be forever grateful (hey, I am also forever grateful if you chip in $10, mind you!) And regardless of your support, please spread the word among your friends and family, that can go a long, long way! (please use the Indiegogo share tools to that end if possible).

If I still have not convinced you, maybe the Tango Jazz Orchestra lineup will do the job, as it brings together some of the strongest and most personal jazz players in New York these days:

 

 

The Tango Jazz Orchestra

Reeds: Alejandro Aviles, Todd Bashore, Tim Armacost, Jon Irabagon, Terry Goss

Trumpets: Alex Norris, Jim Seeley, John Bailey, David Neves

Trombones: Noah Bless, Mike Fahie, Eric Miller, James Rodgers

Piano/Composer: Emilio Solla

Bandoneon: Julien Labro

Bass: Pablo Aslan

Drums: Ferenc Nemeth

 

Music will not cure the world. But we believe that true music, true art which only obeys the voice of inspiration and personal search, creates an energy that might help make it a slightly better place.

Thanks a lot for being a part of this album! 

I promise we will deliver something that will make you feel! 

Emilio Solla

"Nothing is more powerful than an idea whose time has come".   Victor Hugo
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi, if you got to this page maybe you already know my name or have heard my music, but if you have not, here a brief summary: Pianist and composer from Argentina based in New York, I have been in search of a personal blend of Argentine tango and folk with jazz, classical and other herbs for the past 35 years, recorded 10 albums as a leader and many more as arranger, producer and pianist. Have worked with Paquito D'Rivera, Arturo O'Farrill, Edmar Castañeda, and many more latin jazz greats. If credentials are good enough, please read on.
 

 
In 2014, tired of knocking on labels doors to record my 9-piece ensemble, La Inestable de Brooklyn, I decided to launch a fundraiser for the first time. We collected $11,000 in 30 days, which allowed me to record, mix, pay musicians, art cover, CD fabrication, release, etc and we launched Second Half  with no record label, and got a Grammy nomination as Best Latin Jazz Album! 
 

 
Now, the industry is in even worst shape than four years ago, and I had this absurd idea to create a Tango Jazz Orchestra, a 17-piece ensemble with the structure of a usual jazz big band, but replacing the guitar for a bandoneon. I spent much of 2018 writing, rehearsing and performing with this band in NY, and it is time to get us into the studio. The expenses are huge as you can guess, I need around $30,000 to pay for recording, mixing, mastering, musicians, art cover, pics, video, press release, CD making, and a good list of etceteras. I know, the fact that I am crazy is not your problem! :) But if you can, I encourage you to check my music and see how you can be a part of this huge effort. Perks are hilarious and I hope also tempting, you can have the new album and many of my older ones, a private concert at your house, or a fake Messi autograph! 
And if you are wealthy and can make a big contribution, please DO. YOU CAN MAKE A HUGE DIFFERENCE! And I swear on my own health that every single dime will go to pay for the album expenses, I get zero dollars out of all this. $1,000 might be a lot for most of us musicians, but if life and business have been generous with you and you can and want, please do not hesitate and hit us big. Your name will be carved in this piece and I will be forever grateful (hey, I am also forever grateful if you chip in $10, mind you!) And regardless of your support, please spread the word among your friends and family, that can go a long, long way! (please use the Indiegogo share tools to that end if possible).
If I still have not convinced you, maybe the Tango Jazz Orchestra lineup will do the job, as it brings together some of the strongest and most personal jazz players in New York these days:
 


 

The Tango Jazz Orchestra
Reeds: Alejandro Aviles, Todd Bashore, Tim Armacost, Jon Irabagon, Terry Goss
Trumpets: Alex Norris, Jim Seeley, John Bailey, David Neves
Trombones: Noah Bless, Mike Fahie, Eric Miller, James Rodgers
Piano/Composer: Emilio Solla
Bandoneon: Julien Labro
Bass: Pablo Aslan
Drums: Ferenc Nemeth

 
Music will not cure the world. But we believe that true music, true art which only obeys the voice of inspiration and personal search, creates an energy that might help make it a slightly better place.

Thanks a lot for being a part of this album! 
I promise we will deliver something that will make you feel! 
Emilio Solla
"Nothing is more powerful than an idea whose time has come".   Victor Hugo

story:
This industry of independent artists is growing by leaps and bounds and I am going to help make their struggles a little easier.  

How? The majority of these artists can not afford to pay an extra person to go on tour with them to handle their everyday needs or issues. There is so much more to a tour than getting to a gig, setting up, singing, then going home. There is finding safe places to stay in the middle of nowhere, finding an open eatery, having a flat tire, needing medicine or medical attention, broken equipment, broken strings, and the list goes on and on. I will provide 24/7 access to concierge services at an affordable rate.  

Why do I need your assistance? Marketing and small office equipment. Heavy marketing will be required for this project to be successful for all of us. I have quite a few connections but this has to be presented to them professionally and in order to accomplish that, there will be a need for a multitude of professional design and printing, mail, and computer costs involved.

 

Last but not least, I hope you will all join me in making Life On The Road a little smoother for our independent artists and to help save the music we love from becoming extinct.

story:
Introducing Johnny & The Mongrels

A tour de force of veteran musicians collaborating to create an original sound that appeals to ears and hearts from all walks of life.

Fronted by Lead vocalist Johnny Ryan & Bassist Jeff Bostic, the project will also be backed and co-produced by Scott Sharrard, former lead guitarist and musical director for the late Gregg Allman,  In addition to the core of Ryan, Bostic and Sharrard, a who's who of incredible guest musicians will be part of this project; most of which will be announced very soon. Two that can be revealed now is one of the most sought-after New Orleans groove keepers in the business, New Orleans Suspects & former Jon Cleary drummer, Eddie Christmas. The Uptown native, will be "bringin' that thang" like only he can bring on the drums.  Secondly, on keys, Bill McKay joins the project with his legendary right hand and extensive experience with acts such as The Derek Trucks Band, Leftover Salmon, Band Du Jour & Coral Creek just to name a few.  Consequently, Johnny & The Mongrels is a special collaboration that defies musical boundaries to organically produce some of the most notable new music 2020 will have to offer.

Both fate and instincts originally led Johnny Ryan to collaborate with Jeff Bostic. Aside from both musicians growing to appreciate each others individual projects over a 5 year period, Johnny Ryan and Jeff Bostic legitimately connected at an impromptu blues jam in 2015. Playing together where neither had the inherent pressure of being the leader of the show, allowed them to relate on a different level away from the hustle and bustle of their usual working musician lives and they found a common ground of interest and excitement for the future. And the rest is "Mongrels History!"

From there, recognition and admiration for the duo prompted Snapped On The River Music's own Joe Michaels, to introduce himself and offer to produce this project.  And with the addition of revered, industry-wide recognizable musicians like Scott Sharrard, Eddie Christmas, Bill McKay and those still to be named, some would say it would be down right foolish to miss out on bragging you had a hand in bringing this project to life!

Johnny notes that the end product of Johnny & The Mongrels' 1st full length album has no preconceived sound because that would limit the possibilities. Both Johnny, Bostic and Sharrard brought songs to the table from writing sessions they had in New York City. And more often than not, one would start making noise, another would riff off of it, while another created lyrics and songs would be born. All the artists involved took to the studio with a "see what happens" mentality and thusly created "a project even mama would be proud of" according to Johnny.

Prestige and prowess of the artists aside, the music of Johnny & The Mongrels speaks for itself. This eclectic group of players is eager to see where the project takes them and to get the music heard by as many people as possible. Johnny & The Mongrels has become a truly organic collaboration with the music taking form out of what feels natural and evolving into an honest, feel-good collection of songs.

Meet The Band

Johnny Ryan

Johnny's been immersed in professional music virtually all of his life, even as a small boy, due to the fact that the majority of his family has always been involved in the professional music industry.

He started out at the age of 7 and could be seen performing with his families various professional projects, wowing the audience with "beyond his years" tone and presence.

Since 1999, Johnny has been immersed in several live performance projects in the local Colorado music scene. Johnny has had the privilege of sharing stages with notable artists such as Kid Rock, .38 Special, The Doobie Brothers, George Porter Jr., Ivan Neville, Samantha Fish, Aaron Wilkinson & Chris Spies (Honey Island Swamp Band), Bob Malone, Bobby Messano, Deanna Bogart, Bill McKay, Donna The Buffalo & The Peterson Brothers, just to name a few.

Since 2003, Johnny has been entrenched with his musical brainchild, Johnny & The Mongrels, whose down and dirty New Orleans infused swamp funk & bayou soul has become a staple in the Colorado festival & venue circuit.

Jeff Bostic

Musical inspiration wasn’t far from home for Jeff. He was born in Chicago but grew up west of Minneapolis, and since his dad was an accomplished guitar and piano player, Jeff was raised as more than just a die-hard Vikings fan. Starting piano and violin lessons at the age of 4, music was always around, whether strumming a guitar with his dad or a vocal group at school.

Sadly, at 15, Jeff took the unfortunate passing of his dad as inspiration to carry the torch, and he used that motivation to further dedicate himself. At 18, while on tour in Europe with his college choir group, he was asked if he wanted to try bass. It became his instrument of choice, enabling him access to the grooves & funk chops of his favorites, Stevie Wonder, Stanley Clarke, Marcus Miller, Victor Wooten & more.

In 2001, he ventured to Colorado with Blues is Blood, and quickly acclimated to the music scene, playing bass, keyboards and singing with numerous bands, artists and studio sessions. His resume includes blues, classic rock, pop and R&B and opening opportunities with such artists as Buddy Guy, Taj Mahal, Gavin Degraw, George Porter Jr., Ivan Neville, Samantha Fish, and more. His strong contributions of songwriting, vocals, music direction and thunderin’ bottom end grooves are the anchor of Johnny & The Mongrels.

Scott Sharrard

Scott Sharrard is best know as lead guitarist and musical director for the late Gregg Allman. But his personal artistic journey - which includes singing, songwriting, producing and arranging, began long before he first teamed up with the rock icon. He was born in Michigan on December 28, 1976 and spent his formative years in Milwaukee, where he was a club fixture long before he could legally take a drink. Sharrard has had the privilege of working with many legends over his career beginning with Mel Rhyne, Buddy Miles, Hubert Sumlin, Luther Allison, Clyde Stubblefield, Stokes, Willie Higgins, Willie "Big Eyes" Smith and Pinetop Perkins. Then later in his career, working with  Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame inductees like Levon Helm & the aforementioned Gregg Allman. 

Scott has lived in New York City since 1996 where his journey with not only Gregg Allman began but also where he met iconic Atlantic Records executive Ahmet Ertegun, who for the course of 3 albums, mentored The Chesterfields, the band Sharrard joined with his friend Sean Dixon. From there the young guitarist began to chart his own course.  A series of releases followed, including "Dawnbreaker" (2005), "Analog/Monolog" (2008), "Ante Up" (2009) and his latest project "Saving Grace" (2018), which took place in Memphis and at the historic FAME Studios in Muscle Shoals, Alabama. Half the album employs the Hi Rhythm Section, the other The Swampers of Muscle Shoals. 

All of these incredible experiences have wrought accolades and recognition for Scott in the music industry including grammy nominations and countless offers to join storied projects....Thankfully, this time, Johnny & The Mongrels are part of that storied history now.

Eddie Christmas

Eddie Christmas who is known in the drum community as well by his peers as “Christmas”. Christmas was born May 19, 1980 in New Orleans, LA home of some the funkiest drummers today. Eddie started playing drums in church at the age of 6 where he was under the guidance of Craig and Tom Washington. They were some of the most talented musicians on the gospel scene. Eddie was blessed to have musicians that took him under their wings to guide him and enhance his talents.

His first performance was on Frenchman Street at the age of 9 years old with a quartet by the name of the Friendly Traveler. He performed with this group every Sunday night. Eddie attended Andrew J. Bell middle school where he studied and started his career as a percussionist under the direction of Donald “Meat Head” Richardson. Eddie was the drum section leader in his 7th and 8th grade years in middle school. Eddie attended John F. Kennedy high school where he joined the concert band and marching band. He later went on to win numerous trophies in parades, competitions and more.

After graduating high school Eddie focused on playing gigs in and out of church. Eddie is known for his Fatt Pocket and Back Beat sound. When asked by his peers or fellow musicians to describe his unique sound he says until you had gumbo it’s hard to say. Over his musical journey Eddie has played and shared the stage with several talented artists in his career. He has played with Gerald Levert, Chris Robinson, The Black Crowes, Sting, Marva Wright, Big Chief Bo Dollis, June Yamagishi, Leo Neo Neocentilli, Shane Theriot, Henry Butler, Big Sams Funky Nation, Good Enough for Good Times, Brian Coogan Band, Krik Joseph, The Pentones, Big Al Carson, Dirty Dozen Brass Band, Tab Benoit, Jon Cleary & The Absolute Monster Gents, Billy Iuso, George Porter, New Orleans Suspects and his side project Funk Monkey. Eddie is currently touring with New Orleans Suspects when he is not touring You catch Eddie around town in Nola playing the funky pirate bar with The Pentones on bourbon st or BIRN and Funky Monkey playing Frenchman st and other venues.

Eddie has traveled the world touring all over the country. Eddie has masters of music percussion He teaches classes for kids which helps develop musical and fundamental skills in order to become great musicians and percussionist. He is very thankful for an amazing career God has blessed him with. He is looking forward to this opportunity to share his love thru his music. 

Bill McKay

Bill McKay began his musical journey at the age of six, taking classical piano lessons and singing in a church choir as a boy soprano. In high school, he studied jazz theory and ear training, and sang in the choir and barbershop group, touring in England, Wales, and Amsterdam. Bill began playing rock and roll in bars and clubs at the age of 16 with various bands.
       Moving to Colorado in 1987 to attend Colorado College, Bill played with the band The Circle while studying world music ( including East Indian, African, and Native American music ). He also worked with the dance department, accompanying modern dance classes and composing a thesis around choreography and music. After graduating in 1991 with a political science degree, Bill moved to Boulder and began playing with Band Du Jour
     The Soul 'n Roll outfit Band Du Jour recorded and toured extensively from 1990-1995, including a two month DOD tour to South Korea, Japan, and Okinawa. Band Du Jour was a Colorado favorite, and shared the stage with many of the great bands of the early 90s, including The Aquarium Rescue Unit, Blues Traveler, The Samples, Phish, Big Head Todd.
     In 1995, Bill joined the Derek Trucks Band as lead singer and keyboardist. Living in Atlanta, he toured and recorded with Derek for 5 years, sharing the stage with greats such as Gregg Allman, Col. Bruce Hampton, Warren Haynes and Gov't Mule, Phil Lesh, and many others. 
    Returning to Colorado in 2000, Bill joined Leftover Salmon, recording, touring, and performing with them for the next 10 years. During this time, he also created his own band, Bill McKay Band, pursued many opportunities to play solo piano, and recorded and performed all over the musical map, with too many wonderful musicians to list here!
    Throughout his entire life and career, Bill and his brother John have recorded, toured, and performed as the McKay Brothers. This is a special and meaningful project that showcases the brilliant songwriting of John McKay, as well as Bill's originals and a vast assortment of blues, folk and country music.
     These days, in addition to Bill McKay Band, McKay Brothers, and multiple freelance projects, Bill plays solo piano, and regular gigs with the True Blue Band and Brother's Keeper. Proud to be a part of the Colorado music scene for 25 years, Bill McKay keeps moving forward in his pursuit of musical adventure!
Bill has recently begun working with Chris Thompson's longstanding musical project Coral Creek. in addition to performing and recording with this killer jamgrass outfit, Coral Creek Music offers opportunities for promotion and distribution of Bills new recordings; Which will now also include his much anticipated stint with Johnny & The Mongrels!

Meet The Team

Joe Michaels

Joe Michaels has been working in the Music industry since 1969. Most of his career has been spent as a live sound engineer working with iconic bands including Rolling Stones, Blood Sweat and Tears, Larry Graham, James Brown, and the Kinks. Later in life, he moved into the studio producing records. Joe started Snapped on the River Music in 2003 when he started his studio work. Since it's inception, his clients have included Ivan Neville, Shaun Murphy, Bobby Messano, Bob Malone, Deanna Bogart and many more. "I produced Blues Blast Magazines "Best Contemporary CD of 2012" for Shaun Murphy. My collaboration and production on Deanna Bogart's cover of Sly Stone's "Hot Fun in the Summertime" was named one of USA Today's "Top Ten Songs of Summer."
Michaels specializes in working with established musicians who have been doing the same music for a long time. "I take them out of their comfort zone, often putting them with other players they have never worked with and give them a new direction. The result is always something new and different and often their best work in years if not their career."

On May 18th of this year, Joe Michaels celebrated his 50th year in music with a great concert thrown for him by many of the artists he's have worked for over his career.

Jim Mimna

Jim Mimna is a freelance photographer/videographer based near Denver, CO. He shoots a wide variety of subject matter like nature & wildlife, landscapes & remote location portrait work but his specialty is in concert photography/videography and band portraits. He has captured the images of some of the most influential, iconic artists of our time. From U2, Tom Petty & Neil Young to Widespread Panic, The Black Keys & Lorde just to scratch the surface. Mimna has established himself as the go-to photographer in an industry that has a truckload of qualified options. His incredible eye will be a crucial cog in the wheel of this campaign. Having unfortgettable images and video will inspire and document the passion and excitement of this project for years to come.

Help us bring this incredible project to the world!

  • Launching a project like this is quite the endeavor. Getting time at the right studio, with the right musicians, engineers and producers is key to the vision and feel of the album. Additionally, the selection of where to mix and master the tracks (songs) once they're recorded, can make or break whether the project lands in the hands of the right label and management team. Lastly, we need video and promotional work to launch Johnny & The Mongrels into the world with the most momentum possible.

  • Contributors will have the opportunity to obtains CDs, t-shirts, photo books, and other cool swag as well as several "experience"-based perks such as getting a first-hand look at the mixing and mastering process. One lucky funder will get to curate a dream show as the band will perform a private gig and even get to introduce the band before they take the stage!

  • If we don't make our goal, your dollars will still go to securing time at the studio, mixing the album and promotion; the budget will just be adjusted down. If we bust over, we just have more time perfecting the mix!

The Impact

By acting as a contributor to this project, you are directly supporting bringing music created by some of the most gargantuan players in today's music scene to life.

Whether you have been following Jeff Bostic for the better part of 2 decades, were moved by heartfelt songs written by Johnny Ryan, or just now found out Scott Sharrard was the mastermind behind The Gregg Allman Band and Eddie Christmas was the groove keeper on one of your favorite albums, there is something for everyone in Johnny & The Mongrels.

The musical and professional standards of this project are set at the highest echelon and, in order to make sure this process is seen though 110%, we will need the help of our friends, family, and fans to chip in whatever they can to be present in this process. This music will not let you down and the band holds their fans and supporters in the highest regard and makes this music for YOU!

Risks & Challenges

The general public is often unaware of the time, energy and expenses that go into making a high-quality album. You need top-notch engineers, producers, management, labels, photographers/videographers, publicists, etc to utilize all resources and to make sure the project is the best-oiled machine on the market!

Here are an example of some of the expenses:

  • $10,000 - Recording at Dockside Studios & Mixing with Justin Tocket (Marc Broussard, Anders Osborne, Marcia Ball)
  • $2,000 - Mastering By Grammy-winning engineer David Glasser (Grateful Dead, Hot Tuna, Leftover Salmon) 
  • $10,000 - Two video shoots ($5,000 each)
  • $5,000 - Tour promotion.

It is also time-consuming and difficult to coordinate the schedules of all these full-time, working musicians who do nothing but eat, sleep, write, create, and breathe music, so the limited time Johnny & The Mongrels spend together needs to be spent wisely.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times can be tough and money can be tight, so even if you can't chip in $5, please share this campaign on all social media outlets and help us spread the word!

  • Please  use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page! They make it easy for you to help tell the world!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks so much from Johnny, Jeff, Scott and Joe

He is looking forward to this opportunity to share his love thru his music. Bill McKayBill McKay began his musical journey at the age of six, taking classical piano lessons and singing in a church choir as a boy soprano. In high school, he studied jazz theory and ear training, and sang in the choir and barbershop group, touring in England, Wales, and Amsterdam. Bill began playing rock and roll in bars and clubs at the age of 16 with various bands.       Moving to Colorado in 1987 to attend Colorado College, Bill played with the band The Circle while studying world music ( including East Indian, African, and Native American music ). He also worked with the dance department, accompanying modern dance classes and composing a thesis around choreography and music. After graduating in 1991 with a political science degree, Bill moved to Boulder and began playing with Band Du Jour     The Soul 'n Roll outfit Band Du Jour recorded and toured extensively from 1990-1995, including a two month DOD tour to South Korea, Japan, and Okinawa. Band Du Jour was a Colorado favorite, and shared the stage with many of the great bands of the early 90s, including The Aquarium Rescue Unit, Blues Traveler, The Samples, Phish, Big Head Todd.     In 1995, Bill joined the Derek Trucks Band as lead singer and keyboardist. Living in Atlanta, he toured and recorded with Derek for 5 years, sharing the stage with greats such as Gregg Allman, Col. Bruce Hampton, Warren Haynes and Gov't Mule, Phil Lesh, and many others.     Returning to Colorado in 2000, Bill joined Leftover Salmon, recording, touring, and performing with them for the next 10 years. During this time, he also created his own band, Bill McKay Band, pursued many opportunities to play solo piano, and recorded and performed all over the musical map, with too many wonderful musicians to list here!    Throughout his entire life and career, Bill and his brother John have recorded, toured, and performed as the McKay Brothers. This is a special and meaningful project that showcases the brilliant songwriting of John McKay, as well as Bill's originals and a vast assortment of blues, folk and country music.     These days, in addition to Bill McKay Band, McKay Brothers, and multiple freelance projects, Bill plays solo piano, and regular gigs with the True Blue Band and Brother's Keeper. Proud to be a part of the Colorado music scene for 25 years, Bill McKay keeps moving forward in his pursuit of musical adventure!Bill has recently begun working with Chris Thompson's longstanding musical project Coral Creek. in addition to performing and recording with this killer jamgrass outfit, Coral Creek Music offers opportunities for promotion and distribution of Bills new recordings; Which will now also include his much anticipated stint with Johnny & The Mongrels!Meet The TeamJoe MichaelsJoe Michaels has been working in the Music industry since 1969. Most of his career has been spent as a live sound engineer working with iconic bands including Rolling Stones, Blood Sweat and Tears, Larry Graham, James Brown, and the Kinks. Later in life, he moved into the studio producing records. Joe started Snapped on the River Music in 2003 when he started his studio work. Since it's inception, his clients have included Ivan Neville, Shaun Murphy, Bobby Messano, Bob Malone, Deanna Bogart and many more. "I produced Blues Blast Magazines "Best Contemporary CD of 2012" for Shaun Murphy. My collaboration and production on Deanna Bogart's cover of Sly Stone's "Hot Fun in the Summertime" was named one of USA Today's "Top Ten Songs of Summer."Michaels specializes in working with established musicians who have been doing the same music for a long time. "I take them out of their comfort zone, often putting them with other players they have never worked with and give them a new direction. The result is always something new and different and often their best work in years if not their career."On May 18th of this year, Joe Michaels celebrated his 50th year in music with a great concert thrown for him by many of the artists he's have worked for over his career.Jim MimnaJim Mimna is a freelance photographer/videographer based near Denver, CO. He shoots a wide variety of subject matter like nature & wildlife, landscapes & remote location portrait work but his specialty is in concert photography/videography and band portraits. He has captured the images of some of the most influential, iconic artists of our time. From U2, Tom Petty & Neil Young to Widespread Panic, The Black Keys & Lorde just to scratch the surface. Mimna has established himself as the go-to photographer in an industry that has a truckload of qualified options. His incredible eye will be a crucial cog in the wheel of this campaign. Having unfortgettable images and video will inspire and document the passion and excitement of this project for years to come.Help us bring this incredible project to the world!
Launching a project like this is quite the endeavor. Getting time at the right studio, with the right musicians, engineers and producers is key to the vision and feel of the album. Additionally, the selection of where to mix and master the tracks (songs) once they're recorded, can make or break whether the project lands in the hands of the right label and management team. Lastly, we need video and promotional work to launch Johnny & The Mongrels into the world with the most momentum possible.
Contributors will have the opportunity to obtains CDs, t-shirts, photo books, and other cool swag as well as several "experience"-based perks such as getting a first-hand look at the mixing and mastering process. One lucky funder will get to curate a dream show as the band will perform a private gig and even get to introduce the band before they take the stage!
If we don't make our goal, your dollars will still go to securing time at the studio, mixing the album and promotion; the budget will just be adjusted down. If we bust over, we just have more time perfecting the mix!
The ImpactBy acting as a contributor to this project, you are directly supporting bringing music created by some of the most gargantuan players in today's music scene to life.Whether you have been following Jeff Bostic for the better part of 2 decades, were moved by heartfelt songs written by Johnny Ryan, or just now found out Scott Sharrard was the mastermind behind The Gregg Allman Band and Eddie Christmas was the groove keeper on one of your favorite albums, there is something for everyone in Johnny & The Mongrels.The musical and professional standards of this project are set at the highest echelon and, in order to make sure this process is seen though 110%, we will need the help of our friends, family, and fans to chip in whatever they can to be present in this process. This music will not let you down and the band holds their fans and supporters in the highest regard and makes this music for YOU!Risks & ChallengesThe general public is often unaware of the time, energy and expenses that go into making a high-quality album. You need top-notch engineers, producers, management, labels, photographers/videographers, publicists, etc to utilize all resources and to make sure the project is the best-oiled machine on the market!Here are an example of some of the expenses:
$10,000 - Recording at Dockside Studios & Mixing with Justin Tocket (Marc Broussard, Anders Osborne, Marcia Ball)
$2,000 - Mastering By Grammy-winning engineer David Glasser (Grateful Dead, Hot Tuna, Leftover Salmon) 
$10,000 - Two video shoots ($5,000 each)
$5,000 - Tour promotion.
It is also time-consuming and difficult to coordinate the schedules of all these full-time, working musicians who do nothing but eat, sleep, write, create, and breathe music, so the limited time Johnny & The Mongrels spend together needs to be spent wisely.Other Ways You Can HelpWe know times can be tough and money can be tight, so even if you can't chip in $5, please share this campaign on all social media outlets and help us spread the word!Please  use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of this page! They make it easy for you to help tell the world!And that's all there is to it. Thanks so much from Johnny, Jeff, Scott and Joe

story:
About Leo Z

Leo Z is an artist/producer/composer currently based in Los Angeles. He is able to work in a wide range of styles but he always ensures that his work exemplifies music that is timeless and sonically genuine. His experience with large ensembles, including the London Philharmonic and the San Diego Symphony has imparted on Leo the relevant sensibility on all matters acoustic. Leo has had the good fortune to create music for and with artists such as Josh Groban, Elisa, Nathan Pacheco, Andrea Bocelli and Tina Guo, just to name a few.

About Materia Prima XIV

Materia Prima means "first matter" and originates in alchemy; a proto-science, alchemy is the medieval forerunner of chemistry, based on the supposed transformation of matter. In that sense, Materia Prima marks a return to what is essential for Leo Z, and that is the piano (the featured instrument of this project). The album will include fourteen tracks in total, twelve original songs and two covers and will also include a variety of video and other visual content. 

How Your Support Helps

All of the funds raised will be used in the creation and promotion of the album and your generous support of this project will allow Leo to complete the following aspects of the project: 

  • 6,000 benchmark - if this funding target is achieved, Leo will be able to record, mix, and master the album. He will also be able to hire a graphic designer to create the cover art and will be able to manufacture physical copies of the record. 
  • 11,000 benchmark - along with the above, if this funding target is achieved Leo will be able to create three performances based videos and cover all of the associated costs (film crew, editing, piano transportation, musicians etc.)
  • 14,000 benchmark - along with all of the above, if this funding target is achieved Leo will be able to create a special animated video for the project (a very important artistic aspect of the project for Leo). 
  • 16,000 benchmark - along with all of the above, if this funding target is achieved Leo will be able to allocate a portion of the project's budget for digital marketing to promote the record properly online and to make sure that the fans are aware of the new album
  • 20,000 benchmark - along with all of the above, if this funding target is achieved Leo will be able to create additional digital content and special behind-the-scenes features for the fans. 

All funds will be used to support the creation of this new album, even if the overall funding goal is not achieved. 

Perks Available 

A wide range of perks have been created for this project, including Skype concerts, house concerts, studio and mastering visits and a host of other items. If you have any questions about the campaign or the available perks, please email leozmusic@gmail.com

story:
NOW HEAR THIS!

Hi there! Jon Olejnik and Aaron Krings of the World Famous Glenn Miller Orchestra here! We've spent the year touring all over the USA- during down times we would often play together in a duo setting for fun. We quickly realized a great musical connection between us and decided to release a duo album to share this music with YOU!

We would love for you to join us in the process of making this album!

 

Get What You Give

There are many costs associated with putting an album together: recording, mixing, mastering, printing/distribution. This is where we need your help! Our heaviest financial weight is on mastering and printing/distribution. This album will be recorded on location while touring in Japan November 2019-December 2019 with the final product mastered by a 3rd party for the best possible quality. Any funds raised past the goal will be invested into providing the best album for YOU, our supporters! (3rd party mixing, album art, professional liner notes, higher-quality printing, etc.)

 

If we don't make our full goal? The album will still be released, but on a smaller scale. You will still receive the album as it was conceived by Jon and Aaron!

Perks range all the way from video shout-out and thank you on social media, to signed original scores, to a private 2-hour performance for you and your friends in the comfort of your own home!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the means to join us in this project, but even if you cannot afford to be a financial backer, you can still help us out in other ways!

  • Tell friends and family about the project and the album!
  • Share the campaign on your social media accounts to spread the word!

story:
Who am I?

Hello everyone,

My name is Gabriel Agudo and I am a musician known by my work as songwriter and singer in the World Progressive Rock scene . Two years ago I decided to work in my solo career  

In the meantime, I participate in parallel projects as one of the lead singers of Steve Rothery (Marillion) and In Continuum Band (ex Sound of Contact) in the strong belief to expand my musical horizons.

New Life is my first solo work and it marks a milestone in my career and life.

It represents my last inner journey ended in a new renaissance as person and solo artist. 


What will I do?

Together with you we I want to make another step forward releasing my own music.  

The music and the lyrics of my album are inspired by the resilience and the capacity to survive the deepest wounds in order to make a real transformation that really could change life

New Life is a 1 hour 10 minutes piece of music with long songs. Like a Symphony each song represents a movement marking the way to a New Life and love. 

The album has a final pearl. A special version of Genesis classic ¨ Suppers Ready ¨ played by an international team of musicians. 

For the album I team up with my friend Rene Bosc a prestigious and talented musician who comes from the classical music word. New Life also have very special guests to finally create a piece of art that is beyond what I created as yet.

You will enjoy of the talent of Steve Rothery (guitarist and founding member of Marillion), Clive Nolan (keyboardist of Pendragon and founding member of Arena), Dave Kerzner ( keyboardist and founding member of Sound of Contact / In Continuum band) Fernando Perdomo and Jan Vincent Velazco (drummer of Pendragon) and Helene Collerette (first violin of Radio France Symphony Orchestra) among others.

Help me to finish this album. This trip has only one destination: to touch people`s hearts and ignite a spark of peace in their souls.

Thanks for being part! 


How will we do this?

With your support I expected to finish the album first days of October, so I have enough time to manufacture and ship the album on time.  If you help me grow this seed, you will probably receive the album even before the official release.

The Album Cover is already done and I´m working in the CD design. I will also try to do a T-Shirt design limited edition.

We will ask the best professionals to master our tracks so they sound amazing on all devices that you can think of and make your ears sizzle.


What do I need the money for?

We got the instruments and the creative minds - so that's all set. But we DO need money for making the last recording sessions, artwork and mastering, then we need to press the CDs so my music can materialize. We need to spend some money in advertising this campaign and the release of the album so people can know about it. We need some money to ship all the perks to you that you want to hold in your hands and last but not least, Indiegogo and the handling of the payments eat up another 8 to 10% of the whole cake.

All in all we will need about 10.000 dollars to let this project happen. The more the better because you will help me to cover the costs. But to be honest - I will make happen the digital album anyway, cause this is what I do! :)

Always believe that giving and receiving will always be balanced.

In deep gratitude and relatedness,

Gabriel
